original: gang phan chad sdug bsngal med pa ste zhes bya ba ni gang skyes phan chad skye ba gzhan med pa'o //
analyzed: gang phan chad sdug bsngal med pa ste zhes bya ba ni gang skyes phan chad skye ba gzhan med pa'o //
translated: One who is beyond that is one who has no more suffering, that is, one who has no more rebirths after this one.

analyzed: de byed pa ni khams gsum pa'i nyon mongs can gyi chos ma lus pa dang bral ba skye bar byed pa ste /

original: de ni sdug bsngal gyi mtha' yin no //
analyzed: de ni sdug bsngal gyi mtha' yin no //

original: de nyid kyi phyir sdug bsngal @231a * //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir sdug bsngal @231a * //

analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa thob pa'i gegs ni nyon mongs pa'i thob pa yin te /

translated: ‚ÄúBecause it is indefinite‚Äù means that it is not definite that one who has fully ripened the continuum will become one who takes rebirth seven times at the most, and therefore it is not mentioned.

original: rnam gsum rnam bzhi las grol ba //
analyzed: rnam gsum rnam bzhi las grol ba //

translated: The S≈´tra master says:üîΩThe stream enterer who has abandoned three or four stages of the afflictions to be abandoned by the path of meditation is called a once returner.üîΩThe stream enterer who has abandoned three or four stages of the afflictions to be abandoned by the path of meditation is posited as a once returner ekavƒ´cika.

analyzed: 'di ni thams cad las dbang po rtul ba gang yin pa srid pa bdun du 'khor bar 'gyur ba'o //

original: de kho na bzhin du rung ste zhes bya bas ni ji skad mdo las 'byung ba bzhin du'o //
analyzed: de kho na bzhin du rung ste zhes bya bas ni ji skad mdo las 'byung ba bzhin du'o //
translated: as it is stated in the sutra.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /

original: ji ltar gtso bo bzhin sngar bstan pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: ji ltar gtso bo bzhin sngar bstan pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because it is taught first, as the principal one.

original: bar ma dor skyes nas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba bzhin no //
analyzed: bar ma dor skyes nas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba bzhin no //
translated: because it is like one who is born in the intermediate state and attains nirvana.

original: yang mngon par 'du byed pa dang bcas pa yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba bas mngon par 'du byed med par yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba gtso bo zhes bya ba 'di ji ltar shes she na /
analyzed: yang mngon par 'du byed pa dang bcas pa yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba bas mngon par 'du byed med par yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba gtso bo zhes bya ba 'di ji ltar shes she na /

original: de'i phyir lam dang gis 'byung ba dang lam ngang gis 'byung ba ma yin pa dag ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir lam dang gis 'byung ba dang lam ngang gis 'byung ba ma yin pa dag ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
translated: Therefore it says, ‚Äúbecause they are the paths that are and are not attained naturally,‚Äù and so on.

original: ngang gis 'byung bas na dang gis 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: ngang gis 'byung bas na dang gis 'byung ba ste /
translated: It is attained naturally because it is attained naturally.

original: lam gang zhig sngon goms pa'i khyad par las 'bad pa med pa 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: lam gang zhig sngon goms pa'i khyad par las 'bad pa med pa 'byung ba'o //

original: bzlog pa ni dang gis 'byung ba ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: bzlog pa ni dang gis 'byung ba ma yin pa'o //
translated: The opposite of that is not attained naturally.

original: mngon par 'du byed pa med pa dang mngon par 'du byed pa dang bcas pas bsgrub par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mngon par 'du byed pa med pa dang mngon par 'du byed pa dang bcas pas bsgrub par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni /

original: lam ngang gis 'byung ba ni 'bad pa med pas bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: lam ngang gis 'byung ba ni 'bad pa med pas bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: The path that occurs naturally is to be accomplished without effort.

original: ngang gis 'byung ba ma yin pa ni 'bad pas bsgrub par bya ba zhes bya ba ste nges par bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: ngang gis 'byung ba ma yin pa ni 'bad pas bsgrub par bya ba zhes bya ba ste nges par bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: The path that does not occur naturally is to be accomplished with effort.

original: 'di ga las she na /üîΩde'i phyir 'bad pa med pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'di ga las she na / de'i phyir 'bad pa med pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /

original: 'bad pa med pa dang 'bad pa mngon du gyur pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'bad pa med pa dang 'bad pa mngon du gyur pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Therefore, it is said, ‚Äúbecause of the absence of effort and the presence of effort.‚Äù

original: 'bad pa med par thob pa'i sgo nas lam ngang gis 'byung ba ni mngon par 'du byed pa med par bsgrub par bya ba nyid do //
analyzed: 'bad pa med par thob pa'i sgo nas lam ngang gis 'byung ba ni mngon par 'du byed pa med par bsgrub par bya ba nyid do //
translated: The path that occurs naturally is to be accomplished without manifest effort because of the absence of effort.

original: lam ngang gis 'byung ba ma yin par 'bad pa'i sgo nas thob pa ni mngon par 'du byed pas bsgrub par bya ba nyid do //
analyzed: lam ngang gis 'byung ba ma yin par 'bad pa'i sgo nas thob pa ni mngon par 'du byed pas bsgrub par bya ba nyid do //
translated: The path that does not occur naturally is to be accomplished with manifest effort because of the presence of effort.

original: de ltar yin na mngon par 'du byed pa med pa dang / skyes nas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba gnyis la go khyad par ci zhig yod de /
analyzed: de ltar yin na mngon par 'du byed pa med pa dang / skyes nas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba gnyis la go khyad par ci zhig yod de /

original: de gnyis ka yang lam dang gis 'byung ba yin pas so zhe na /
analyzed: de gnyis ka yang lam dang gis 'byung ba yin pas so zhe na /
translated: Both of these occur on the path of meditation.

original: de'i phyir skyes nas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de'i phyir skyes nas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ngo //
translated: Therefore it is said, ‚ÄúOne who attains nirvana after birth is of two types: one who ascends and one who does not ascend.‚Äù

original: rnam pa gnyis ni rgyu dang 'bras bu'i sgo nas so //
analyzed: rnam pa gnyis ni rgyu dang 'bras bu'i sgo nas so //
translated: Two types are distinguished from the perspective of cause and result.

original: gnas gtsang mar skyes pa ni bsam gtan yal ba'i 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir @234b mir gyur pa gang gi bsam gtan spel ba de ni 'og min du song nas mya ngan las 'da' ste /
analyzed: gnas gtsang mar skyes pa ni bsam gtan yal ba'i 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir @234b mir gyur pa gang gi bsam gtan spel ba de ni 'og min du song nas mya ngan las 'da' ste /
translated: One who ascends is born in a pure abode, because that is the result of increasing absorption. One who ascends attains nirvana after going to Akani·π£·π≠ha,

original: de'i gong du skye ba gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i gong du skye ba gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no other place to be born above that.

original: gzhan ni gnas gtsang mar ma zhugs par srid pa'i rtsa mor mthar thug pa yin te de'i gong du skye ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan ni gnas gtsang mar ma zhugs par srid pa'i rtsa mor mthar thug pa yin te de'i gong du skye ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: One who does not ascend is born at the summit of existence without entering a pure abode, because there is no other place to be born above that.

original: de 'phar zhes bya ba ni gzugs kyi khams kyi gnas dang po dang tha mar skye ba bar du mi 'gro ba'i phyir 'phar ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de 'phar zhes bya ba ni gzugs kyi khams kyi gnas dang po dang tha mar skye ba bar du mi 'gro ba'i phyir 'phar ba zhes bya'o //
translated: One who ascends is called a jumper because one is born in the first or last stage of the form realm and does not go to the intermediate stages.

original: gnas 'ga' tsam yang 'gal te 'og min du 'jug pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gnas 'ga' tsam yang 'gal te 'og min du 'jug pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: There is also a contradiction with regard to the location, since it is called the approach to the summit of existence.

original: yang gi sgras ni mang po yang ngo //
analyzed: yang gi sgras ni mang po yang ngo //
translated: The word also indicates that there are many.

original: gang zhig chung ngu spel te bsgom pa de ni gnas gtsang ma dang po'i skye gnas su skye'o //üîΩde bzhin du gang zhig chen po bsgom pa de gsum par skye'o //
analyzed: gang zhig chung ngu spel te bsgom pa de ni gnas gtsang ma dang po'i skye gnas su skye'o // de bzhin du gang zhig chen po bsgom pa de gsum par skye'o //
translated: Those who cultivate the small approach to the summit of existence are born in the first stage of the pristine abodes.üîΩThose who cultivate the medium approach to the summit of existence are born in the second stage of the pristine abodes.

original: der skyes pa dag ches chen po dang ches cher chen po dag bskyed de gnas gzhan gcig gam gnyis sam gsum brgal te gnas gtsang mar 'jug ste /
analyzed: der skyes pa dag ches chen po dang ches cher chen po dag bskyed de gnas gzhan gcig gam gnyis sam gsum brgal te gnas gtsang mar 'jug ste /
translated: Those who are born there generate the great and exceedingly great approaches to the summit of existence and enter the pristine abodes by passing over one, two, or three stages.

original: de ni gzugs kyi khams kyi gnas dang po dang mthar mjug gi bar du mi 'gro ba'i phyir phyed du 'phar ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ni gzugs kyi khams kyi gnas dang po dang mthar mjug gi bar du mi 'gro ba'i phyir phyed du 'phar ba zhes bya'o //
translated: They are called half-leapers because they do not go to the first stage of the form realm or to the end of the summit of existence.

original: lta ba'i gnas yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni de ni 'di snyam du bdag ni sems can 'di rnams kyi sprul pa po yin la /
analyzed: lta ba'i gnas yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni de ni 'di snyam du bdag ni sems can 'di rnams kyi sprul pa po yin la /

original: bdag gis sems can 'di dag sprul lo snyam du sems shing /
analyzed: bdag gis sems can 'di dag sprul lo snyam du sems shing /

original: dang po bskyed pa de dag kyang 'di snyam du 'di ni bdag gi sprul ba pa'o snyam du sems so //
analyzed: dang po bskyed pa de dag kyang 'di snyam du 'di ni bdag gi sprul ba pa'o snyam du sems so //
translated: The first of these emanations think: This is my emanator.

original: 'phags pa dag ni rang dbang ba yin pa su la yang rag mi las pa /
analyzed: 'phags pa dag ni rang dbang ba yin pa su la yang rag mi las pa /
translated: The noble ones are independent, not subject to anyone else.

original: de dag ni gtso bo gcig pa'i gnas su mi skye'o //
analyzed: de dag ni gtso bo gcig pa'i gnas su mi skye'o //
translated: They are not born in the same place as their emanator.

original: gnas thams cad du 'chi 'pho ba zhes bya ba 'byung ste /
analyzed: gnas thams cad du 'chi 'pho ba zhes bya ba 'byung ste /

original: de ni dbang po rtul po yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni dbang po rtul po yin pa'i phyir ro //

original: bsam gtan dang po la sogs pa'i ro myangs pas tshangs ris nas bzung ste /
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po la sogs pa'i ro myangs pas tshangs ris nas bzung ste /
translated: They die and pass away in all abodes, because they experience the taste of the first absorption and so on.

original: bar med par gnas gzhan thams cad du lan re re skyes shing 'og man gyi bar du zhugs nas mya ngan las 'da' ba'o //
analyzed: bar med par gnas gzhan thams cad du lan re re skyes shing 'og man gyi bar du zhugs nas mya ngan las 'da' ba'o //

analyzed: kha cig na re bsam gtan dang po'i gnas gzhan gnyis su zhes pas 'dis kyang grub pa yin no //

original: de lta ma yin na tshangs pa chen po gnas gzhan tha dad du brtags pas 'phags pa rnams der 'jug pa'i phyir phyed du 'phar ba dang gnas thams cad du 'chi 'pho ba dag khyad par med par 'gyur ro zhes zer ro //üîΩgang dag gnas gtsang ma rnams su skyes nas gnas gzhan bar ma gcig brgal nas 'og @235a * //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na tshangs pa chen po gnas gzhan tha dad du brtags pas 'phags pa rnams der 'jug pa'i phyir phyed du 'phar ba dang gnas thams cad du 'chi 'pho ba dag khyad par med par 'gyur ro zhes zer ro // gang dag gnas gtsang ma rnams su skyes nas gnas gzhan bar ma gcig brgal nas 'og @235a * //
translated: Otherwise, since the noble ones would enter the other abodes of Mahabrahma, there would be no difference between those who rise up half way and those who die in all abodes.

original: min du 'jug pa de nyid phyed du 'phar ba'o zhes sems par byed na /
analyzed: min du 'jug pa de nyid phyed du 'phar ba'o zhes sems par byed na /
translated: Some think that those who are born in the pure abodes and who rise up to Akanistha after passing through one intermediate abode are those who rise up half way.

original: de 'di ni shes byed ma yin te gnas gtsang ma kho na'i gnas gzhan brgal ba gang yin pa phyed du 'phar ba yin no //
analyzed: de 'di ni shes byed ma yin te gnas gtsang ma kho na'i gnas gzhan brgal ba gang yin pa phyed du 'phar ba yin no //
translated: But that is not a proof, because those who rise up half way are those who pass through the other abodes of the pure abodes.

original: yang 'dir zhes bya ba 'di la rgyu brjod par mi bya'o //
analyzed: yang 'dir zhes bya ba 'di la rgyu brjod par mi bya'o //
translated: Here, the word here should not be taken to refer to a cause.

original: gang du skyes pa zhes bya ba la gang du skye ba'i skye mched du skyes pa der ro //
analyzed: gang du skyes pa zhes bya ba la gang du skye ba'i skye mched du skyes pa der ro //
translated: Where one is born refers to where one is born, that is, the place of birth.

original: de la 'og ma'i skye ba'i skye mched rnams su skye ba'i sgo nas slar phyir mi 'ong ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la 'og ma'i skye ba'i skye mched rnams su skye ba'i sgo nas slar phyir mi 'ong ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because he is a non-returner in the sense that he will not be reborn in the lower realms.

original: de ltar na 'dir ni phyir mi 'ong ba nyid yongs su rdzogs pa ma yin gyi rnam pa gzhan du ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na 'dir ni phyir mi 'ong ba nyid yongs su rdzogs pa ma yin gyi rnam pa gzhan du ma yin no //
translated: Thus, non-returners are not fully described by this one quality, but by other qualities as well.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: gang du shi ba de nyid du slar mi 'ong ba'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: gang du shi ba de nyid du slar mi 'ong ba'i phyir ro ;
translated: Because he will not return to the very place where he died.

original: gnas gtsang ma rnams su mi 'jug pa kho nar zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gnas gtsang ma rnams su mi 'jug pa kho nar zhes bya ba ni /
translated: He does not enter the pure abodes.

original: bsam gtan bzhi pa spel pa ma bsgoms pa'i phyir gnas gtsang ma rnams su mi 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi pa spel pa ma bsgoms pa'i phyir gnas gtsang ma rnams su mi 'jug pa'o //
translated: He does not enter the pure abodes because he has not cultivated the fourth meditation that is increased.

original: bar skabs su yang zhes bya ba ni /üîΩ'og min nas srid pa'i rtse mor mi 'jug par zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bar skabs su yang zhes bya ba ni / 'og min nas srid pa'i rtse mor mi 'jug par zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: He does not enter in the intermediate state.üîΩHe does not enter from the Akani·π£·π≠ha heaven to the summit of existence.

original: gong du 'pho ba zhes bya ba ni mchog tu thogs nas 'og min nas srid pa'i rtse mo'i bar thams cad du rung bar blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: gong du 'pho ba zhes bya ba ni mchog tu thogs nas 'og min nas srid pa'i rtse mo'i bar thams cad du rung bar blta bar bya'o //
translated: He is a ‚Äúone who goes upstream,‚Äù because he is capable of going from the Akani·π£·π≠ha heaven to the summit of existence.

original: 'dis ni rig pa dang mi 'gal bar ston par byed do //
analyzed: 'dis ni rig pa dang mi 'gal bar ston par byed do //

original: phan chad du 'gro ba med pa'i phyir te zhes bya ba 'dis lung dang 'gal ba spong bar byed do //
analyzed: phan chad du 'gro ba med pa'i phyir te zhes bya ba 'dis lung dang 'gal ba spong bar byed do //

original: dper na zhes bya ba ni 'di nyid kyi dpe'o //
analyzed: dper na zhes bya ba ni 'di nyid kyi dpe'o //
translated: For example, this is an example of that.

original: re zhig de dag ni gzugs su nye bar 'gro ba'i phyir mi 'ong ba lnga zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: re zhig de dag ni gzugs su nye bar 'gro ba'i phyir mi 'ong ba lnga zhes bya ba ni /
translated: First, these are the five nonreturners who go to the form realm.

original: bar ma dor yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba nas gong du 'pho ba'i bar ro //
analyzed: bar ma dor yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba nas gong du 'pho ba'i bar ro //
translated: They are from the one who attains nirvana in the intermediate state up to the one who goes upstream.

original: gzugs med par 'gro ba rnams ni bzhi ste /
analyzed: gzugs med par 'gro ba rnams ni bzhi ste /
translated: Those who go to the formless realm are four,

original: bar ma dor mya ngan las 'da' ba ma gtogs pa'o //
analyzed: bar ma dor mya ngan las 'da' ba ma gtogs pa'o //
translated: excluding the one who attains nirvana in the intermediate state.

original: gzugs med pa rnams rna bar ma do med pa'i phyir bar ma dor mya ngan las 'da' ba med do //
analyzed: gzugs med pa rnams rna bar ma do med pa'i phyir bar ma dor mya ngan las 'da' ba med do //
translated: Because there is no intermediate state in the formless realm, there is no one who attains nirvana in the intermediate state.

original: de'i phyir skyes nas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba la sogs pa'i bye brag gis zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir skyes nas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba la sogs pa'i bye brag gis zhes bya ba smos te /

analyzed: 'di nas shi 'phos nas zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'i khams nas so //
translated: Having died and transmigrated from here means from the desire realm.

translated: The first five are as previously explained in the form realm and the sixth is the nonreturner who proceeds to the formless realm.üîΩThe three examples are like the following:

original: dpe gsum gyis zhes bya ba ni zhogs ma chung ngu'i ma la sogs pa dper na zhogs ma chung ngu'i me mngon par 'grub bzhin du 'chi bar 'gyur ba dang / dper na lcags kyi thu lum @235b mam ;
analyzed: dpe gsum gyis zhes bya ba ni zhogs ma chung ngu'i ma la sogs pa dper na zhogs ma chung ngu'i me mngon par 'grub bzhin du 'chi bar 'gyur ba dang / dper na lcags kyi thu lum @235b mam ;
translated: One dies like a small spark of fire,üîΩlike a red-hot iron ball that is struck by an iron hammer,

original: thong lcags me kun tu 'bar ba rab tu bsregs pa lcags kyi tho bas brgyab pa rnams kyi tsha tsha gyen du yar bzhin du 'chi bar 'gyur ba dang / dper na lcags kyi tsha tsha de nyid gyen du yar nas sa la ma ltung ba kho nar 'chi bar 'gyur ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: thong lcags me kun tu 'bar ba rab tu bsregs pa lcags kyi tho bas brgyab pa rnams kyi tsha tsha gyen du yar bzhin du 'chi bar 'gyur ba dang / dper na lcags kyi tsha tsha de nyid gyen du yar nas sa la ma ltung ba kho nar 'chi bar 'gyur ba lta bu'o //
translated: like that very spark of iron that ascends but dies out before falling to the ground.

original: yang na gsum po thams cad zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: yang na gsum po thams cad zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Or else all three are like

original: bar ma do dang skyes nas yongs su mya ngan 'da' ba rnams dang gong du 'pho ba rnams te /üîΩre re zhing myur ba dang myur ba ma yin pa dang / yun ring po zhig na yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i phyir phyir mi 'ong ba dgur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bar ma do dang skyes nas yongs su mya ngan 'da' ba rnams dang gong du 'pho ba rnams te / re re zhing myur ba dang myur ba ma yin pa dang / yun ring po zhig na yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i phyir phyir mi 'ong ba dgur 'gyur ro //
translated: Those who attain nirvana in the intermediate state, those who attain nirvana after birth, and those who relocate to higher levels.üîΩEach of these is of three types: those who attain nirvana quickly, not quickly, and after a long time.üîΩThus there are nine types of nonreturners.

original: phyir mi 'ong ba gsum dang zhes bya ba ni gang dag gi bye brag gis phyir mi 'ong ba dgur bshad pa'o //
analyzed: phyir mi 'ong ba gsum dang zhes bya ba ni gang dag gi bye brag gis phyir mi 'ong ba dgur bshad pa'o //
translated: The three nonreturners are those who attain nirvana in the intermediate state and so on.

original: dgu po de dag gi zhes bya ba ni ji skad bshad pa bzhin du de dag gi bye brag gis bsdus pa de dag gi'o //
analyzed: dgu po de dag gi zhes bya ba ni ji skad bshad pa bzhin du de dag gi bye brag gis bsdus pa de dag gi'o //
translated: The nine types of nonreturners are subsumed by these three.

original: mngon par 'grub pa myong bar 'gyur ba'i las bsags pa'i phyir bar dor yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba ste /
analyzed: mngon par 'grub pa myong bar 'gyur ba'i las bsags pa'i phyir bar dor yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba ste /
translated: Those who attain nirvana in the intermediate state antaraparinirvrita are so called because they accumulate karma to be experienced in the next rebirth and then attain nirvana in the intermediate state.

original: gzhan ma yin par bar ma do kho nar yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan ma yin par bar ma do kho nar yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i phyir ro //
translated: They do not attain nirvana in any other state, but only in the intermediate state.

original: skyes nas myong bar 'gyur ba'i las bsags pa'i phyir skyes nas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba ste /
analyzed: skyes nas myong bar 'gyur ba'i las bsags pa'i phyir skyes nas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba ste /
translated: One who attains nirvana after being reborn is one who attains nirvana after being reborn because he accumulates karma to be experienced after rebirth.

original: de nyid kho nar skyes nas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid kho nar skyes nas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i phyir ro //
translated: He attains nirvana in that very lifetime because he attains nirvana after being reborn.

original: lan grangs gzhan la myong bar gyur pa'i las bsags pa'i phyir gong du 'pho ba ste /
analyzed: lan grangs gzhan la myong bar gyur pa'i las bsags pa'i phyir gong du 'pho ba ste /

analyzed: de la kha cig na re rten khyad par can thob pa ni yongs su nyams pa med pa'i gtan tshigs so //

analyzed: dbang po rnams ches shin tu smin pa ni dbang po 'pho ba med pa'i rgyu'o zhe'o // gzhan dag na re /

analyzed: gcig dang gnyis dang gsum pa'i yang yin no zhes zer ro //

translated: Because the path is not familiar means that because the path that is the antidote to the nine levels of affliction is not familiar, the path does not manifest in the intermediate state of existence.

analyzed: phra rgyas shin tu chung ba ma yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la /
translated: Because the negative tendencies are not extremely small means that

analyzed: bye brag tu smra ba rnams ni 'dod pa'i khams las 'da' bar dka' ba'i phyir te /
translated: Vaibhasikas say that it is difficult to transcend the desire realm because

analyzed: de'i phyir mang po zhig bya dgos la zhes rgyas par 'byung ste /

analyzed: re zhig sngon dus kyi srid pa nyid kyang 'dod pa'i khams las 'da' bar dka' na /

analyzed: dge sbyong gi tshul gyi 'bras bu gnyis sam gsum thob pa ni lan cig phyir 'ong bas ni phyir mi 'ong ba dang dgra bcom pa nyid kyi 'bras bu ste /

analyzed: dge sbyong gi tshul gyi 'bras bu gnyis thob par bya dgos la /

analyzed: ting nge 'dzin de ni thams cad pas las su rung ba zhes bya ba ni shin tu sbyangs pa'i bde ba thams cad kyi mchog yin pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: lam sla ba de dag gi nang na bsam gtan bzhi pa mchog yin no //

analyzed: de'i sa pa'i shin tu sbyangs pa'i bde ba mchog yin pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: de ji ltar bsam gtan spel ba bsgom pas mthong bas thob pa gong du 'pho bar 'gyur zhe na /

analyzed: de ni yongs su nyams pa srid pa ma yin pas 'di la skyon med do //
translated: Since complete degeneration is impossible in this case, there is no fault.

analyzed: gang zhig dad pas mos pa spel ba bsgom pa las yongs su nyams pa des 'jigs pa nyid kyis mthong bas thob pa so sor rtog ste gzugs kyi khams su skyes te bsam gtan spel bar nus so //
translated: He is afraid of losing the superknowledges, and so he contemplates them and is reborn in the form realm, where he is able to increase the superknowledges.

original: de ltar byas te sha dapte /
analyzed: de ltar byas te sha dapte /

original: gong du 'pho ba pamba dyam te /
analyzed: gong du 'pho ba pamba dyam te /

translated: This increase of the superknowledges is conventional knowledge, which has the five aggregates as its nature. The eight liberations, the four supranormal powers, and subsequent knowledge are increased.

original: gzhan dag na re sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung shes pa dag kho na kun rdzob shes pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung shes pa dag kho na kun rdzob shes pa ste /
translated: Others say that only the knowledge of suffering and origin are conventional knowledge,

original: de dag de'i yul can yin pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //
analyzed: de dag de'i yul can yin pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //
translated: because they are the subjects of those.

original: de lta na ches mang ba'i zag pa med pa'i shes pa mngon du gyur pa'i phyir de dag spel ba la dbang ba nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na ches mang ba'i zag pa med pa'i shes pa mngon du gyur pa'i phyir de dag spel ba la dbang ba nyid du mi 'gyur ro //

analyzed: gzhan dag na re bsam gtan spel te bsgom par mi 'gyur ro zhes zer ro // gnas gtsang mar skye ba'i phyir du zhes bya ba ni /

original: thun mong pa der skye ba'o //
analyzed: thun mong pa der skye ba'o //
translated: The pure abodes are the common objective since one is reborn there in common.

original: mi skye ba ni thun mong pa ma yin pa mngon par 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: mi skye ba ni thun mong pa ma yin pa mngon par 'dod pa'o //
translated: The non-returners do not desire rebirth there in common.üîΩFor the sake of abiding in comfort in this life.

original: mthong ba'i chos la bde bar gnas par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten pa ni ches shin tu lus la brten pa yin pas mthong ba'i chos la bde bar gnas par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mthong ba'i chos la bde bar gnas par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten pa ni ches shin tu lus la brten pa yin pas mthong ba'i chos la bde bar gnas par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Since the mundane is extremely dependent on the body, one cultivates the meditative development of the formless states for the sake of abiding in comfort in this life.

original: de ni zag pa med pa dag gi 'khor du 'gyur te ro myang ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i ting nge 'dzin thag bsring ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni zag pa med pa dag gi 'khor du 'gyur te ro myang ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i ting nge 'dzin thag bsring ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is the retinue of the uncontaminated states because it extends the meditative concentration that is associated with enjoyment.

original: de ltar na nyon mongs pa can la mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen sbyin pa bsal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na nyon mongs pa can la mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen sbyin pa bsal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, the giving of the condition as the equivalent and immediate antecedent is excluded in regard to the defiled.

original: dgra bcom pa dbang po rnon po ni skye ba dang yongs su nyams pa mi srid pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa dbang po rnon po ni skye ba dang yongs su nyams pa mi srid pa'i phyir /
translated: An arhat of sharp faculty does not regress and is not subject to rebirth.

original: mthong ba'i chos la bde bar gnas par bya ba kho na'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mthong ba'i chos la bde bar gnas par bya ba kho na'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are for the sake of abiding happily in this life alone.

original: dbang po rtul po ni skye ba kho na mi srid pas mthong ba'i chos la bde bar gnas par bya ba dang / yongs su mi nyams par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbang po rtul po ni skye ba kho na mi srid pas mthong ba'i chos la bde bar gnas par bya ba dang / yongs su mi nyams par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Those of dull faculty are not capable of being born in the formless realm, so they cultivate the five faculties in order to abide happily in this life and to prevent degeneration.

original: de la zag pa dang bcas pa gang yin pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de la zag pa dang bcas pa gang yin pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: In this context, those that are contaminated

original: zag pa med pa ni srid pa'i gnyen po yin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩde ltar rgyu @239a * //
analyzed: zag pa med pa ni srid pa'i gnyen po yin pa'i phyir ro // de ltar rgyu @239a * //
translated: are not antidotes to existence.

original: rnam pa lnga yin pa'i phyir 'bras bu yang rnam pa lnga yin pas gnas gtsang ma'i skye ba lnga kho na yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa lnga yin pa'i phyir 'bras bu yang rnam pa lnga yin pas gnas gtsang ma'i skye ba lnga kho na yin no //
translated: Thus, because there are five types of causes, there are five types of results.

original: sems can ni sems bco lnga po rnams te ma thob pa rnams nyid thob pa'o //
analyzed: sems can ni sems bco lnga po rnams te ma thob pa rnams nyid thob pa'o //
translated: Beings are those possessing the fifteen mental states who obtain what has not been obtained.

original: gzhan dag na re ma thob pa zag pa med pa dang dbang po lnga dang lhag ma bcu thob po zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re ma thob pa zag pa med pa dang dbang po lnga dang lhag ma bcu thob po zhes zer ro //
translated: Others say: They obtain the five uncontaminated faculties and the remaining ten.

original: lnga rnams ni mngon sum du gyur pa'i phyir ma 'ongs pa bcu bsgom pas thob pa yin no //
analyzed: lnga rnams ni mngon sum du gyur pa'i phyir ma 'ongs pa bcu bsgom pas thob pa yin no //
translated: The five are obtained through meditation in the future because they are manifest.

original: kha cig ni ldang bas spel ba dang kha cig ldang ba'i phyir rnam pa gzhan rnams so //
analyzed: kha cig ni ldang bas spel ba dang kha cig ldang ba'i phyir rnam pa gzhan rnams so //
translated: Some increase through the power of faith, etc., and some through the power of the faculties.

original: dad pa la sogs pa'i dbang po lhag pas lnga ste /
analyzed: dad pa la sogs pa'i dbang po lhag pas lnga ste /
translated: There are five due to the predominance of the faculties of faith, etc.

analyzed: kha cig tu dad pa'i dbang po lhag pas spel ba nas kha cig tu shes rab kyi dbang po lhag pa'i bar ro //
translated: In some cases, one increases through the predominance of the faculty of faith, and in some cases, up to the predominance of the faculty of wisdom.

original: de'i dbang gis gtsang ma'i skye ba rnams lnga'o zhes slob dpon dpal len sems par byed de /
analyzed: de'i dbang gis gtsang ma'i skye ba rnams lnga'o zhes slob dpon dpal len sems par byed de /
translated: Master Haribhadra thinks that the pure abodes are five due to the power of those.

original: gnas gtsang ma dang po dang po'i dbang po lhag pa yin pa nas lnga pa shes rab kyi bar ro //
analyzed: gnas gtsang ma dang po dang po'i dbang po lhag pa yin pa nas lnga pa shes rab kyi bar ro //
translated: The first pure abode is due to the predominance of the faculty of faith, and the fifth is due to the predominance of wisdom.

original: de'i phyir dad pa la sogs pa lnga yang chung ngu dang 'bring dang chen po dang shin tu chen po dang shin tu ches chen po'i rim pas rnam pa lngar dbye'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir dad pa la sogs pa lnga yang chung ngu dang 'bring dang chen po dang shin tu chen po dang shin tu ches chen po'i rim pas rnam pa lngar dbye'o //
translated: Therefore, the five such as faith are divided into five types by the sequence of small, medium, great, very great, and exceedingly great.

original: de'i phyir lnga kho na de 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir gnas gtsang ma rnams su 'gyur ro //

translated: Because each meditative development is a distinct abode of meditative development.

original: sbyor ba gcig nyid la yang chung ngu dang 'bring dang chen po'i dbye bas snyoms par 'jug pa'i gnas tha dad do //
analyzed: sbyor ba gcig nyid la yang chung ngu dang 'bring dang chen po'i dbye bas snyoms par 'jug pa'i gnas tha dad do //
translated: And because even one meditative development has different abodes due to the differentiation of weak, medium, and strong.

original: dgu tshan drug ces bya ba la /
analyzed: dgu tshan drug ces bya ba la /
translated: Six groups of nine.

original: rigs de rnams gcig tu bsdoms na lnga bcu rtsa bzhir 'gyur la /
analyzed: rigs de rnams gcig tu bsdoms na lnga bcu rtsa bzhir 'gyur la /
translated: When those types are combined into one, there are fifty-four.üîΩSixteen groups of fifty-four.

original: lnga bcu rtsa bzhi phrag bcu drug na zhes bya ba ni gzugs kyi khams kyi gnas bcu drug bsdoms pa'o //
analyzed: lnga bcu rtsa bzhi phrag bcu drug na zhes bya ba ni gzugs kyi khams kyi gnas bcu drug bsdoms pa'o //
translated: The sixteen abodes of the form realm are combined.

original: tshangs pa chen po ni tshangs pa mdun na 'don gyi phyogs gcig yin pas lnga bcu rtsa bzhi pa bcu drug po de dag bsdoms na brgyad brgya dang drug cu rtsa bzhir 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshangs pa chen po ni tshangs pa mdun na 'don gyi phyogs gcig yin pas lnga bcu rtsa bzhi pa bcu drug po de dag bsdoms na brgyad brgya dang drug cu rtsa bzhir 'gyur ro //
translated: The MahƒÅbrahmƒÅs are one part of the Brahmapurohitas. When those sixteen groups of fifty-four are combined, there are eight hundred and sixty-four.

original: mnyam par brtsi ba'i phyir zhes bya ba 'byung ste /
analyzed: mnyam par brtsi ba'i phyir zhes bya ba 'byung ste /
translated: In order to calculate equally.

original: ci nas kyang bsam gtan bzhin dgu dgur 'gyur bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ci nas kyang bsam gtan bzhin dgu dgur 'gyur bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: In order to make the nine types of faculties and the nine stages of meditative concentration correspond, the nine types of faculties are established in this way.

original: de ma yin na mi 'dra bar brtsis par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ma yin na mi 'dra bar brtsis par 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, the faculties would not be counted in the same way as the stages.

original: gal te nyon mongs pa rnam pa dgu spangs pa'i bye brag gis dgur brtsis na ni de lta na mi 'dra bar brtsis par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te nyon mongs pa rnam pa dgu spangs pa'i bye brag gis dgur brtsis na ni de lta na mi 'dra bar brtsis par 'gyur te /
translated: If the nine types of faculties were counted according to the distinction of abandoning the nine types of defilements, then they would not be counted in the same way as the stages,

original: bsam gtan bzhi pa na rnam pa dgu med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi pa na rnam pa dgu med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there are no nine types of defilements in the fourth meditative concentration.

original: de'i rnam pa dgu po la 'dod chags dang bral ba de ni gzugs med par nye bar 'gro ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i rnam pa dgu po la 'dod chags dang bral ba de ni gzugs med par nye bar 'gro ba yin no //
translated: One who is free from the nine types of defilements in the fourth meditative concentration proceeds to the formless realm.

original: gong du 'pho ba'i bar du yang de dang 'dra bas zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gong du 'pho ba'i bar du yang de dang 'dra bas zhes bya ba la /
translated: The same applies up to those who proceed upward.

original: gnas gzhan dang / rigs dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / dbang po'i bye brag gis snga ma bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: gnas gzhan dang / rigs dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / dbang po'i bye brag gis snga ma bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The difference is in the stage, type, freedom from attachment, and faculty, as before.

original: 'dir gong du 'pho ba gzugs su nye bar 'gro ba gzung gi gzugs med par nye bar 'gro ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dir gong du 'pho ba gzugs su nye bar 'gro ba gzung gi gzugs med par nye bar 'gro ba ni ma yin no //
translated: Here, those who proceed upward proceed to the form realm, not to the formless realm.

original: de nyid kyi phyir bsam gtan bzhi pa na rnam pa dgu pa las 'dod chags dang bral ba bgrangs te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir bsam gtan bzhi pa na rnam pa dgu pa las 'dod chags dang bral ba bgrangs te /
translated: Therefore, one who is free from attachment to the ninth stage of the fourth absorption is counted as a nonreturner.

original: de'i phyir 'dir phyir mi 'ong pa gzugs su nye bar 'gro ba lnga'i dbye ba byas par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dir phyir mi 'ong pa gzugs su nye bar 'gro ba lnga'i dbye ba byas par 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, here nonreturners are classified as five types who proceed to the form realm.

original: 'di lta ste bar ma dor yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba dang / skyes nas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba dang / mngon par 'du byed pa dang bcas pas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba dang / mngon par 'du byed pa med par yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba dang gong du 'pho ba'o ;
analyzed: 'di lta ste bar ma dor yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba dang / skyes nas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba dang / mngon par 'du byed pa dang bcas pas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba dang / mngon par 'du byed pa med par yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba dang gong du 'pho ba'o ;
translated: They are: nonreturners attaining nirvana in the intermediate state, nonreturners attaining nirvana after birth, nonreturners attaining nirvana with exertion, nonreturners attaining nirvana without exertion and nonreturners who relocate to higher levels.

original: / de ltar na phyir mi 'ong ba khri nyis stong dgu brgya dang drug cur 'gyur te /
analyzed: / de ltar na phyir mi 'ong ba khri nyis stong dgu brgya dang drug cur 'gyur te /
translated: Thus there are 12,960 nonreturners.

original: bar ma dor yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba nyis stong lnga brgya dgu bcu rtsa gnyis lnga 'gyur du byas nas zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: bar ma dor yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba nyis stong lnga brgya dgu bcu rtsa gnyis lnga 'gyur du byas nas zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: It is thought that nonreturners attaining nirvana in the intermediate state are multiplied by five.

original: rnam pa lngar byed pa yang gzugs su nye bar 'gro ba'i phyir mi 'ong ba rnam pa lnga @241b yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam pa lngar byed pa yang gzugs su nye bar 'gro ba'i phyir mi 'ong ba rnam pa lnga @241b yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The five types are due to the five types of nonreturners who proceed to the form realm.

original: ji skad bshad pa'i tshul 'dis phyir mi 'ong ba gzugs med par nye bar 'gro ba par ma dor yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba ma gtogs pa rnams kyi dbye pa khong du chud par bya ste /
analyzed: ji skad bshad pa'i tshul 'dis phyir mi 'ong ba gzugs med par nye bar 'gro ba par ma dor yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba ma gtogs pa rnams kyi dbye pa khong du chud par bya ste /
translated: The classification of nonreturners who proceed to the formless realm is to be understood by the method just explained, except for nonreturners who attain nirvana in the intermediate state.

original: gzugs med pa'i khams ni skye ba las rnam pa bzhi zhig tu zad do //
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i khams ni skye ba las rnam pa bzhi zhig tu zad do //
translated: The formless realm has only four types of birth.

original: gong du 'pho ba la yang 'phar ba dang phyed du 'phar ba dag la ni sa dang gnas kyi dbye bas dbye ba nyung la /
analyzed: gong du 'pho ba la yang 'phar ba dang phyed du 'phar ba dag la ni sa dang gnas kyi dbye bas dbye ba nyung la /
translated: In the case of those who transit to higher levels, those who leap over and those who leap over half, the classification is reduced by the classification of level and stage.

original: de lta na yang gnas thams cad du 'chi 'pho ba ni dbye ba mang pa'i phyir bar ma dor yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba la sogs pa bzhin du dbye ba bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: de lta na yang gnas thams cad du 'chi 'pho ba ni dbye ba mang pa'i phyir bar ma dor yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba la sogs pa bzhin du dbye ba bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: However, since there are many classifications of death and transmigration in all abodes, they should be established like those who attain nirvana in the intermediate state and so on.

original: 'di rdo rje dang 'dra bas rdo rje lta bu ste phra rgyas thams cad 'joms pa'i phyir zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di rdo rje dang 'dra bas rdo rje lta bu ste phra rgyas thams cad 'joms pa'i phyir zhes bya'o //
translated: Since it is like a vajra, it is called vajra-like, because it destroys all negative tendencies.

original: 'di'i rdo rje dang chos mthun pa ni 'di yin no zhes ston par byed do //
analyzed: 'di'i rdo rje dang chos mthun pa ni 'di yin no zhes ston par byed do //
translated: It is taught that this is similar to a vajra.

original: gal te phra rgyas thams cad 'joms na srid pa'i rtse mo'i nyon mongs pa rnam pa dgu pa bzhin thams cad ci'i phyir mi 'joms she na /
analyzed: gal te phra rgyas thams cad 'joms na srid pa'i rtse mo'i nyon mongs pa rnam pa dgu pa bzhin thams cad ci'i phyir mi 'joms she na /
translated: If it destroys all negative tendencies, why doesn‚Äôt it destroy all of them, like the ninth stage of the afflictions of the summit of existence?

original: de'i phyir sngar bcom zin pa'i phyir 'dis thams cad 'joms pa ni ma yin gyi zhes smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir sngar bcom zin pa'i phyir 'dis thams cad 'joms pa ni ma yin gyi zhes smos te /
translated: Therefore it says, ‚ÄúIt does not destroy all of them, because they have already been destroyed.‚Äù

original: sngar srid pa'i rtse mo'i nyon mongs pa rnam pa brgyad kyi bar spangs zin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sngar srid pa'i rtse mo'i nyon mongs pa rnam pa brgyad kyi bar spangs zin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the eight stages of afflictions of the summit of existence have already been abandoned.

original: gal te de spangs zin pa'i phyir mi 'joms na ji ltar phra rgyas thams cad 'joms pa zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de spangs zin pa'i phyir mi 'joms na ji ltar phra rgyas thams cad 'joms pa zhes bya zhe na /
translated: If it does not destroy them because they have already been abandoned, how can it be called the destroyer of all negative tendencies?

original: de'i phyir thams cad 'joms par nus pa yin no zhes smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir thams cad 'joms par nus pa yin no zhes smos te /
translated: Therefore it says, ‚ÄúIt is able to destroy all of them.‚Äù

original: gal te des spangs zin pa de dag kyang bcom pa'i phyir de gzhom par bya ba ma yin pa'i phra rgyas kyi rnam pa 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gal te des spangs zin pa de dag kyang bcom pa'i phyir de gzhom par bya ba ma yin pa'i phra rgyas kyi rnam pa 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Since it destroys those already abandoned, there is no aspect of the negative tendencies that are not destroyed by that path.

original: mnyam par 'jog pa med pa la ni 'joms par byed pa med do //
analyzed: mnyam par 'jog pa med pa la ni 'joms par byed pa med do //
translated: But if one is not in equipoise, there is no destruction.

original: de nyid la rgyu smos pa ;
analyzed: de nyid la rgyu smos pa ;
translated: The cause of that is stated:

original: bar chad med pa'i lam thams cad kyi nang na shin tu che ba yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bar chad med pa'i lam thams cad kyi nang na shin tu che ba yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Because it is the greatest of all uninterrupted paths.

original: nyon mongs pa'i rnam pa phra mo thams cad 'joms pa'i phyir bar chad med pa'i lam thams cad kyi nang nas chen po nyid du rjes su dpag ste /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i rnam pa phra mo thams cad 'joms pa'i phyir bar chad med pa'i lam thams cad kyi nang nas chen po nyid du rjes su dpag ste /
translated: It is inferred that it is the greatest of all uninterrupted paths because it destroys all subtle aspects of the afflictions.

original: des phra rgyas thams cad 'joms nus par rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: des phra rgyas thams cad 'joms nus par rtogs par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that it is able to destroy all negative tendencies.

original: de lta mod kyi mthong ba'i lam yang srid pa'i rtse mo'i sa yang nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po ste /
analyzed: de lta mod kyi mthong ba'i lam yang srid pa'i rtse mo'i sa yang nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po ste /
translated: However, the path of seeing is also the antidote to the afflictions of the summit of existence.

original: de ni rnam pa dgu las rnam pa du ma zhig 'joms par byed de /
analyzed: de ni rnam pa dgu las rnam pa du ma zhig 'joms par byed de /
translated: It destroys some aspects out of the nine aspects.

original: gang gi phyir de ni nyon mongs pa nyam chung ngu'i gnyen po yin pa'i phyir nyon mongs pa thams cad kyi @242a * //üîΩgnyen po nyid du rtogs par mi bya'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ni nyon mongs pa nyam chung ngu'i gnyen po yin pa'i phyir nyon mongs pa thams cad kyi @242a * // gnyen po nyid du rtogs par mi bya'o //
translated: Because it is the antidote to weak afflictions, it should not be understood as the antidote to all afflictions.

original: 'dis de spong pa'i gegs nus pas de rdo rje lta bu ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dis de spong pa'i gegs nus pas de rdo rje lta bu ma yin no //
translated: It is not a vajra-like concentration because it is unable to obstruct the abandonment of afflictions.

original: dngos po de ni phra rgyas kyi rnam pa chung ngus spong ba'i gnyen po ste de phra rgyas spong nus par rigs so //
analyzed: dngos po de ni phra rgyas kyi rnam pa chung ngus spong ba'i gnyen po ste de phra rgyas spong nus par rigs so //
translated: It is reasonable that it is the antidote to the abandonment of afflictions because it is the antidote to the abandonment of the weak class of afflictions.

original: de nyid kyang rdo rje lta bu ste shes pa drug las gang yang rung ba yin te /
analyzed: de nyid kyang rdo rje lta bu ste shes pa drug las gang yang rung ba yin te /
translated: It is also a vajra-like concentration because it is any one of the six knowledges.

original: rjes su shes pa bzhi rnams dang 'gog pa dang lam la chos shes pa dag go //
analyzed: rjes su shes pa bzhi rnams dang 'gog pa dang lam la chos shes pa dag go //
translated: They are the four subsequent knowledges, the Dharma knowledge of cessation, and the Dharma knowledge of path.

original: de ltar byas na 'di rnam pa bcu drug ste bden pa bzhi la dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar byas na 'di rnam pa bcu drug ste bden pa bzhi la dmigs pa'o //
translated: Thus it has sixteen aspects, focusing on the four truths.

original: rdo rje lta bu rnams kyi bye brag ni rnam pa mang po zhig tu brjod de zhes bya ba ni sa dgu pa yang grub pa yin no //
analyzed: rdo rje lta bu rnams kyi bye brag ni rnam pa mang po zhig tu brjod de zhes bya ba ni sa dgu pa yang grub pa yin no //
translated: It is said that there are many types of vajra-like concentrations.

original: mi lcogs pa med pas bsdus pa zhes bya ba ni gang gi tshe mi lcogs pa med pa la brten nas srid pa'i rtse mo la 'dod chags dang bral bar byed pa de'i tshe na rdo rje lta bu mi lcogs pa med pas bsdus pa yin no //
analyzed: mi lcogs pa med pas bsdus pa zhes bya ba ni gang gi tshe mi lcogs pa med pa la brten nas srid pa'i rtse mo la 'dod chags dang bral bar byed pa de'i tshe na rdo rje lta bu mi lcogs pa med pas bsdus pa yin no //
translated: The vajra-like concentrations subsumed by unrestricted access concentration are when one becomes free from attachment to the summit of existence by relying on unrestricted access concentration.üîΩThe vajra-like concentrations subsumed by unrestricted access concentration are when one becomes free from attachment to the summit of existence by relying on unrestricted access concentration.üîΩThe vajra-like concentrations subsumed by unrestricted access concentration are when one becomes free from attachment to the summit of existence by relying on unrestricted access concentration.

analyzed: srid pa'i rtse mo'i sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung la dmigs pa zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni mi lcogs pa med pa la brten nas srid pa'i rtse mo'i sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung la mi rtag pa la sogs pa'am rgyu la sogs pa'i rnam pa dag
translated: The vajra-like concentrations subsumed by unrestricted access concentration are when one becomes free from attachment to the summit of existence by relying on unrestricted access concentration.üîΩThe vajra-like concentrations subsumed by unrestricted access concentration are when one becomes free from attachment to the summit of existence by relying on unrestricted access concentration.

original: tu rtogs pa na sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung la rjes su shes pa'i rnam pa dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa brgyad do ;üîΩsdug bsngal dang kun 'byung shes pa chos shes pa yang zhes bya ba de'i phyir rjes su shes pa smos so //

translated: The vajra-like concentrations subsumed by unrestricted access concentration are when one becomes free from attachment to the summit of existence by relying on unrestricted access concentration.üîΩThe vajra-like concentrations subsumed by unrestricted access concentration are when one becomes free from attachment to the summit of existence by relying on unrestricted access concentration.üîΩThe vajra-like concentrations subsumed by unrestricted access concentration are when one becomes free from attachment to the summit of existence by relying on unrestricted access concentration.üîΩThe vajra-like concentrations subsumed by unrestricted access concentration are when one becomes free from attachment to the summit of existence by relying on unrestricted access concentration.üîΩThe vajra-like concentrations subsumed by unrestricted access concentration are when one becomes free from attachment to the summit of existence by relying on unrestricted access concentration.üîΩThe vajra-like concentrations subsumed by unrestricted access concentration are when one becomes free from attachment to the summit of existence by relying on unrestricted access concentration.üîΩThe vajra-like concentrations subsumed by unrestricted access concentration are when one becomes free from attachment to the summit of existence by relying on unrestricted access concentration.üîΩThe vajra-like concentrations subsumed by unrestricted access concentration are when one becomes free from attachment to the summit of existence by relying on unrestricted access concentration.üîΩThe vajra-like concentrations subsumed by unrestricted access concentration are when one becomes free from attachment to the summit of existence by relying on unrestricted access concentration.

original: 'gog pa dang lam shes pa yang ngo zhes bya ba de'i phyir sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung smos so //
analyzed: 'gog pa dang lam shes pa yang ngo zhes bya ba de'i phyir sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung smos so //
translated: The knowledge of cessation and the knowledge of the path are also aspects.

original: rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin gyi rnam pa ni shes rab ste rnam pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i bye brag las brgyad du 'gyur te //üîΩsdug bsngal gyi rnam pa bzhi dang kun 'byung gi rnam pa bzhi dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin gyi rnam pa ni shes rab ste rnam pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i bye brag las brgyad du 'gyur te // sdug bsngal gyi rnam pa bzhi dang kun 'byung gi rnam pa bzhi dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The vajra-like concentration has eight aspects, because it is associated with the four aspects of the knowledge of suffering and the four aspects of the knowledge of origin.üîΩThe knowledge of cessation and the knowledge of the path have sixteen aspects, because they are associated with the four aspects of the knowledge of cessation and the four aspects of the knowledge of the path.

original: 'gog pa dang lam la chos shes pa'i zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'gog pa dang lam la chos shes pa'i zhes bya ba la /
translated: The knowledge of cessation and the knowledge of the path have sixteen aspects, because they are associated with the four aspects of the knowledge of cessation and the four aspects of the path.

original: 'dir yang khyad par dang khyad par can gyi ngo bo snga ma bzhin du 'dod pa na spyod pa'i 'du byed pa rnams 'gog pa'i gnyen po yid la byed pa'i sgo nas rnam pa brgyad dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i bye brag las kyang brgyad du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dir yang khyad par dang khyad par can gyi ngo bo snga ma bzhin du 'dod pa na spyod pa'i 'du byed pa rnams 'gog pa'i gnyen po yid la byed pa'i sgo nas rnam pa brgyad dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i bye brag las kyang brgyad du 'gyur ro //
translated: Here, when the nature of the distinctive and the distinctive are accepted as before, they are associated with the eight aspects of the antidote that is the cessation of the formative forces of the desire realm, from the point of view of mental attention.

original: 'gog pa dang lam la chos shes pa dag bsgom pa'i lam la khams gsum gyi gnyen po yin pa'i phyir @242b 'gog pa la rjes su shes pa'i rnam pa dag dang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
analyzed: 'gog pa dang lam la chos shes pa dag bsgom pa'i lam la khams gsum gyi gnyen po yin pa'i phyir @242b 'gog pa la rjes su shes pa'i rnam pa dag dang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
translated: they possess the aspects of subsequent knowledge of cessation.

original: bsam gtan dang po nas bzung ste srid pa'i rtse mo'i par sa brgyad po re re la 'gog pa yid la byed pa'i sgo nas rdo rje lta bu rnam pa brgyad dang bzhir 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po nas bzung ste srid pa'i rtse mo'i par sa brgyad po re re la 'gog pa yid la byed pa'i sgo nas rdo rje lta bu rnam pa brgyad dang bzhir 'gyur ro //
translated: Each of the eight levels, beginning with the first absorption and ending with the summit of existence, has four vajra like concentrations that focus on cessation.

original: lam la rjes su shes pa'i rnam pa ngang mtshungs par ldan pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: lam la rjes su shes pa'i rnam pa ngang mtshungs par ldan pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: The path of subsequent knowledge is similar to that.

original: gal te lam la rjes su shes pa gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i 'du byed rnams kyi gnyen po yid la byed na bzhi nyid do //
analyzed: gal te lam la rjes su shes pa gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i 'du byed rnams kyi gnyen po yid la byed na bzhi nyid do //
translated: If subsequent knowledge of the truth of path focuses on the antidote to the formative forces of the desire realm, it has four aspects.üîΩIf it focuses on the antidote to the formative forces of the form and formless realms, it has four aspects.

original: rjes su shes pa'i phyogs dang mthun pa'i lam mtha' dag la dmigs pa na /
analyzed: rjes su shes pa'i phyogs dang mthun pa'i lam mtha' dag la dmigs pa na /
translated: If it focuses on the entire path of the aspect of subsequent knowledge,

original: 'gog pa dang lam la yongs su gcod pa'i sgo nas dmigs so //
analyzed: 'gog pa dang lam la yongs su gcod pa'i sgo nas dmigs so //
translated: it focuses on the truth of path by way of comprehending cessation.

original: de dag ni shes pa'i rnam pa dang dmigs pa'i bye brag gis tha dad pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la /üîΩshes pa'i rnam pas tha dad pa ni re zhig sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung shes pa'i rnam pa dag gis so zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag ni shes pa'i rnam pa dang dmigs pa'i bye brag gis tha dad pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la / shes pa'i rnam pas tha dad pa ni re zhig sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung shes pa'i rnam pa dag gis so zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are differentiated by the aspects and objects of consciousness.üîΩThey are differentiated by the aspects of consciousness, since it is said that they are differentiated by the aspects of the knowledge of suffering and origin.

original: dmigs pa'i bye brag gis tha dad pa yang srid pa'i rtse mo pa'i sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung gi bsam gtan la dmigs pas so zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i bye brag gis tha dad pa yang srid pa'i rtse mo pa'i sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung gi bsam gtan la dmigs pas so zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: They are also differentiated by the objects of consciousness, since it is said that they focus on the suffering and origin of the summit of existence.

original: de ltar bsam gtan bzhi pas bsdus pa'i bar zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de ltar bsam gtan bzhi pas bsdus pa'i bar zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Thus, up to the fourth absorption is included.

original: bsam gtan dang po dang khyad par can dang gnyis pa dang gsum pas bsdus ta /
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po dang khyad par can dang gnyis pa dang gsum pas bsdus ta /
translated: It is included in the first absorption, the special first absorption, the second absorption, and the third absorption.

original: so sor rdo rje lta bu lnga bcu rtsa gnyis su rig par bya'o //
analyzed: so sor rdo rje lta bu lnga bcu rtsa gnyis su rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that each has fifty-two vajra-like concentrations.

original: bsam gtan dag ni kun tu lta ba yin te gong ma ngang 'og ma dmigs ba yin no //
analyzed: bsam gtan dag ni kun tu lta ba yin te gong ma ngang 'og ma dmigs ba yin no //
translated: The absorptions are called all-seeing, because they focus on lower and higher levels.

original: chos shes pa med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: chos shes pa med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Because there is no knowledge of dharmas.

original: nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched la sogs pas bsdus pa'i rdo rje lta bu rnams la chos shes pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched la sogs pas bsdus pa'i rdo rje lta bu rnams la chos shes pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: The vajra like concentrations subsumed by the base of infinite space and so on do not possess Dharma knowledge.

original: gzugs med pa rnams kyi 'dod pa'i khams kyi 'gog pa'am gnyen po la dmigs pa med do //
analyzed: gzugs med pa rnams kyi 'dod pa'i khams kyi 'gog pa'am gnyen po la dmigs pa med do //
translated: Therefore they do not focus on the cessation or antidote of the desire realm.

original: rjes su shes pas sa 'og ma'i 'gog pa la dmigs pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rjes su shes pas sa 'og ma'i 'gog pa la dmigs pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Subsequent knowledge does not focus on the cessation of lower levels.

original: gzugs med pa rnams kyi sa 'og ma'i 'gog pa la dmigs pa med pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs med pa rnams kyi sa 'og ma'i 'gog pa la dmigs pa med pa'o //
translated: This means that formless states do not focus on the cessation of lower levels.

original: yang ci'i phyir rang gi sa dang sa gong ma pa kho na'i 'gog pa la dmigs kyis 'og ma pa'i 'gog pa la ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: yang ci'i phyir rang gi sa dang sa gong ma pa kho na'i 'gog pa la dmigs kyis 'og ma pa'i 'gog pa la ma yin zhe na /
translated: Why do they focus on the cessation of their own level and higher levels alone and not on the cessation of lower levels?

original: sa 'og ma pa'i sdug bsngal mi dmigs pas de 'gog pa la dmigs par mi nus so //üîΩsdug @243a * //
analyzed: sa 'og ma pa'i sdug bsngal mi dmigs pas de 'gog pa la dmigs par mi nus so // sdug @243a * //
translated: They cannot focus on the cessation of lower levels because they do not focus on the suffering of lower levels.

original: bsngal yang thams cad zag pa dang bcas pa yin la /üîΩgzugs med dngos gzhi dge rnams kyi //
analyzed: bsngal yang thams cad zag pa dang bcas pa yin la / gzugs med dngos gzhi dge rnams kyi //
translated: Suffering is contaminated andüîΩthe formless realm is uncontaminated.

original: spyod yul zag bcas 'og ma min //
analyzed: spyod yul zag bcas 'og ma min //
translated: The formless realm is not the domain of contaminated lower levels.

original: zhes bya ba 'di yang nges pas so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'di yang nges pas so //
translated: This is also ascertained by the Abhidharmakosa, which states,üîΩThe domain of the virtuous actual basis of the formless realm is not contaminated lower levels.

original: de la nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched la 'gog pa dang lam la chos shes pa'i rnam pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa brgyad dang / 'gog pa la rjes su shes pa'i rnam pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa bzhi dang bsam gtan gyi 'gog pa la dmigs pa bcu drug dor nas lhag ma nyi shu rtsa brgyad du 'gyur te /

analyzed: de bzhin du rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched la ni /

analyzed: srid pa'i rtse mo'i sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung ba ltar sa gzhan pa'i sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung la ma yin zhe na /

analyzed: sa 'og ma las 'dod chags dang bral ba'i phyir te /

translated: They are distinguished by the specific types of dull, medium and great faculty, which are threefold.

analyzed: gzhan dag la yang de dang 'dra bar rigs dang dbang po'i bye phrag gi khyad par sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The same should be applied to the other concentrations.

analyzed: 'on kyang sngar spangs pa rnams kyi thob pa dag kyang skye'o //

analyzed: da ni bral ba rnams kyi thob pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: Now, the obtainment of freedom is explained.üîΩObtainment of the result, relinquishment of the former path,

analyzed: 'bras la sngon lam btang ba dang // gzhan thob pa dang zad bsdoms dang // zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: obtainment of another, and the combination of eliminations.

analyzed: 'bras bu gzhan gyi phyir bslab par bya ba med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la /
translated: Because there is no other fruit to be obtained.

original: gal te mi slob pa la yang dbang po 'pho ba'i sgo nas 'bras bu thob par bya ba yod de spel bas khyad par can zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro zhe na de ni yod pa ma yin no //

translated: If you think that even the nonlearner has a fruit to be obtained through upgrading faculties, because it is said that the fruit is distinguished by enhancement, that is not so.

translated: Because the once returner and nonreturner are similar, their fruit is not another fruit.üîΩIf you think that when a name that is a sign of a former fruit is discarded and a name that is a sign of a later fruit is designated, that is another fruit, that is not so.

original: gang du sngar gyi 'bras bu'i rgyu mtshan can gyi ming dor nas 'bras bu phyi ma'i rgyu mtshan can gyi ming btags pa de ni de'i 'bras bu gzhan yin no zhes bya bar shes na dgra bcom pa de ltar de la dbang po 'phos kyang sngar ming mi

analyzed: 'dor la / de'i dbang po 'phos kyang snga ma ltar dgra bcom pa nyid yin pas 'bras bu gzhan med do //
translated: And even though their intellectual faculty upgrades, they are still arhats as before. Therefore there is no other fruit.

analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba ni /

analyzed: gang gi phyir de ni rang gi don yongs su rdzogs pa yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because that is the complete fulfillment of one's own aim.

analyzed: rang gi don yongs su rdzogs pa ni shin tu chos gzhan gyi don byed par 'os pa yin no //
translated: One who has completely fulfilled one's own aim is fit to perform the aim of another.

original: de yang ji skad du /
analyzed: de yang ji skad du /
translated: And it is said:

analyzed: zhugs pa dang 'bras bu la gnas pa med /

analyzed: gang gi zad pa shes pa skye ba ni 'di slob pa dang dgra bcom pa zhes bya ba /
translated: One who has generated the knowledge of elimination is called a learner and an arhat.

original: gang zad pa shes pa ma skyes par gyur pa'i gang zag de ni slob pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: gang zad pa shes pa ma skyes par gyur pa'i gang zag de ni slob pa zhes bya ste /
translated: One who has not generated the knowledge of elimination is called a learner.

original: de nyid kyi phyir gang zag sngar bshad pa bdun ni slob pa dag yin no zhes bya bar grub pa'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir gang zag sngar bshad pa bdun ni slob pa dag yin no zhes bya bar grub pa'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore it is established that the seven persons explained earlier are learners.

original: de dag ni zhugs pa bzhi dang 'bras bu la gnas pa gsum mo //
analyzed: de dag ni zhugs pa bzhi dang 'bras bu la gnas pa gsum mo //
translated: These are the four who enter and the three who abide in the result.

original: tshul khrims kyi dbang du byas pa'i bslab pa ni lhag pa'i tshul khrims so //
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi dbang du byas pa'i bslab pa ni lhag pa'i tshul khrims so //

original: lhag pa'i sems dang lhag pa'i shes rab kyi bar yang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: lhag pa'i sems dang lhag pa'i shes rab kyi bar yang de dang 'dra'o //

original: so so'i skye po yang slob pa yin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: so so'i skye po yang slob pa yin par 'gyur te /

original: de dag tshul khrims dang ting nge 'dzin dang shes rab la slob pa yin no zhen ma yin @244b te ;
analyzed: de dag tshul khrims dang ting nge 'dzin dang shes rab la slob pa yin no zhen ma yin @244b te ;
translated: because they train in morality, concentration, and wisdom.

original: bden pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du ma shes pa'i phyir te so so skye bo zhes skabs dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: bden pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du ma shes pa'i phyir te so so skye bo zhes skabs dang sbyar ro //
translated: But this is not so, because they do not know the truths as they are.

original: 'di ltar lhag pa'i tshul khrims dang / lhag pa'i sems kyis bslab pa bshad nas /
analyzed: 'di ltar lhag pa'i tshul khrims dang / lhag pa'i sems kyis bslab pa bshad nas /
translated: Thus, having explained the training in higher morality and higher mind,

original: lhag pa'i shes rab kyis bslab pa gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: lhag pa'i shes rab kyis bslab pa gang yin zhe na /
translated: what is the training in higher wisdom?üîΩIt is as stated:

original: 'di ni sdug bsngal 'phags pa'i bden pa yin no zhes bya bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu shes shing zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: 'di ni sdug bsngal 'phags pa'i bden pa yin no zhes bya bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu shes shing zhes bya ba nas /
translated: This is the noble truth of suffering - one knows it as it truly is.

original: 'di ni sdug bsngal 'gog par 'gro ba'i lam 'phags pa'i bden pa yin no zhes bya bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin shes pa yin no zhes bya ba'i bar du gsungs te /
analyzed: 'di ni sdug bsngal 'gog par 'gro ba'i lam 'phags pa'i bden pa yin no zhes bya bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin shes pa yin no zhes bya ba'i bar du gsungs te /
translated: This is the correct understanding of the noble truths.

original: so so'i skye bo la ni yongs su shes pa zag pa med pa ji lta ba bzhin shes pa yod pa ma yin la /
analyzed: so so'i skye bo la ni yongs su shes pa zag pa med pa ji lta ba bzhin shes pa yod pa ma yin la /
translated: Ordinary beings do not have uncontaminated complete knowledge or correct understanding.

original: der med pas de la zag pa med pa'i tshul khrims dang ting nge 'dzin yang med do //
analyzed: der med pas de la zag pa med pa'i tshul khrims dang ting nge 'dzin yang med do //
translated: Since they do not have that, they do not have uncontaminated ethics and concentration.

original: de'i phyir bslab pa rnams zag pa med pa yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de'i phyir bslab pa rnams zag pa med pa yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Therefore, because the trainings are uncontaminated,

original: de slob pa dag la slob pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de slob pa dag la slob pa ma yin no //

original: yang bslab pa gtong ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: yang bslab pa gtong ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /

analyzed: re zhig lhag pa'i tshul khrims la bslab pa gtong ste /

analyzed: so sor thar pa'i sdom pa gtong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because they abandon the pratimok·π£a vows.

original: lhag pa'i sems kyi bslab pa la yang slob pa gtong ste /
analyzed: lhag pa'i sems kyi bslab pa la yang slob pa gtong ste /
translated: They also abandon the training in superior mindüîΩbecause they abandon the meditative attainment of the absorptions and formless states.

original: dro bar gyur pa'i ting nge 'dzin la sogs pa las yongs su nyams pa las so //
analyzed: dro bar gyur pa'i ting nge 'dzin la sogs pa las yongs su nyams pa las so //

original: lhag pa'i shes rab kyi bslab pa la yang slob pa gtong ste /
analyzed: lhag pa'i shes rab kyi bslab pa la yang slob pa gtong ste /

analyzed: dro bar gyur pas bsdus pa'i shes rab kyi bar las yongs su nyams pa las so //
translated: from the falling away from the wisdom included in the concentration of heat.

original: dgra bcom pa dang slob pa yang yongs su nyams par 'gyur ba ma yin zhe na yongs su nyams mod kyi /üîΩyongs su nyams pas 'chi ba 'am /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa dang slob pa yang yongs su nyams par 'gyur ba ma yin zhe na yongs su nyams mod kyi / yongs su nyams pas 'chi ba 'am /
translated: But an arhat and a learner do not fall away from their fruit or from the state of a learner.üîΩEven though they do fall away,

original: des bya ba ma yin pa byed pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: des bya ba ma yin pa byed pa ni ma yin no //
translated: they do not die through that falling away, nor do they commit an action that is to be intensely regretted.

original: slob pa yongs su nyams pa la yang bslab pa gsum po lhag pa'i tshul khrims dang lhag pa'i sems dang lhag pa'i shes rab yod do //
analyzed: slob pa yongs su nyams pa la yang bslab pa gsum po lhag pa'i tshul khrims dang lhag pa'i sems dang lhag pa'i shes rab yod do //
translated: Even though a learner falls away, he still has the three trainings: higher morality, higher mind, and higher wisdom.

original: de la 'bras bu dang po las nyams pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la 'bras bu dang po las nyams pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he does not fall away from the first fruit.

original: so so skye bo ni dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su chad pa la bslab pa gsum rnam pa thams cad du yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: so so skye bo ni dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su chad pa la bslab pa gsum rnam pa thams cad du yod pa ma yin no //
translated: An ordinary person who has severed his wholesome roots does not have the three trainings in any way.

original: 'phags pa rang bzhin du gnas pa zhes bya ba ni lung du ma bstan pa'i spyod pa la gnas pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'phags pa rang bzhin du gnas pa zhes bya ba ni lung du ma bstan pa'i spyod pa la gnas pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The noble one who is naturally restrained is one who is naturally restrained in the sense of being restrained in the uncollected state.

analyzed: sems can rnams kyi rang bzhin ni mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i gnas skabs la brjod do //

original: sems pa ni @245a * //üîΩbsam pa'o // lam du 'gro ba bzhin no zhes bya ba ni ji ltar 'gro ba'i bsam pa ma gtang ba'i phyir lam du zhugs pa la zas la sogs pa za zhing /

original: mi 'gro yang lam du 'gro ba zhes brjod pa de 'dra'o //üîΩthob pa dang rjes su 'brel ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mi 'gro yang lam du 'gro ba zhes brjod pa de 'dra'o // thob pa dang rjes su 'brel ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
translated: Like one who is traveling on a road, just as one who has set out on a road is said to be traveling on the road, even when not traveling, because the intention to travel has not been abandoned, and while eating food, etc.üîΩ, in the same way, the noble one is said to be naturally restrained, even in the uncollected state, because of the connection with the obtainment of the three trainings.

original: rang bzhin du gnas kyang bslab pa gsum gyi thob pa dang rjes su 'brel pas bslab pa nyid du brjod do //
analyzed: rang bzhin du gnas kyang bslab pa gsum gyi thob pa dang rjes su 'brel pas bslab pa nyid du brjod do //
translated: Because of the connection with the obtainment of the three trainings, even though naturally restrained, he is said to be restrained.

original: ci'i phyir mya ngan las 'das pa slob pa ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir mya ngan las 'das pa slob pa ma yin zhe na /
translated: Why is nirvana not a learner?

original: bslab pa'i lam gyi thob pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: bslab pa'i lam gyi thob pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: It is the obtainment of the path of training.

original: mi slob pa dang so so skye bo dag kyang de dang ldan pa'i phyir ro zhes rgyas par 'byung ste /üîΩ'jig rten pa'i lam gyi so so skye bo rnams la mya ngan las 'das pa'i theb pa skye'o //
analyzed: mi slob pa dang so so skye bo dag kyang de dang ldan pa'i phyir ro zhes rgyas par 'byung ste / 'jig rten pa'i lam gyi so so skye bo rnams la mya ngan las 'das pa'i theb pa skye'o //
translated: because ordinary beings and nonlearners possess it.üîΩThe mundane path is the mundane path of preparation.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa 'phags pa rnams la'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa 'phags pa rnams la'o //
translated: The supramundane path is the supramundane path of preparation.

original: mi slob pa dang so so skye bo dag kyang de dang ldan pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba 'dis ni so sor ma brtags pa'i 'gog pa slob pa nyid yin par bsal ba yin no //
analyzed: mi slob pa dang so so skye bo dag kyang de dang ldan pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba 'dis ni so sor ma brtags pa'i 'gog pa slob pa nyid yin par bsal ba yin no //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúbecause ordinary beings and nonlearners possess it‚Äù indicates that analytical cessation is not a learner state.

analyzed: de bzhin du slob pa dang so so skye bo dag kyang de dang ldan pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba 'dis ni mi slob pa nyid do //

analyzed: zhugs pa dang po zhes bya ba ni rgyun tu zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la zhugs pa'o //

original: 'di ni zhugs pa kho na yin gyi 'bras bu la gnas pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni zhugs pa kho na yin gyi 'bras bu la gnas pa ma yin no //
translated: He is an enterer, not a dweller in the result.

original: 'bras bu la gnas pa bzhi zhes bya ba ni rgyun tu zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la gnas pa nas dgra bcom pa nyid kyi 'bras bu la gnas pa'i bar ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu la gnas pa bzhi zhes bya ba ni rgyun tu zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la gnas pa nas dgra bcom pa nyid kyi 'bras bu la gnas pa'i bar ro //
translated: The four abiders in the fruit are the stream enterer who abides in the fruit up to the arhat who abides in the fruit.

original: zhugs pa lhag ma rnams ni zhes bya ba ni lan cig phyir 'ong ba ngang /
analyzed: zhugs pa lhag ma rnams ni zhes bya ba ni lan cig phyir 'ong ba ngang /
translated: The remaining enterers are the once returner,

original: phyir mi 'ong ba dang / dgra bcom pa nyid kyi 'bras bu la zhugs pa rnams so //
analyzed: phyir mi 'ong ba dang / dgra bcom pa nyid kyi 'bras bu la zhugs pa rnams so //
translated: nonreturner, and arhat who have entered the path.

original: 'bras bu la gnas pa gsum las tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'bras bu la gnas pa gsum las tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
translated: Because they are not different from the three abiders in the fruit.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: re zhig lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu mngon sum du bya ba'i phyir zhugs pa gang yin pa de ni rgyun tu zhugs pa las tha dad pa ma yin te /
analyzed: re zhig lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu mngon sum du bya ba'i phyir zhugs pa gang yin pa de ni rgyun tu zhugs pa las tha dad pa ma yin te /
translated: First, one who has entered to manifest the result of once returner is not different from the stream enterer.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: If that is so, then what is it?

original: rgyun tu zhugs pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: rgyun tu zhugs pa nyid yin no //
translated: It is a stream enterer.

original: de bzhin du phyir mi 'ong ba dang / dgra bcom pa nyid la zhugs pa gsum lan cig phyir 'ong ba dang / phyir mi 'ong ba dag las tha mi dad pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du phyir mi 'ong ba dang / dgra bcom pa nyid la zhugs pa gsum lan cig phyir 'ong ba dang / phyir mi 'ong ba dag las tha mi dad pa yin no //
translated: Similarly, the three who enter the state of a nonreturner and the state of an arhat are not different from the once-returner and nonreturner.

original: de ltar na 'bras bu la zhugs pa rnams ni 'bras bu la gnas pa gsum las tha mi dad @245b de ;
analyzed: de ltar na 'bras bu la zhugs pa rnams ni 'bras bu la gnas pa gsum las tha mi dad @245b de ;
translated: Thus, those who enter the result are not different from the three who abide in the result.

analyzed: 'dir ni mthar gyis thob pa'i phyir yin te gang gi tshe rgyun tu zhugs pa'i 'bras bu'i mjug thogs su lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu thob la /

analyzed: de'i mjug thogs su phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu thob pa na 'o //
translated: and immediately after that they obtain the result of a nonreturner.

original: phal cher las 'dod chags dang bral pa 'jig rten pa'i lam gyis gang gi 'dod pa na spyod pa rnams las rnam pa drug spangs pa dang / 'dod pa las 'dod chags dang bral ba rnam pa dgu zad pa ni mthong ba'i lam la zhugs pa dag kho na yin gyi rgyun tu zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la zhugs pa dag ni ma yin no //

translated: Those who are detached from the realm of desire by the mundane path and who abandon six types of defilements related to the realm of desire, and those who are detached from the realm of desire and who eliminate nine types of defilements related to the realm of desire, are only those who have entered the path of insight, not those who have entered the fruit of stream-entry.üîΩThus there are four or three persons, not five.

original: 'jig rten 'das kyis srid rtse las //

original: chags bral zhes bya ba la /

analyzed: de ni rang gis gong ma'i gnyen po yin pa'i phyir ro // de'i gong na 'jig rten pa med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la /

original: 'jig rten pa'i lam sa gong mas bsdus pa ni sa gong ma'i gnyen po yin na /üîΩsrid pa'i rtse mo'i gong na sa yod pa'ang ma yin no //

analyzed: dper na 'dod pa'i khams rang gi sa pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams ltar de skye ba dang mthun pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: gang gi gnyen po gang yin pa de la nyon mongs ba rgyas par mi 'gyur te /
translated: Any affliction that is the antidote to a thing does not increase in dependence on that thing,

analyzed: de'i 'grib pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir /
translated: because it is the cause of its decrease.

translated: One does not possess mundane obtainment of freedom from attachment to those eight stages,

analyzed: srid rtse'i byed las rnam grol dang // gong du skyes pa bzhin mi ldan //

translated: As appropriate means as much as is possible.

original: thams cad kyis thams cad du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: thams cad kyis thams cad du ni ma yin no //
translated: That is said, but not by all and to all.
