analyzed: mngon par 'du byed pa yin mod kyi 'di ni lam dang bcas pa mngon par 'du byed pa shin tu che ba'o //
translated: and it is manifest activity. However, this is the great manifest activity with the path.

original: kha cig na re sa 'og ma ni rgod pa mang zhing nye bar zhi ba chung pa'i phyir rags pa'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: kha cig na re sa 'og ma ni rgod pa mang zhing nye bar zhi ba chung pa'i phyir rags pa'o zhes zer ro //
translated: Some say that the lower stage is gross because it has much excitement and little tranquility.

original: ci'i phyir gnas dan lan rab tu mang ba nyid yin zhen gang gnas ngan ni lus dang sems las su mi rung ba nyid de nyon mongs pa dang rjes su mthun pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ci'i phyir gnas dan lan rab tu mang ba nyid yin zhen gang gnas ngan ni lus dang sems las su mi rung ba nyid de nyon mongs pa dang rjes su mthun pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Why is the place of bad destinies so much worse? Because it is the unserviceability of body and mind, which is to say, it is the conformity to the passions.

original: 'di dang mi mthun par gyur pas gya nom pa ma yin pa la rgyu smos pa ni mngon par 'du byed pa chen pos zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'di dang mi mthun par gyur pas gya nom pa ma yin pa la rgyu smos pa ni mngon par 'du byed pa chen pos zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The cause of the non-excellence is stated: ‚Äúbecause of the great effort of the defilements.‚Äù

original: rgod pa chung ngus kyang gya nom pa'i bde ba mi bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgod pa chung ngus kyang gya nom pa'i bde ba mi bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because even a small agitation does not produce an excellent pleasure.

original: gzhan dag na re tha ma ni sdug bsngal ba'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re tha ma ni sdug bsngal ba'o zhes zer ro //
translated: Others say that the last is suffering.

original: rtsig pa stug po lta bur zhes pa ni rtsig pa stug po'i ngo bor ro //
analyzed: rtsig pa stug po lta bur zhes pa ni rtsig pa stug po'i ngo bor ro //
translated: ‚ÄúLike a thick wall‚Äù means like the nature of a thick wall.

original: rtsig pa la nges par mi 'byung ba bzhin du zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rtsig pa la nges par mi 'byung ba bzhin du zhes bya ba la /
translated: ‚ÄúJust as space is not found in a wall‚Äù means:

original: dper na rtsig pa yod na nam mkha' 'am phyogs des non pa'i phyir nges par 'byung ba med /üîΩdpe de bzhin dus de nyid kyis @248a * //
analyzed: dper na rtsig pa yod na nam mkha' 'am phyogs des non pa'i phyir nges par 'byung ba med / dpe de bzhin dus de nyid kyis @248a * //
translated: for example, when there is a wall, space is not found there, because that place is occupied.

original: las nges par mi 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: las nges par mi 'byung ba'o //
translated: In the same way, karma is not found in that reality.

original: gzhan dag na re der nye bar 'tshe ba mang pos 'joms pas de las nges par 'byung ba mthong ba'i phyir rtsig pa stug po lta bu'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re der nye bar 'tshe ba mang pos 'joms pas de las nges par 'byung ba mthong ba'i phyir rtsig pa stug po lta bu'o zhes zer ro //
translated: Others say: It is like a thick wall because one sees that it is an escape from the many harms that destroy it.

original: gzhan dag na re dgos pa chung ngu yang 'bad pa med par zhi ba'i sgo nas bde ba ches khyad par du 'phags pa skyes pa ni gya nom pa'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re dgos pa chung ngu yang 'bad pa med par zhi ba'i sgo nas bde ba ches khyad par du 'phags pa skyes pa ni gya nom pa'o zhes zer ro //
translated: Others say: It is sublime because it is the superior bliss that arises from the door of peace without exertion, even for a small purpose.

original: sa 'og ma'i nye bar 'tshe ba mthong nas nges par de las thar par 'dod pa ni nges par 'byung ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: sa 'og ma'i nye bar 'tshe ba mthong nas nges par de las thar par 'dod pa ni nges par 'byung ba zhes bya ste /
translated: Seeing the harm of lower levels, one definitely wishes to be free from them.

original: de'i phyir yang de dag zhi ba dang rags pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir yang de dag zhi ba dang rags pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa ste /
translated: Therefore, they are called the aspects of peace, coarseness, and so on.

original: yang 'phags pa'i lam bzhin rnam pa khyad par med pa ma yin no //
analyzed: yang 'phags pa'i lam bzhin rnam pa khyad par med pa ma yin no //
translated: They are not like the ƒÅrya path, which is not differentiated by aspect.

original: gal te 'jig rten pa'i bar chad med pa dang rnam par grol ba'i lam rnams kyang 'phags pa'i lam bzhin rnam pa gcig tu gyur te /
analyzed: gal te 'jig rten pa'i bar chad med pa dang rnam par grol ba'i lam rnams kyang 'phags pa'i lam bzhin rnam pa gcig tu gyur te /
translated: If the mundane uninterrupted and liberated paths were the same as the ƒÅrya path in terms of aspect,

original: zhi ba dang rags pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa nyid ma yin pa de lta na 'jig rten pa'i lam nye bar bzung nas mya ngan las 'das par 'gro ba la lam zhes brjod de /
analyzed: zhi ba dang rags pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa nyid ma yin pa de lta na 'jig rten pa'i lam nye bar bzung nas mya ngan las 'das par 'gro ba la lam zhes brjod de /
translated: If it were not so, then, taking the mundane path, one would not be able to say that one is on the path to nirvana,

original: 'ga' la yang mi brten pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'ga' la yang mi brten pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because one would not be relying on anything.

original: gang gi phyir de ni ma yin te dza loo ka bzhin gnas gzhan gtong bas so //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ni ma yin te dza loo ka bzhin gnas gzhan gtong bas so //
translated: But that is not so, because, like a potter, one abandons one state and enters another.

original: de'i phyir rnam par sun 'byin pa'i dngos po la dmigs pa ni rags pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa yin la /
analyzed: de'i phyir rnam par sun 'byin pa'i dngos po la dmigs pa ni rags pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa yin la /
translated: Therefore, the object of the counteragent is the aspect of coarseness, etc.

original: bar chad med pa'i lam ni bzlog pas bsam pa'i dngos po la dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: bar chad med pa'i lam ni bzlog pas bsam pa'i dngos po la dmigs pa'o //
translated: The uninterrupted path is the object of the counteragent, and the aspect of the object to be eliminated.

original: zhi ba la sogs pa'i rnam pa rnam par grol ba'i lam du rnam par bzhag ste /
analyzed: zhi ba la sogs pa'i rnam pa rnam par grol ba'i lam du rnam par bzhag ste /
translated: The path of liberation is the aspect of calmness, etc.

original: gnyen po rnams la dmigs pa dang rnam pa'i dbye ba med do //
analyzed: gnyen po rnams la dmigs pa dang rnam pa'i dbye ba med do //
translated: There is no distinction of object and aspect in the case of the counteragent.

original: mthong ba'i lam bzhin du aa pya ga t'a ba she su ru bhi pra ya ba sha da pi kal pa ya tatta tho tva tte ri ti /
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam bzhin du aa pya ga t'a ba she su ru bhi pra ya ba sha da pi kal pa ya tatta tho tva tte ri ti /
translated: Just as in the case of the path of vision, so in the path of cultivation, there is the distinction of the path of immediate succession and the path of liberation, because of the distinction of the object and the aspect.

original: ci'i phyir zad pa shes pa'i mjug thogs mi skye zhe na des lhag par grol pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ci'i phyir zad pa shes pa'i mjug thogs mi skye zhe na des lhag par grol pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Why does the knowledge of nonarising not arise immediately after the knowledge of elimination? Because it is liberated from the superior.

original: zad pa shes pa kho nas de dang lhan cig de thob pa dang 'dra ba nyid du 'dus byas kyi 'bras bu bsdus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zad pa shes pa kho nas de dang lhan cig de thob pa dang 'dra ba nyid du 'dus byas kyi 'bras bu bsdus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The knowledge of elimination itself is superior, because it includes the result of conditioned states that are similar to it.

original: yang ci'i phyir de skye ba shes pa sngar mi skye zhen zad pa shes pa la rag lus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang ci'i phyir de skye ba shes pa sngar mi skye zhen zad pa shes pa la rag lus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Why does the knowledge of birth not arise prior to the knowledge of elimination? Because it is dependent on the knowledge of elimination.

original: de skye ba nyid kyis shes te mi skye ba'i phyir phung po lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su 'jug pa la gegs su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de skye ba nyid kyis shes te mi skye ba'i phyir phung po lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su 'jug pa la gegs su 'gyur ro //
translated: The knowledge of birth itself would be knowledge, because it would enter the realm of nirvana without remainder.

original: gang shes pas shes pa brda sprod par byed pa dang rjes su mthun pa dgra bcom pa thams @248b cad kyi thun mong ba de nyid mi skye ba shes pa ste lhag par grol ba sngon du skye'o //
analyzed: gang shes pas shes pa brda sprod par byed pa dang rjes su mthun pa dgra bcom pa thams @248b cad kyi thun mong ba de nyid mi skye ba shes pa ste lhag par grol ba sngon du skye'o //
translated: The knowledge of nonarising is the knowledge that is the cause of the knowledge of elimination, and it is common to all arhats. It is superior, because it arises prior to the knowledge of elimination.

original: rdo rje lta bu'i mjug thogs su mi skye ba shes pa mi slob pa'i yang dag pa'i lta ba 'am zad pa shes pa ste mi skye ba shes pa'i dang po nyid du thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rdo rje lta bu'i mjug thogs su mi skye ba shes pa mi slob pa'i yang dag pa'i lta ba 'am zad pa shes pa ste mi skye ba shes pa'i dang po nyid du thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the knowledge of nonarising is attained for the first time as the correct view of no more learning or the knowledge of elimination immediately after the vajra like samadhi.

original: yongs su nyams pa srid pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: yongs su nyams pa srid pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la /
translated: Because complete degeneration is possible.

original: 'di ni nyon mongs pa skye ba srid pa yin no zhes ston to //
analyzed: 'di ni nyon mongs pa skye ba srid pa yin no zhes ston to //
translated: This shows that it is possible for affliction to arise.

original: mi skye ba shes pa rdo rje lta bu'i mjug thogs su thob po /
analyzed: mi skye ba shes pa rdo rje lta bu'i mjug thogs su thob po /
translated: The knowledge of nonarising is attained immediately after the vajra like samadhi.

original: mi g-yo ba'i chos can gyi skad cig ma la zad pa shes pa dang skad cig ma gzhan la ni snga ma las rab tu gyur pa'i mi skye ba shes pa rnam pa gnyis 'dis bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: mi g-yo ba'i chos can gyi skad cig ma la zad pa shes pa dang skad cig ma gzhan la ni snga ma las rab tu gyur pa'i mi skye ba shes pa rnam pa gnyis 'dis bshad pa yin no //
translated: This explains that the knowledge of elimination is attained in the moment of the immutable arhat and the knowledge of nonarising is attained in another moment, which is superior to the former.

original: de la ni mi skye ba shes pa'i mjug thogs su mi skye ba shes pa nyid skye ste /
analyzed: de la ni mi skye ba shes pa'i mjug thogs su mi skye ba shes pa nyid skye ste /
translated: The knowledge of nonarising arises immediately after the knowledge of nonarising.

original: mi slob pa'i yang dag pa'i lta ba'o //
analyzed: mi slob pa'i yang dag pa'i lta ba'o //
translated: It is the correct view of no more learning.

original: gang gi phyir zad pa shes pa ni de ni dgra bcom pa thams cad la zhes pa ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir zad pa shes pa ni de ni dgra bcom pa thams cad la zhes pa ste /
translated: Because the knowledge of elimination is common to all arhats,

original: rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin gyi mjug thogs dgra bcom pa thams cad kyis mi slob ba'i yang dag pa'i lta ba 'thob po //
analyzed: rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin gyi mjug thogs dgra bcom pa thams cad kyis mi slob ba'i yang dag pa'i lta ba 'thob po //
translated: Immediately after the vajra like samadhi, all arhats obtain the correct view of the adept.

original: kha cig gis res 'ga' mngon du byed de /
analyzed: kha cig gis res 'ga' mngon du byed de /
translated: Some manifest it sometimes.

original: sngar ji skad bshad pa bzhin des nyon mongs pa yang dag par zhi ba'i sgo nas zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sngar ji skad bshad pa bzhin des nyon mongs pa yang dag par zhi ba'i sgo nas zhes bya ba la /
translated: As previously explained, by means of the complete pacification of the afflictions.

original: kha cig na re /
analyzed: kha cig na re /
translated: Some say:

original: khams dang 'gro ba dang skye gnas rnams su 'khor ba'i ngal ba bsal bas na dge sbyong ngo zhes zer ro //
analyzed: khams dang 'gro ba dang skye gnas rnams su 'khor ba'i ngal ba bsal bas na dge sbyong ngo zhes zer ro //
translated: They are ascetics because they remove the fatigue of samsara in the realms, destinies, and birth processes.

original: slob dpon ni nyon mongs pa zhi bar byed pa'i phyir zhes so //
analyzed: slob dpon ni nyon mongs pa zhi bar byed pa'i phyir zhes so //
translated: The Master says: They are ascetics because they pacify the afflictions.

original: de'i ngo bo ni dge sbyong gi tshul te /
analyzed: de'i ngo bo ni dge sbyong gi tshul te /
translated: The nature of that is the nature of an ascetic.

original: de'i ngo bor byed pas de'i ngo bo ste /
analyzed: de'i ngo bor byed pas de'i ngo bo ste /
translated: It is the nature of that because it is made into the nature of that.

original: 'dis nyon mongs pa dang bral bar byed cing sel bar byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'dis nyon mongs pa dang bral bar byed cing sel bar byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is the nature of that because it causes the separation from and removal of the afflictions.

original: so so skye bo ni gtan du zhi bar byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: so so skye bo ni gtan du zhi bar byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la /
translated: Ordinary beings are not pacified forever.

original: so so'i skye bo ni ci yang med pa'i skye mched kyi bar las 'dod chags dang bral ba yang don dam pa'i dge sbyong ma yin te /
analyzed: so so'i skye bo ni ci yang med pa'i skye mched kyi bar las 'dod chags dang bral ba yang don dam pa'i dge sbyong ma yin te /
translated: Ordinary beings who are free from attachment to the base of nothingness and below are not true spiritual practitioners.

original: nyes pa'i 'phro dang bcas pa'i phyir dang / nyes pa bsam gtan ma zhi ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyes pa'i 'phro dang bcas pa'i phyir dang / nyes pa bsam gtan ma zhi ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they possess the remainder of faults and because they possess faults that are not pacified by the absorptions.

original: de dag kyang mdo las rnam pa bzhir gsungs so zhes bya ba ni rgyun tu zhugs pa'i 'bras bu nas dgra bcom pa nyid kyi bar ro //
analyzed: de dag kyang mdo las rnam pa bzhir gsungs so zhes bya ba ni rgyun tu zhugs pa'i 'bras bu nas dgra bcom pa nyid kyi bar ro //
translated: The sutras state that they are of four types.

original: de la rgyun tu zhugs pa'i 'bras bu lam la rjes su shes pa ni 'dus byas so //
analyzed: de la rgyun tu zhugs pa'i 'bras bu lam la rjes su shes pa ni 'dus byas so //
translated: The path of subsequent knowledge of the result of stream entry is conditioned.

original: khams gsum pa'i mthong bas spang bar bya ba spangs pa ni 'dus ma byas so //üîΩlan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu lam la rjes su shes pa rnam par grol @249a * //
analyzed: khams gsum pa'i mthong bas spang bar bya ba spangs pa ni 'dus ma byas so // lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu lam la rjes su shes pa rnam par grol @249a * //
translated: The abandonment of objects to be abandoned by the path of seeing of the three realms is unconditioned.

original: ba'i lam drug pa ni 'dus byas so //
analyzed: ba'i lam drug pa ni 'dus byas so //
translated: The sixth liberated path of subsequent knowledge of the result of once return is conditioned.

original: 'dus ma byas ni sngar bshad pa ste /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas ni sngar bshad pa ste /
translated: Unconditioned states are as previously explained.üîΩThe path of subsequent knowledge of the result of nonreturn is conditioned.

original: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i bsgom pas spang bar bya ba rnam pa drug spangs pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i bsgom pas spang bar bya ba rnam pa drug spangs pa'o //
translated: It is the abandonment of the six types of objects to be abandoned by the path of meditation that exist in the desire realm.

original: phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu lam la rjes su shes pa rnam par grol ba'i lam dgu pa ni 'dus byas so //
analyzed: phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu lam la rjes su shes pa rnam par grol ba'i lam dgu pa ni 'dus byas so //
translated: The ninth liberated path, the path of subsequent knowledge of the truth of the path, is conditioned.

original: 'dus ma byas ni sngar bshad pa ste 'dod pa na spyod pa'i bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa'i rnam pa chung ngu spangs pa'o //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas ni sngar bshad pa ste 'dod pa na spyod pa'i bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa'i rnam pa chung ngu spangs pa'o //
translated: Unconditioned states are as previously explained.

original: dgra bcom pa nyid kyis zad pa shes pa dang mi skye ba shes pa'am mi slob pa'i yang dag pa'i lta pa 'dus byas so //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa nyid kyis zad pa shes pa dang mi skye ba shes pa'am mi slob pa'i yang dag pa'i lta pa 'dus byas so //
translated: The knowledge of elimination and the knowledge of nonarising of an arhat or the uncontaminated view of one in higher training are conditioned.

original: khams gsum pa'i mthong ba dang bsgom pas spang bar bya ba spangs pa ni 'dus ma byas so //
analyzed: khams gsum pa'i mthong ba dang bsgom pas spang bar bya ba spangs pa ni 'dus ma byas so //
translated: The abandonment of objects to be abandoned by the path of seeing and objects to be abandoned by the path of meditation of the three realms is unconditioned.

original: mdo sde pa rnams na re /
analyzed: mdo sde pa rnams na re /
translated: Sautrantikas say:üîΩThe sutras state that the results of training in virtue are unconditioned.üîΩThe sutra states:

original: mdo las dge sbyong tshul gyi 'bras bu rnams 'dus ma byas nyid du gsungs te 'di ltar rgyun tu zhugs pa'i 'bras bu gang zhe na /
analyzed: mdo las dge sbyong tshul gyi 'bras bu rnams 'dus ma byas nyid du gsungs te 'di ltar rgyun tu zhugs pa'i 'bras bu gang zhe na /
translated: What is the result of stream entry?

original: kun tu sbyor ba gsum spangs pa gang yin pa'o zhes pa nas drag bcom pa nyid gang zhe na /
analyzed: kun tu sbyor ba gsum spangs pa gang yin pa'o zhes pa nas drag bcom pa nyid gang zhe na /
translated: It is the abandonment of the three fetters.üîΩWhat is the state of having destroyed the intense?

original: 'dod chags zad par spangs pa gang yin pa dang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: 'dod chags zad par spangs pa gang yin pa dang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: It is the abandonment of the exhaustion of attachment.

original: spangs pa ni 'dus byas kyi skyon las grol ba'i phyir dang de la mngon par 'dod pa bskyed pa'i phyir dge tshul gyi 'bras bu ni 'dus ma byas rnams kho na'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: spangs pa ni 'dus byas kyi skyon las grol ba'i phyir dang de la mngon par 'dod pa bskyed pa'i phyir dge tshul gyi 'bras bu ni 'dus ma byas rnams kho na'o zhes zer ro //
translated: Because it is liberated from the faults of conditioned states and because it generates manifest interest in it, the result of the state of being a novice is unconditioned states alone.üîΩBecause it is the natural outflow and the result of conscious effort of the uninterrupted path.

original: de'i rgyu mthun pa dang skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la rnam par grol ba'i lam ni bar chad med lam gyi rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu yin te de dang 'dra ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i rgyu mthun pa dang skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la rnam par grol ba'i lam ni bar chad med lam gyi rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu yin te de dang 'dra ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The path of liberation is the natural outflow result of the uninterrupted path because it is similar to it.

original: skyas bu byed pa'i 'bras bu yin te de'i stobs kyis bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skyas bu byed pa'i 'bras bu yin te de'i stobs kyis bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the result of conscious effort because it is generated by the power of that.

original: de'i spang bya nyon mongs pa rnams spangs pa yang brgyad cu rtsa dgu ste /
analyzed: de'i spang bya nyon mongs pa rnams spangs pa yang brgyad cu rtsa dgu ste /
translated: The afflictions that are to be abandoned by that are also ninety-eight.

original: skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu 'dus ma byas rnams kyang dge sbyong tshul gyi 'bras bu yin no //
analyzed: skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu 'dus ma byas rnams kyang dge sbyong tshul gyi 'bras bu yin no //
translated: The unconditioned results of the person‚Äôs action are also the result of the way of virtuous endeavor.

original: spang ba'i thob pa 'gog pa dang thob pa gcod pa'i phyir rnam par grol ba'i lam dgu pa yang dge sbyong gi tshul te /
analyzed: spang ba'i thob pa 'gog pa dang thob pa gcod pa'i phyir rnam par grol ba'i lam dgu pa yang dge sbyong gi tshul te /
translated: The ninth liberated path is the way of virtuous endeavor because it severs the obtainment of the obtainment of cessation.

original: de dag kyang bar chad med pa'i lam gyi rgyu mthun pa dang skyes bu'i byed pa'i 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: de dag kyang bar chad med pa'i lam gyi rgyu mthun pa dang skyes bu'i byed pa'i 'bras bu'o //
translated: That is the result of natural outflow and the result of conscious effort of the uninterrupted path.

original: de ltar na bar chad med pa'i lam 'dus byas rnams dge sbyong tshul gyi 'bras bur thal bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar na bar chad med pa'i lam 'dus byas rnams dge sbyong tshul gyi 'bras bur thal bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: Thus it follows that conditioned states of the uninterrupted path are the result of the way of virtuous endeavor.

original: 'di ni de ltar ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni de ltar ma yin te /
translated: That is not so,

original: bar chad med pa'i lam gyi dbang gis rnam par grol ba'i lam skye zhing des de @249b skye ba'i gegs bsal ba'i phyir de'i mjug thogs su nges par skye'o //
analyzed: bar chad med pa'i lam gyi dbang gis rnam par grol ba'i lam skye zhing des de @249b skye ba'i gegs bsal ba'i phyir de'i mjug thogs su nges par skye'o //
translated: because the liberated path arises by the power of the uninterrupted path and it definitely arises immediately after it because it eliminates the obstruction to its arising.

original: rnam par grol ba'i lam gyi dbang gis bar chad med pa'i lam skye ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam par grol ba'i lam gyi dbang gis bar chad med pa'i lam skye ba ni ma yin no //
translated: The uninterrupted path does not arise by the power of the liberated path.

original: yod pa rnams kyang dus gzhan du sbyor bas gzhan gyi skye ba srid pa dang / de ltar shin tu mi 'thad pa'i phyir dang / bar chad med lam thams cad rnam par grol ba'i lam gyi 'bras bur 'gyur ba ma yin pa'i phyir 'dir thal bar 'gyur ba med do //üîΩde lta na 'o na zhes bya ba ni gal te dge sbyong tshul gyi 'bras bu rnams brgyad cu rtsa dgu yin na'o //
analyzed: yod pa rnams kyang dus gzhan du sbyor bas gzhan gyi skye ba srid pa dang / de ltar shin tu mi 'thad pa'i phyir dang / bar chad med lam thams cad rnam par grol ba'i lam gyi 'bras bur 'gyur ba ma yin pa'i phyir 'dir thal bar 'gyur ba med do // de lta na 'o na zhes bya ba ni gal te dge sbyong tshul gyi 'bras bu rnams brgyad cu rtsa dgu yin na'o //
translated: But this is not the case here, because it is quite unacceptable and because not all uninterrupted paths are results of the liberated paths.

original: sangs rgyas kyis gsungs pa kha bskang bar bya dgos par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyis gsungs pa kha bskang bar bya dgos par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If that is so, then the Buddha‚Äôs statement would have to be supplemented.

original: des gsungs pa las tha dad pa'i 'bras bu yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des gsungs pa las tha dad pa'i 'bras bu yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there would be results that are not included in the Buddha‚Äôs statement.

original: ched du gtad nas skong ba ni kha skong ba ste /
analyzed: ched du gtad nas skong ba ni kha skong ba ste /
translated: Supplementation is the addition of what is not included.

original: kha nye bar bskang zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: kha nye bar bskang zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It means the addition of what is not included.

original: bya mi dgos te mdo las bstan pa ni dgongs pa can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bya mi dgos te mdo las bstan pa ni dgongs pa can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not necessary to supplement the sutra, because the sutra statement is indirect.

original: 'dir dgongs pa gang zhig yin zhe na //
analyzed: 'dir dgongs pa gang zhig yin zhe na //
translated: What is the indirect statement here?

original: 'bras bu mang po zhig yod mod kyi //
analyzed: 'bras bu mang po zhig yod mod kyi //
translated: There are many results,üîΩ

original: 'bras bu bzhir gzhag pa ni rgyu lnga srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu bzhir gzhag pa ni rgyu lnga srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: There are many fruits, but four fruits are established because five causes are possible.

original: zhugs pa dang 'bras bu'i lam btang ba dang thob pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhugs pa dang 'bras bu'i lam btang ba dang thob pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
translated: Because one who is a candidate for the fruit and one who has attained the fruit abandon and obtain the path.

original: sngar gyi lam btang bas zhugs pa'i lam btang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sngar gyi lam btang bas zhugs pa'i lam btang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because one who is a candidate for the fruit abandons the path of a candidate for the fruit.

original: sngar med pa'i lam thob pas 'bras bu'i lam thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sngar med pa'i lam thob pas 'bras bu'i lam thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because one who has attained the fruit obtains the path of one who has attained the fruit.

original: 'bras bu dang po la zhugs par 'dod pa la phal cher 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / gnyis pa dang gsum pa la zhugs pa dag la yang rgyu lnga po 'di dag med de /
analyzed: 'bras bu dang po la zhugs par 'dod pa la phal cher 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / gnyis pa dang gsum pa la zhugs pa dag la yang rgyu lnga po 'di dag med de /
translated: One who is a candidate for the first fruit, one who is free from attachment to the desire realm, and one who is a candidate for the second and third fruits do not have these five causes.

original: mthong ba'i lam la gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam la gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they abide in the path of seeing.

original: gnyis pa dang / gsum pa dang bzhi pa la zhugs pa rnams la ni dang po gsum med kyi /
analyzed: gnyis pa dang / gsum pa dang bzhi pa la zhugs pa rnams la ni dang po gsum med kyi /
translated: Those who are candidates for the second, third, and fourth fruits do not have the first three causes.

original: shes pa brgyad thob pa dang rnam pa bcu drug thob pa gnyis ni yod de bsgom pa'i lam la gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes pa brgyad thob pa dang rnam pa bcu drug thob pa gnyis ni yod de bsgom pa'i lam la gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: But they do have the last two causes: obtaining the eight knowledges and obtaining the sixteen aspects, because they abide in the path of meditation.

original: de ltar 'bras bu gzhan las yongs su nyams pas 'bras bu dang po las kyang yongs su nyams par thal bar 'gyur ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar 'bras bu gzhan las yongs su nyams pas 'bras bu dang po las kyang yongs su nyams par thal bar 'gyur ba ma yin no //
translated: Thus, it is not the case that one falls from the first fruit by falling from the other fruits.

original: 'bras bu snga ma thob pa nye bar 'joms pa dang / 'bras bu phyi ma thob pa na spangs pa thams cad kyi thob pa gcig 'thad pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'bras bu snga ma thob pa nye bar 'joms pa dang / 'bras bu phyi ma thob pa na spangs pa thams cad kyi thob pa gcig 'thad pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: Because when one obtains the former fruit, one obtains the obtainment of all that is abandoned by the latter fruit.

original: 'di ni de lta bu ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni de lta bu ma yin te /
translated: This is not so,

original: yongs su nyams pa'i dus kho nar de thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yongs su nyams pa'i dus kho nar de thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because one obtains the former fruit at the time of falling from it.

original: 'bras bu gzhan thob pa ma nyams @250a * //
analyzed: 'bras bu gzhan thob pa ma nyams @250a * //
translated: The noble ones who obtain the other fruits do not fall from the former fruit.

original: par 'dzin pa 'phags pas 'bras bu snga ma thob pa de dang bral ba na bden pa snang ba'i thabs su mun pa la phyogs pa lta bu'i tshul gyis rgyud rjes su 'ching bar byed de /
analyzed: par 'dzin pa 'phags pas 'bras bu snga ma thob pa de dang bral ba na bden pa snang ba'i thabs su mun pa la phyogs pa lta bu'i tshul gyis rgyud rjes su 'ching bar byed de /
translated: When they obtain the latter fruit, they bind their mindstreams with the former fruit, as if they were turning toward darkness as a means of illuminating the truths.

original: 'bras bu gzhan bzhi nyid rnam par gzhag pa'i rnam pa sems la bzhag nas grag go zhes bya ba ni ma rangs pa'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu gzhan bzhi nyid rnam par gzhag pa'i rnam pa sems la bzhag nas grag go zhes bya ba ni ma rangs pa'o //
translated: It is said that the four other fruits are posited in terms of the aspects that are placed in the mind.

original: de yang nyon mongs pa'i dngos po yongs su gtugs par spangs pa'i gnas skabs la dgongs nas 'bras bu dang po gsungs so //
analyzed: de yang nyon mongs pa'i dngos po yongs su gtugs par spangs pa'i gnas skabs la dgongs nas 'bras bu dang po gsungs so //
translated: The first result is declared with the intention of the state of complete abandonment of the things of affliction.

original: mi dge ba'i rnam par rig byed kun nas slong ba'i nyon mongs pa spangs pa la dgongs pa nas gnyis pa gsungs so //
analyzed: mi dge ba'i rnam par rig byed kun nas slong ba'i nyon mongs pa spangs pa la dgongs pa nas gnyis pa gsungs so //
translated: The second is declared with the intention of the abandonment of the affliction that motivates unwholesome informative action.

original: mi dge ba yongs su gtugs par spangs pa las gsum pa'o //
analyzed: mi dge ba yongs su gtugs par spangs pa las gsum pa'o //
translated: The third is from the complete abandonment of unwholesome.

original: nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs pa la dgongs nas bzhi pa gsungs so //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs pa la dgongs nas bzhi pa gsungs so //
translated: The fourth is declared with the intention of the abandonment of all afflictions.

original: kha cig na re shes pa rnam pa dag khyad par med pa'i phyir gang yang rung pa gnyis dag go zhes zer ro //
analyzed: kha cig na re shes pa rnam pa dag khyad par med pa'i phyir gang yang rung pa gnyis dag go zhes zer ro //
translated: Some say: Because there is no difference in the aspects of the cognitions, any two are suitable.

original: gzhan dag na re de yang de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re de yang de lta ma yin te /
translated: Others say: That is not so.

original: chos dang rjes su shes pa dag so sor rnam pa bcu drug yin pa'i phyir bden pa re re'i rnam pa dag kyang chos dang rjes su shes pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: chos dang rjes su shes pa dag so sor rnam pa bcu drug yin pa'i phyir bden pa re re'i rnam pa dag kyang chos dang rjes su shes pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because the cognitions of the truths are sixteen in number, each aspect of each truth is a cognition of the truths and a subsequent cognition.

original: gnyi ga ma bzung par ma lus pa gzung ba ma yin par shes te de'i phyir gnyi ga ma smos so zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gnyi ga ma bzung par ma lus pa gzung ba ma yin par shes te de'i phyir gnyi ga ma smos so zhes zer ro //
translated: Since the non-apprehension of both is known to be the non-apprehension of all, therefore, neither is mentioned.

original: gzhan dag na re gnas skabs 'di dag tu rnal 'byor pa rnams mchog tu yid brtan pa de las nyams te dus bya ba srid pa'i phyir de nyid 'bras bu nyid du ma gsungs so zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re gnas skabs 'di dag tu rnal 'byor pa rnams mchog tu yid brtan pa de las nyams te dus bya ba srid pa'i phyir de nyid 'bras bu nyid du ma gsungs so zhes zer ro //
translated: Others say that in these states, the yogis and yoginis are not supremely confident, because it is possible that they may fall away from that. Therefore, it is not said that they are results.

original: gzhan dag na re 'di nyid ni rim pa bzhin ngan song dang de'i rgyu mi dang lha'i 'gro ba ste ;
analyzed: gzhan dag na re 'di nyid ni rim pa bzhin ngan song dang de'i rgyu mi dang lha'i 'gro ba ste ;
translated: Others say that these are the destinies of humans and gods, and the lower realms, respectively, which are the causes of those.

original: rim pas rab tu phye ba'i phyir 'dir 'dod chags la sogs pa chen pos ni ngan song du 'gro ba yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: rim pas rab tu phye ba'i phyir 'dir 'dod chags la sogs pa chen pos ni ngan song du 'gro ba yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: They say that in order, those with great attachment, etc., go to the lower realms.

original: 'jig rten pa'i lam gyis thob pa'i 'bras bu gnyis zhes bya ba ni lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i lam gyis thob pa'i 'bras bu gnyis zhes bya ba ni lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'o //
translated: The two results obtained by the mundane path are the result of once-returner and the result of non-returner.

original: de la ni zhes rgyas par 'byung ba ni 'di skad du de dag ni zag pa med pa'i lam gyi 'bras bu spang pa ches mang pa yin gyis 'jig rten pa'i lam gyi 'bras bu nyid ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de la ni zhes rgyas par 'byung ba ni 'di skad du de dag ni zag pa med pa'i lam gyi 'bras bu spang pa ches mang pa yin gyis 'jig rten pa'i lam gyi 'bras bu nyid ni ma yin te /
translated: but not the results of the mundane path.üîΩThey are the results of the path of seeing,

original: de dag gis mthong ba'i lam gyi 'bras bu spangs pa bsdus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag gis mthong ba'i lam gyi 'bras bu spangs pa bsdus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they subsume the abandonment that is the result of the path of seeing.

original: de'i phyir de dag ni dge sbyong gi tshul gyi 'bras bu @250b yin no zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir de dag ni dge sbyong gi tshul gyi 'bras bu @250b yin no zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore it is said that they are the results of the system of training in virtue.

original: thams cad kyi zhes bya ba ni mthong ba'i lam gyi 'bras bu dang / bsgom pa'i lam gyi 'bras bu'i 'o //
analyzed: thams cad kyi zhes bya ba ni mthong ba'i lam gyi 'bras bu dang / bsgom pa'i lam gyi 'bras bu'i 'o //
translated: All refers to the results of the path of seeing and the results of the path of meditation.üîΩBecause they are subsumed by the single obtainment of that result,

original: thob pa de'i 'bras bur bsdus pa gcig snyed pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni thob pa lan cig phyir 'ong ba dang phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bus bsdus pa gcig snyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thob pa de'i 'bras bur bsdus pa gcig snyed pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni thob pa lan cig phyir 'ong ba dang phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bus bsdus pa gcig snyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are subsumed by the single obtainment of the result of once return and nonreturn.

original: de nyid kyi phyir mdo las zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir mdo las zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
translated: Therefore the sutra states:

original: gang gi phyir mthong ba'i lam dang / bsgom pa'i lam gyi 'bras bu thams cad kyi thob pa de'i 'bras bu bsdus pa gcig snyed pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir mthong ba'i lam dang / bsgom pa'i lam gyi 'bras bu thams cad kyi thob pa de'i 'bras bu bsdus pa gcig snyed pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because the obtainment of all results of the path of seeing and the path of meditation is subsumed by the single obtainment of their result.üîΩTherefore a sutra states:

original: de'i phyir mdo las lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu gang zhe na zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de'i phyir mdo las lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu gang zhe na zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ngo //
translated: What is the result of once return?

original: de lta ma yin na mthar gyis pa dang phal cher la 'dod chags dang bral bas kun tu sbyor ba gsum sngar spangs zin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na mthar gyis pa dang phal cher la 'dod chags dang bral bas kun tu sbyor ba gsum sngar spangs zin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If that were not so, then the serial abandoner and the one liberated from three attachments would have previously abandoned the three fetters.

original: 'dod pa la 'dod chags dang bral bas 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug gi kun tu sbyor ba gsum spangs par gsungs pa dang / tha ma'i cha dang mthun pa'i kun tu sbyor ba lnga spangs par gsungs pa yang don med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dod pa la 'dod chags dang bral bas 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug gi kun tu sbyor ba gsum spangs par gsungs pa dang / tha ma'i cha dang mthun pa'i kun tu sbyor ba lnga spangs par gsungs pa yang don med par 'gyur ro //
translated: It would be meaningless to state that those free from attachment to the desire realm abandon the three fetters of attachment, aversion and delusion and to state that they abandon the five lower level fetters.

original: bral ba'i thob pa zag pa med pas zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bral ba'i thob pa zag pa med pas zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Obtaining freedom through uncontaminated statesüîΩThe Abhidharmakosa states,

original: 'jig rten pa yi chags bral ba'i //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa yi chags bral ba'i //
translated: Those free from attachment to the desire realm

original: 'phags la bral ba'i thob rnam gnyis //
analyzed: 'phags la bral ba'i thob rnam gnyis //
translated: The Abhidharmakosa states,

original: zhes bshad de /
analyzed: zhes bshad de /
translated: Two types of obtainment of separation exist for the aryas.

original: de'i phyir 'jig rten pa'i lam gyi 'bras bu spangs pa de la bral pa'i thob pa zag pa med pa brgya dang 'dra ba dag skye la de dag gis de'i spangs pa 'dzin par byed do //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'jig rten pa'i lam gyi 'bras bu spangs pa de la bral pa'i thob pa zag pa med pa brgya dang 'dra ba dag skye la de dag gis de'i spangs pa 'dzin par byed do //
translated: Therefore, the obtainment of separation from the result of the mundane path is similar to the uncontaminated obtainment of the hundred and sixty four types of abandonment and they maintain that abandonment.

original: de'i stobs kyis zhes bya ba'i thob pa zag pa med pa'i stobs kyis so //
analyzed: de'i stobs kyis zhes bya ba'i thob pa zag pa med pa'i stobs kyis so //
translated: By the power of that means by the power of the uncontaminated obtainment.

original: de ma yin na 'jig rten pa'i yongs su nyams pa ltar 'chi bar 'gyur ba zhig na yongs su mnyam pa de ni 'chi ba med ces 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ma yin na 'jig rten pa'i yongs su nyams pa ltar 'chi bar 'gyur ba zhig na yongs su mnyam pa de ni 'chi ba med ces 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: If that were not so, then like the degeneration of the mundane path, one would die.

original: de nyid tshangs tshul tshangs pa yi //
analyzed: de nyid tshangs tshul tshangs pa yi //
translated: That itself is the Brahma wheel of the Brahmins.

original: 'khor lo zhes bya ba la kun rdzob yongs su bzung na dge sbyong gzhan dang bram ze gzhan te /
analyzed: 'khor lo zhes bya ba la kun rdzob yongs su bzung na dge sbyong gzhan dang bram ze gzhan te /
translated: If the conventional is taken as the wheel, then other ascetics and other Brahmins.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said,

original: dge sbyong rnams dang bram ze rnams //
analyzed: dge sbyong rnams dang bram ze rnams //
translated: Ascetics and Brahmins

original: lam 'gro rnams dang smod pa rnams //
analyzed: lam 'gro rnams dang smod pa rnams //
translated: who travel the path and who disparage

original: zhes so // don dam pa yongs su bzung na dge sbyong nyid bram ze ste /
analyzed: zhes so // don dam pa yongs su bzung na dge sbyong nyid bram ze ste /
translated: If one grasps the ultimate, one is a true ascetic and a true brahmin.

original: de skad du yang 'dir dang po 'di ni ji srid bzhi pa'i bar dge sbyong ste /
analyzed: de skad du yang 'dir dang po 'di ni ji srid bzhi pa'i bar dge sbyong ste /
translated: Thus, in this regard, one is an ascetic from the first stage up to the fourth stage.

original: 'di las phyi rol pa la dge sbyong bram ze yod pa ma yin no //üîΩ@251a * // zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'di las phyi rol pa la dge sbyong bram ze yod pa ma yin no // @251a * // zhes gsungs so //
translated: Outside of this, there are no ascetics or brahmins.

original: 'dis sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams zhi bar byed pa'i phyir dge sbyong ngo //
analyzed: 'dis sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams zhi bar byed pa'i phyir dge sbyong ngo //
translated: He is an ascetic because he pacifies evil, nonvirtuous dharmas.

original: 'dis sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams spangs pas na tshangs pa'o //üîΩdge sbyong dang tshangs pa'i mtshan nyid thun mong du ni dge sbyong nyid tshangs pa ste /
analyzed: 'dis sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams spangs pas na tshangs pa'o // dge sbyong dang tshangs pa'i mtshan nyid thun mong du ni dge sbyong nyid tshangs pa ste /
translated: He is a brahmin because he abandons evil, nonvirtuous dharmas.üîΩThe characteristics of an ascetic and a brahmin are common to both.

original: tshangs pa'i dngos po ni mtshungs pa'i tshul lo //
analyzed: tshangs pa'i dngos po ni mtshungs pa'i tshul lo //
translated: The state of a brahmin is the same as the state of an ascetic.

original: zag pa med pa'i lam dang ldan pa'i phyir tshangs par gyur pa yin te /
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i lam dang ldan pa'i phyir tshangs par gyur pa yin te /
translated: He is a brahmin because he possesses the uncontaminated path.

original: dge sbyong gi tshul kho na mtshungs pa'i tshul lo //
analyzed: dge sbyong gi tshul kho na mtshungs pa'i tshul lo //
translated: The state of an ascetic is the same as the state of a brahmin.

original: tshangs pa'i tshul bla na med pa dang ldan pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: tshangs pa'i tshul bla na med pa dang ldan pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Because it possesses the unsurpassed method of Brahma.

original: bla na med pa'i zag pa med pa'i lam dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bla na med pa'i zag pa med pa'i lam dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This means that it possesses the unsurpassed uncontaminated path.

original: de 'di'i yin pas 'khor lo ste mngon par 'brel pa gang gis zhe na /
analyzed: de 'di'i yin pas 'khor lo ste mngon par 'brel pa gang gis zhe na /
translated: What is its wheel?

original: de'i phyir des bskor ba'i phyir zhes smos so //üîΩmyur bar 'gro phyir rtsibs sogs kyis //
analyzed: de'i phyir des bskor ba'i phyir zhes smos so // myur bar 'gro phyir rtsibs sogs kyis //
translated: Therefore, it is said that it is turned by that.üîΩBecause it moves quickly, it has spokes, etc.

original: zhes bya ba ni myur bar 'gro ba la sogs pa'i phyir dang / rtsibs la sogs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni myur bar 'gro ba la sogs pa'i phyir dang / rtsibs la sogs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This means that it moves quickly, etc., and has spokes, etc.

original: 'di ni mthong ba'i lam 'khor lo rin po che dang chos mthun pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni mthong ba'i lam 'khor lo rin po che dang chos mthun pa yin te /
translated: This is the path of seeing, which is similar to the precious wheel.

original: de la 'dis rim pas bgrod par byed pas sam yang nges par bsod nams kyi rim pa bzhin myur bar 'gro zhing 'gro bas 'khor lo ste /
analyzed: de la 'dis rim pas bgrod par byed pas sam yang nges par bsod nams kyi rim pa bzhin myur bar 'gro zhing 'gro bas 'khor lo ste /
translated: Here, it is a wheel because it moves quickly, etc., or because it moves quickly, etc., like the stages of merit.

original: de bzhin du mthong ba'i lam sems kyi skad cig bco lngas bden pa rnams mngon par rtogs pa'i phyir myur bar 'gro ba dang 'dra ba yin no //üîΩyang na skad cig ma gnyis pa mi skye ba'i sgo nas te /üîΩ'khor lo rin po ches rgyab ma 'dor zhing mdun ma la 'jug pa dang chos mthun par chos kyi 'khor los kyang ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du mthong ba'i lam sems kyi skad cig bco lngas bden pa rnams mngon par rtogs pa'i phyir myur bar 'gro ba dang 'dra ba yin no // yang na skad cig ma gnyis pa mi skye ba'i sgo nas te / 'khor lo rin po ches rgyab ma 'dor zhing mdun ma la 'jug pa dang chos mthun par chos kyi 'khor los kyang ste /

translated: Ordinary beings who live there are not disgusted because they are attached to the pleasure of meditative attainment and their life is very long.

analyzed: gzugs kyi khams na ni 'phags pa'i lam 'dren par byed pa skyo ba med pas mthong ba'i lam yod pa ma yin no //
translated: In the form realm, the path of the noble ones is not present because there is no disgust that can induce the path.

original: 'dir brtsam zhing der mthar phyin par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'dir brtsam zhing der mthar phyin par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la /
translated: One begins here and one completes there.

original: 'phags pa ma yin pa ni 'gas kyang der rtsom par mi gsungs so //
analyzed: 'phags pa ma yin pa ni 'gas kyang der rtsom par mi gsungs so //
translated: It is not said that any non-noble one begins there.

original: rtsom pa ni rtsom pa ste mya ngan las 'das par 'gro ba'i thabs rtsom zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rtsom pa ni rtsom pa ste mya ngan las 'das par 'gro ba'i thabs rtsom zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: One begins means one begins the method of going to nirvana.

original: dgra bcom drug 'dod ces bya ba la /
analyzed: dgra bcom drug 'dod ces bya ba la /
translated: Six arhats are asserted.

original: mdo las mi slob pa dgu bshad pa gang yin pa de dag las yongs su mi nyams pa'i chos can dang / shes rab kyis rnam par grol ba dang / gnyis ka'i cha las rnam par grol ba dag kyang mi g-yo ba'i chos can gyi nang du 'du bas chos mngon pa'i lugs las drug nyid du tha snyad btags so //
analyzed: mdo las mi slob pa dgu bshad pa gang yin pa de dag las yongs su mi nyams pa'i chos can dang / shes rab kyis rnam par grol ba dang / gnyis ka'i cha las rnam par grol ba dag kyang mi g-yo ba'i chos can gyi nang du 'du bas chos mngon pa'i lugs las drug nyid du tha snyad btags so //
translated: The one who is subject to complete degeneration, the one liberated through wisdom, and the one liberated in both ways are included in the immutable arhat.

original: 'di la yongs su nyams pa'i chos kyi rang bzhin yod pas yongs su nyams pa'i chos can no //
analyzed: 'di la yongs su nyams pa'i chos kyi rang bzhin yod pas yongs su nyams pa'i chos can no //
translated: The one who is subject to complete degeneration is so called because he possesses the nature of complete degeneration.

original: de bzhin du 'di la bdag nyid 'chi bar sems pa'i chos yod pas na 'chi bar sems pa'i chos can no //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'di la bdag nyid 'chi bar sems pa'i chos yod pas na 'chi bar sems pa'i chos can no //
translated: The one who is subject to death is so called because he possesses the nature of thinking, I will die.

original: 'di la rnam par grol ba gang la gnas pa de gsungs pa'i chos yod pas na rjes su bsrung ba'i chos can no //
analyzed: 'di la rnam par grol ba gang la gnas pa de gsungs pa'i chos yod pas na rjes su bsrung ba'i chos can no //
translated: The one who is subject to protection is so called because he possesses the nature of guarding the state of liberation in which he abides.

original: de bzhin du gnas pa la mi spyod pa ni ga la gnas pa bskyod par mi nus pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du gnas pa la mi spyod pa ni ga la gnas pa bskyod par mi nus pa ste /
translated: The one who does not apply himself is so called because he is incapable of shaking his state of abiding.

original: yongs su nyams pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yongs su nyams pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: He is incapable of shaking his state of abiding because he is incapable of complete degeneration.

original: mi g-yo ba ni rnam par grol ba rtogs shing khong du chud de skal ba dang ldan zhing nus pa ni rtogs pa'i skal ba can no ;
analyzed: mi g-yo ba ni rnam par grol ba rtogs shing khong du chud de skal ba dang ldan zhing nus pa ni rtogs pa'i skal ba can no ;
translated: One who is unshakable is one who has realized and penetrated liberation, who is fortunate and capable, and who is capable of realization.

original: / dbang po rno ba'i phyir na mi g-yo ba ste /
analyzed: / dbang po rno ba'i phyir na mi g-yo ba ste /
translated: He is unshakable because his faculties are sharp.

original: 'di g-yo bar mi nus pa'i phyir mi g-yo ba'i chos can no //
analyzed: 'di g-yo bar mi nus pa'i phyir mi g-yo ba'i chos can no //
translated: He is unshakable because he cannot be shaken.üîΩFrom among those,

original: de dag las zhes bya ba ni dgra bcom pa drug po las so //
analyzed: de dag las zhes bya ba ni dgra bcom pa drug po las so //
translated: means from among the six arhats.

original: sems kyis rnam par grol ba ni dus dang sbyor bas phongs pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sems kyis rnam par grol ba ni dus dang sbyor bas phongs pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: One liberated by the will is one who is liberated by the will at the appropriate time.

original: dus dang sbyor ba ni dus kyis @255a * //üîΩbyung ba ste /
analyzed: dus dang sbyor ba ni dus kyis @255a * // byung ba ste /
translated: The appropriate time is the time of birth.

original: de skye ba yul dang gang zag dang yo byad kyi dus la bltos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de skye ba yul dang gang zag dang yo byad kyi dus la bltos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the arising of that liberation depends on the time of the person, the place, and the requisites.

original: phongs pa ni mig gcig pa'i mig bzhin du lhur blangs nas rtag tu rjes su bsrung ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: phongs pa ni mig gcig pa'i mig bzhin du lhur blangs nas rtag tu rjes su bsrung ba'i phyir te /
translated: It is called ‚Äúat the appropriate time‚Äù because it is protected like the eye of a person with only one eye.

original: phongs pa ni rtag tu rjes su bsrungs pa yin no //
analyzed: phongs pa ni rtag tu rjes su bsrungs pa yin no //
translated: It is protected at the appropriate time.

original: dus la bltos pa yang yin la zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: dus la bltos pa yang yin la zhes bya ba la /
translated: It is called ‚Äúat the appropriate time‚Äù because it depends on the time.

original: dus zhes bya ba ni yo byad la sogs pa la bya'o //
analyzed: dus zhes bya ba ni yo byad la sogs pa la bya'o //
translated: Time is to be understood as referring to requisites, etc.

original: yang ji ltar de dag rnam par grol ba dus dang sbyor ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: yang ji ltar de dag rnam par grol ba dus dang sbyor ba yin zhe na /
translated: How are they liberated in time?

original: de'i phyir 'di dag gi ting nge 'dzin mngon sum du 'gyur ba ni zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di dag gi ting nge 'dzin mngon sum du 'gyur ba ni zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, it is said: ‚Äútheir meditative concentration is manifest,‚Äù

original: de'i rten mthu chung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i rten mthu chung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because their support is weak.

original: g-yo bar mi nus pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa dag gis te /
analyzed: g-yo bar mi nus pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa dag gis te /
translated: Because they are unable to shake off the mental afflictions and secondary mental afflictions.

original: de nyid kyi phyir yongs su mi nyams pa'i sgo nas zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir yongs su mi nyams pa'i sgo nas zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: For this very reason, it is said: ‚Äúin the sense of not falling away.‚Äù

original: 'dod dgur zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin mngon sum du gyur pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'dod dgur zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin mngon sum du gyur pa'i phyir te /
translated: At will is because their meditative concentration is manifest.

original: de ni gang rung rung gi tshe gang rung rung du gang rung rung gis ting nge 'dzin mngon sum du gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni gang rung rung gi tshe gang rung rung du gang rung rung gis ting nge 'dzin mngon sum du gyur pa yin no //
translated: They manifest meditative concentration whenever they want, wherever they want, and however they want.

original: dus gzhan gyi bar dang gtan du rnam par grol ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni dus gzhan gyi bar du rnam par grol ba'i phyir na dus kyi rnam par grol ba'o //
analyzed: dus gzhan gyi bar dang gtan du rnam par grol ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni dus gzhan gyi bar du rnam par grol ba'i phyir na dus kyi rnam par grol ba'o //
translated: because of liberation for a time and because of definitive liberation.üîΩLiberation for a time is due to liberation for a period of time.

original: gtan du rnam par gro la ba'i phyir dus dang mi sbyor bar rnam par grol ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: gtan du rnam par gro la ba'i phyir dus dang mi sbyor bar rnam par grol ba nyid yin no //
translated: Definitive liberation is due to definitive liberation.

original: yang na yongs su nyams pa srid pa'i sgo nas dus gzhan gyi bar du rnam par grol ba'o //
analyzed: yang na yongs su nyams pa srid pa'i sgo nas dus gzhan gyi bar du rnam par grol ba'o //
translated: Or else, liberation for a time is due to the possibility of retrogressing.

original: yongs su nyams pa mi srid pa'i sgo nas gtan du rnam par grol ba'o //
analyzed: yongs su nyams pa mi srid pa'i sgo nas gtan du rnam par grol ba'o //
translated: Definitive liberation is due to the impossibility of retrogressing.

original: kha cig dang po nas de'i rigs zhes bya ba 'byung ngo //
analyzed: kha cig dang po nas de'i rigs zhes bya ba 'byung ngo //
translated: Some say: The first is of the family from the beginning.

original: rigs zhes bya ba ni ci zhig ce na /
analyzed: rigs zhes bya ba ni ci zhig ce na /
translated: What is the meaning of family?

original: kha cig na re dge ba'i rtsa ba yin te /
analyzed: kha cig na re dge ba'i rtsa ba yin te /
translated: Some say: It is the roots of good.

original: de'i bye brag gis 'di bye brag tu 'gyur ro zhes zer ro //
analyzed: de'i bye brag gis 'di bye brag tu 'gyur ro zhes zer ro //
translated: It is due to the difference in these that there is a difference in the faculties.

original: gzhan dag na re dad pa la sogs pa'i dbang po rnams yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re dad pa la sogs pa'i dbang po rnams yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Others say: It is the faculties of faith, etc.

original: mdo sde pa rnams na re ni sems kyi sa bon gyis dngos po'i nus pa yin te /
analyzed: mdo sde pa rnams na re ni sems kyi sa bon gyis dngos po'i nus pa yin te /
translated: Sautrantikas say: The potential of a thing is the seed of the mind.

original: yongs su nyams pa'i chos can ni so so'i skye bo'i gnas skabs dang slob pa'i gnas skabs na yang sa bon yod pas yongs su nyams pa'i chos can gyi rigs can zhes bya la /
analyzed: yongs su nyams pa'i chos can ni so so'i skye bo'i gnas skabs dang slob pa'i gnas skabs na yang sa bon yod pas yongs su nyams pa'i chos can gyi rigs can zhes bya la /
translated: One who is subject to complete degeneration is called a type subject to complete degeneration because the seed exists in the state of an ordinary being and in the state of training.

original: mi slob pa'i gnas skabs su sa bon de'i 'jug pa rnyed pas yongs su nyams pa'i chos can zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mi slob pa'i gnas skabs su sa bon de'i 'jug pa rnyed pas yongs su nyams pa'i chos can zhes bya'o //
translated: In the state of no more learning, the seed is obtained and one is called one who is subject to complete degeneration.

original: 'chi bar sems pa'i chos can la sogs @255b pa dag la yang de bzhin du rigs par bya'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: 'chi bar sems pa'i chos can la sogs @255b pa dag la yang de bzhin du rigs par bya'o zhes zer ro //
translated: One who is subject to death through careful consideration and so on should be understood in the same way.

original: kha cig ni dang po nyid nas zhes bya ba ni so so skye bo'i gnas skabs kho nar te sbyangs pa las gyur pa ma yin no //
analyzed: kha cig ni dang po nyid nas zhes bya ba ni so so skye bo'i gnas skabs kho nar te sbyangs pa las gyur pa ma yin no //
translated: Some say: One who is subject to complete degeneration from the beginning is one who degenerates from the beginning in the state of an ordinary being alone, but not through training.

original: yang ci'i phyir 'dir yongs su nyams pa'i chos can gyi bdag nyid brgal te 'chi bar sems pa'i chos can la spyod par byed ce na /
analyzed: yang ci'i phyir 'dir yongs su nyams pa'i chos can gyi bdag nyid brgal te 'chi bar sems pa'i chos can la spyod par byed ce na /
translated: Why is one who is subject to complete degeneration here considered to be one who is subject to death through careful consideration?

original: gang gi phyir yongs su nyams pa'i chos can sbyangs pa las gyur pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir yongs su nyams pa'i chos can sbyangs pa las gyur pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Because one who is subject to complete degeneration does not become a trainee.

original: mi g-yo ba'i chos can du yang de dang 'dra bar rigs par bya'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mi g-yo ba'i chos can du yang de dang 'dra bar rigs par bya'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: One who is immutable should be understood in the same way.

original: 'chi bar sems pa'i chos can dang po nyid nas de'i rigs can dang dbang po sbyangs pa las gyur pa na rjes su bsrung ba'i chos can thob nas rim gyis mi g-yo ba'i chos can gyi bar 'thob ste /
analyzed: 'chi bar sems pa'i chos can dang po nyid nas de'i rigs can dang dbang po sbyangs pa las gyur pa na rjes su bsrung ba'i chos can thob nas rim gyis mi g-yo ba'i chos can gyi bar 'thob ste /
translated: One who is subject to death is a type who from the very beginning obtains the state of one who is protected by being a trainee and gradually obtains the state of one who is immutable.

original: rjes su bsrungs ba'i chos can la sogs pa dag la yang ci rigs par de dang 'dra bar brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: rjes su bsrungs ba'i chos can la sogs pa dag la yang ci rigs par de dang 'dra bar brjod par bya'o //
translated: One who is protected by being a trainee and so on should be understood in the same way, respectively.

original: de la yongs su nyams pa'i chos can ni yongs su nyams par 'gyur ba'i skal ba dang ldan gyi yongs su nyams pa nyid ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de la yongs su nyams pa'i chos can ni yongs su nyams par 'gyur ba'i skal ba dang ldan gyi yongs su nyams pa nyid ni ma yin no //
translated: Among them, one who is subject to complete degeneration is one who possesses the fortune of complete degeneration but is not one who degenerates.

original: 'chi bar sems pa'i chos can dang yongs su nyams pa'i chos can gang yin pa yongs su nyams pa'i skal ba dang ldan gyis zhes bya ba de tsam zhig brjod na mi 'chi bar sems pa'i chos can la sogs pa la yang thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'chi bar sems pa'i chos can dang yongs su nyams pa'i chos can gang yin pa yongs su nyams pa'i skal ba dang ldan gyis zhes bya ba de tsam zhig brjod na mi 'chi bar sems pa'i chos can la sogs pa la yang thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: If one were to say, ‚ÄúOne who is subject to death and one who is subject to complete degeneration possess the fortune of complete degeneration,‚Äù then it would follow that one who is subject to death and so on would also possess the fortune of complete degeneration.

original: de dag kyang yongs su nyams par byed nus pas de'i phyir 'chi bar sems pa la sogs pa'i chos can ma yin pa zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de dag kyang yongs su nyams par byed nus pas de'i phyir 'chi bar sems pa la sogs pa'i chos can ma yin pa zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: But they are not subject to death and so on, because they are able to degenerate.

original: 'chi bar sems pa'i chos can ni 'chi bar sems par 'gyur ba'i skal pa can zhes bya ba yang 'chi bar sems pa kho na ma yin no //
analyzed: 'chi bar sems pa'i chos can ni 'chi bar sems par 'gyur ba'i skal pa can zhes bya ba yang 'chi bar sems pa kho na ma yin no //
translated: One who is subject to death is one who possesses the fortune of becoming one who is subject to death, but one who is subject to death is not necessarily one who is subject to death.

original: sems par gyur pa ni 'chi bar gyur pa'o //
analyzed: sems par gyur pa ni 'chi bar gyur pa'o //
translated: One who has become subject to death is one who has died.

original: 'chi bar sems pa'i chos can la sogs pa rnams la yongs su nyams pa'i chos can la sogs pa yod kyang re re la mtshan nyid kyi khyad par bstan pa'i 'chi bar sems pa'i chos can ni 'chi bar sems pa'i skal pa dang ldan gyi rjes su bsrung
analyzed: 'chi bar sems pa'i chos can la sogs pa rnams la yongs su nyams pa'i chos can la sogs pa yod kyang re re la mtshan nyid kyi khyad par bstan pa'i 'chi bar sems pa'i chos can ni 'chi bar sems pa'i skal pa dang ldan gyi rjes su bsrung
translated: Those who are subject to falling away and so on are also subject to complete degeneration and so on, but it is not necessary to state that each one is subject to the characteristics of each.

original: pa'i chos can ni ma yin pa gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba 'di brjod mi dgos so //
analyzed: pa'i chos can ni ma yin pa gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba 'di brjod mi dgos so //
translated: Those who are subject to death are those who are fortunate to die, but not those who guard their spiritual level.

original: de bzhin du gzhan la yang brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhan la yang brjod par bya'o //
translated: The same should be said of the others.

original: ma bsrungs kyang 'bras bu de la gnas pa'i skal ba can yin te /üîΩrjes su bsrung ba'i chos can ni ma bsrungs na mnyam pa'i @256a * //
analyzed: ma bsrungs kyang 'bras bu de la gnas pa'i skal ba can yin te / rjes su bsrung ba'i chos can ni ma bsrungs na mnyam pa'i @256a * //
translated: Even though they do not guard their spiritual level, they are fortunate to remain in that result.üîΩThose who guard their spiritual level are fortunate to be equal if they do not guard it, but they do not remain in it.

original: skal ba can yin gyi gnas par mi 'gyur bas de rnam par gcad par bya ba'i phyir nyams par mi 'gyur ba dang zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: skal ba can yin gyi gnas par mi 'gyur bas de rnam par gcad par bya ba'i phyir nyams par mi 'gyur ba dang zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: To exclude that, the text says: they do not retrogress.

original: 'phel bar yang mi 'gyur ba'i zhes bya ba ni rtogs pa'i skal ba can thob par mi 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: 'phel bar yang mi 'gyur ba'i zhes bya ba ni rtogs pa'i skal ba can thob par mi 'gyur ba'o //
translated: They do not progress means they do not obtain the fortune of realization.

original: mngon par brtson pa med na zhes bya ba ni brtson 'grus brtsams pa med na ste /
analyzed: mngon par brtson pa med na zhes bya ba ni brtson 'grus brtsams pa med na ste /
translated: If one is not making effort, if one is not undertaking the practice of striving,üîΩthen one is not a person who has the fortune to attain nirvana.

original: gal te mngon par brtson par byed na ni thob pa'i skal ba can du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te mngon par brtson par byed na ni thob pa'i skal ba can du 'gyur ro //
translated: If one is making effort, then one is a person who has the fortune to attain nirvana.

original: nyams par 'gyur ba'i rkyen stobs dang ldan pa med na zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: nyams par 'gyur ba'i rkyen stobs dang ldan pa med na zhes bya ba la /
translated: If the conditions for degeneration are not strong,

original: yongs su nyams pa'i chos can la sogs pa rnams ni yongs su nyams pa'i rkyen chung ngus kyang yongs su nyams par 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: yongs su nyams pa'i chos can la sogs pa rnams ni yongs su nyams pa'i rkyen chung ngus kyang yongs su nyams par 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: it is taught that those who are subject to complete degeneration can degenerate even through weak conditions for degeneration.

original: yongs su nyams par 'gyur ba'i rkyen rnams ni mdo las ji skad du 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: yongs su nyams par 'gyur ba'i rkyen rnams ni mdo las ji skad du 'byung ba ste /
translated: The conditions for complete degeneration are as they appear in the sutras.üîΩHow is it?

original: ji ltar zhe na rkyen lnga dang rgyu lngas dus kyi rnam par grol ba'i dgra bcom pa yongs su nyams par 'gyur ro ;
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na rkyen lnga dang rgyu lngas dus kyi rnam par grol ba'i dgra bcom pa yongs su nyams par 'gyur ro ;
translated: The arhat liberated according to circumstances degenerates through five conditions and five causes.

original: / lnga gang zhe na /
analyzed: / lnga gang zhe na /
translated: What are the five?

original: las kyi mtha' la zhugs pa yin /üîΩsmra ba la zhugs pa yin /
analyzed: las kyi mtha' la zhugs pa yin / smra ba la zhugs pa yin /
translated: He engages in activities.üîΩHe engages in speech.

original: rtsod pa la zhugs pa yin /
analyzed: rtsod pa la zhugs pa yin /
translated: He engages in disputes.

original: ring du rgyu ba'i sbyor ba dang ldan pa yin /
analyzed: ring du rgyu ba'i sbyor ba dang ldan pa yin /
translated: He is one who is engaged in the practice of going far.

original: nad kyi rnam pa yun ring pos thebs pa yin zhes pa yin /
analyzed: nad kyi rnam pa yun ring pos thebs pa yin zhes pa yin /
translated: He is one who is afflicted by a long-lasting illness.

original: dang po gnyis zhes bya ba ni yongs su nyams pa'i chos can dang ; 'chi bar sems pa'i chos can no //
analyzed: dang po gnyis zhes bya ba ni yongs su nyams pa'i chos can dang ; 'chi bar sems pa'i chos can no //
translated: The first two are the one who regresses and the one who is resolved on death.

original: sngon zhes bya ba ni so so skye po dang slob pa'i gnas skabs na'o //
analyzed: sngon zhes bya ba ni so so skye po dang slob pa'i gnas skabs na'o //
translated: Previously means in the state of an ordinary person or a trainee.

original: rgyun tu sbyor ba gus par sbyor ba med pa yin no //
analyzed: rgyun tu sbyor ba gus par sbyor ba med pa yin no //
translated: He is not one who is engaged in constant practice or respectful practice.

original: gnyi ga la yang gnyi ga med mod kyi /üîΩ'chi bar sems pa'i chos can ni lus la smod pa kun tu spyod pa ches mang ba gang gis na bdag nyid brlag par sems bskyed pa'am yongs su nyams pa dgos pa'am /
analyzed: gnyi ga la yang gnyi ga med mod kyi / 'chi bar sems pa'i chos can ni lus la smod pa kun tu spyod pa ches mang ba gang gis na bdag nyid brlag par sems bskyed pa'am yongs su nyams pa dgos pa'am /
translated: Both of them are not engaged in both.üîΩHowever, the one who is resolved on death is one who engages in a great deal of self-condemnation of the body, by which he generates the thought of self-destruction or the need for regression.

original: lus mi gtsang ba'i rdzas du ma tshogs pa'i bdag nyid can gnas pa la dgos pa med par brtags nas bdag nyid 'chi bar sems pa'o //
analyzed: lus mi gtsang ba'i rdzas du ma tshogs pa'i bdag nyid can gnas pa la dgos pa med par brtags nas bdag nyid 'chi bar sems pa'o //
translated: Or, having examined the body as the nature of a collection of many impure substances, he thinks of his own death without purpose.

original: gzhan dag na re de'i rigs ni gang zag 'di'i rang bzhin gang yin pa de la mtshon cha gdab par bya'o snyam du de ltar srog la bltos pa med pa la brten nas rnam par grol ba thob par byed pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re de'i rigs ni gang zag 'di'i rang bzhin gang yin pa de la mtshon cha gdab par bya'o snyam du de ltar srog la bltos pa med pa la brten nas rnam par grol ba thob par byed pa ste /
translated: Others say: The type of person who thinks, I will stab this person with a weapon, whatever his nature may be, attains liberation in dependence on that, without regard for his life.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: mgrin par mtshon cha kha bstan te //
analyzed: mgrin par mtshon cha kha bstan te //
translated: Pointing a weapon to his throat,üîΩhe attains liberation of mind.

analyzed: de gnyis ni zhes bya ba ni gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i @257a * //

analyzed: 'chi bar sems pa med pas 'chi bar sems pa'i chos can yang med de /

translated: Because they do not have the cause of complete degeneration, which is disenchantment, because they do not have disenchantment that is compatible with thinking death, and because they do not harm themselves or others.

analyzed: dbang po 'pho ba med pas rtogs pa'i skal ba can med do //

analyzed: rigs dang dang po las yongs su nyams par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'di la rgyu smras pa ni slob pa dang mi slob pa'i lam dag gis bstan par byas pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ste / slob pa ni zhes bya ba ste / slob pa ni zhes bya ba la rigs dang po las yongs su nyams par mi 'gyur te zhes bya bar sbyar ro //

original: de nyid la rgyu 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam dag gis zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de nyid la rgyu 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam dag gis zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: One does not retrogress from the family, because the path of cultivation has made firm the first stage.üîΩOne does not retrogress from the first stage, because the path of cultivation has made it firm.üîΩOne does not retrogress from the family, because the path of insight has made it firm.

analyzed: bstan par byas pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar sbyar ro //

analyzed: de'i phyir rigs kho na de dang 'dra ba'o //

analyzed: gzhan dag na re gang gi @257b phyir dang po nas yongs su mi nyams pa ste /

analyzed: sbyangs ba las gyur pa ni yongs su nyams pa'o zhes zer ro //
translated: That which is a natural result of training is not subject to retrogressing.

analyzed: gang zhig slob pa sbyangs pa las gyur pa'i rang bzhin can de ni mi slob pa'i dang po nyid do //

analyzed: lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'am /

analyzed: phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'o //

analyzed: lhag ma las ni yongs su nyams par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la /
translated: One fully degenerates from the remaining results.üîΩOne fully degenerates from the result of nonreturn, but not from the result of stream entry.

original: gang zhig gang gi dang po ma yin pa de las ni nyams par 'gyur ro ;üîΩ/ de nyid kyi phyir rgyun tu zhugs pa'i 'bras bu las yongs su nyams pa med do zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir de ni thams cad kyi tshe dang po kho na yin gyi /

translated: One fully degenerates from the remaining results, but not from the first result.

original: gnyis pa'am gsum pa ma yin pas so //
analyzed: gnyis pa'am gsum pa ma yin pas so //
translated: For that reason there is no full degeneration from the result of stream entry, because it is the first of all and it is not the second or third.üîΩOne should understand that the results of once return and nonreturn are respectively five and six or seven types of abandonment.

original: go rims bzhin du rnam pa lnga dang drug dang bdun yin par rigs par bya'o zhes bya ba la rjes su bsrungs pa'i chos can ni rnam pa lnga yin te /
analyzed: go rims bzhin du rnam pa lnga dang drug dang bdun yin par rigs par bya'o zhes bya ba la rjes su bsrungs pa'i chos can ni rnam pa lnga yin te /

analyzed: de na gnas bzhin du yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba dang / dbang po 'pho ba dang / yongs su nyams nas slob pa nyid du 'gyur ba dang / yongs su nyams pa'i chos can gyi rigs su slar 'ong ba dang / 'chi bar sems pa'i chos can gyi rigs su slar 'ong ba'o //
translated: and while abiding in that, attaining nirvana, and changing faculties, and falling away from that state and becoming a learner again, and returning to the type that is subject to a single fall, and returning to the type that is subject to retrogressing from time to time.

analyzed: gnas pa las mi bskyod pa ni rnam pa drug yin te /

analyzed: lnga po de dag nyid dang rjes su bsrungs pa'i chos can gyi rigs su slar 'ong ba'o //

analyzed: rtogs pa'i skal ba can ni rnam pa bdun yin te /

analyzed: drug po de dag nyid dang gnas pa las mi bskyod pa'i rigs su slar 'ong ba'o //

analyzed: gang gi rigs dang po gang yin pa zhes bya ba ni slob pa'i gnas skabs nas brtsams pa dag go //

analyzed: de slob par gyur na zhes bya ba ni dgra bcom pa nyid las yongs su nyams pa ste /

analyzed: de kho na la gnas kyis gzhan la ma yin no zhes bya'o //

analyzed: mi slob pa sbyangs pas thob pa gang yin pa de slob pa'i gnas skabs gang yin pa yang sbyangs pas thob pas /
translated: If a nonlearner obtains by upgrading, then in whatever stage of training he obtains by upgrading, he does not upgrade again.

original: de'i phyir dgra bcom pa las yongs su nyams pas yongs su nyams par 'gyur ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir dgra bcom pa las yongs su nyams pas yongs su nyams par 'gyur ba ni ma yin no //

original: de ni dang po kho nar mi slob pa'i gnas skabs yin na /üîΩgang so so skye bo'i @258a * //
analyzed: de ni dang po kho nar mi slob pa'i gnas skabs yin na / gang so so skye bo'i @258a * //
translated: If he obtains the state of a nonlearner from the outset,

original: gnas skabs su dbang po sbyangs pas thob pa lta ci smos /
analyzed: gnas skabs su dbang po sbyangs pas thob pa lta ci smos /
translated: what need is there to mention that he obtains by upgrading in the state of an ordinary being?

translated: He does not retrogress from that obtained by upgrading in the state of an ordinary being, even by a learner.

original: des kun nas drangs pa'i rigs gang yin pa de snyed pa'i phyir yongs su mi nyams te /
analyzed: des kun nas drangs pa'i rigs gang yin pa de snyed pa'i phyir yongs su mi nyams te /
