original: 'phel pa kho nar 'gyur gyi yongs su nyams par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'phel pa kho nar 'gyur gyi yongs su nyams par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: They never retrogress from that stage.

original: 'di skad bshad par 'gyur te /üîΩyongs su nyams pa'i chos can dbang po sbyangs pas rtogs pa'i skal ba can thob pa de slob par gyur cing rigs de las kyang yongs su nyams na lugs las bzlog pa gnas pa las mi bskyod pa'i rigs nas 'chi bar sems pa'i chos can gyi rigs kyi
analyzed: 'di skad bshad par 'gyur te / yongs su nyams pa'i chos can dbang po sbyangs pas rtogs pa'i skal ba can thob pa de slob par gyur cing rigs de las kyang yongs su nyams na lugs las bzlog pa gnas pa las mi bskyod pa'i rigs nas 'chi bar sems pa'i chos can gyi rigs kyi
translated: This is explained as follows:

original: bar la mi gnas so //üîΩ'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: bar la mi gnas so // 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: One who is subject to retrogressing, who obtains the potential for realization by refining his intellectual faculty, becomes a learner. If he retrogresses from that spiritual family, he does not remain in any family from the family of the steady one who is the opposite of the one who retrogresses, up to the family of the one who contemplates death.

original: yongs su nyams pa'i chos can gyi rigs kho na la gnas so //
analyzed: yongs su nyams pa'i chos can gyi rigs kho na la gnas so //
translated: But if he does not retrogress, he remains in the family of one subject to retrogressing.

original: 'dir rigs la gnas pa'i sgo nas rigs kyi khyad par thob pas dbang po sbyangs pa thob pa las kyang rigs las nges par nyams par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dir rigs la gnas pa'i sgo nas rigs kyi khyad par thob pas dbang po sbyangs pa thob pa las kyang rigs las nges par nyams par 'gyur ro //
translated: Here, one who obtains the potential for realization by refining his intellectual faculty obtains a special spiritual family through remaining in that family, but he retrogresses from that spiritual family.

original: de khyad par gyi 'bras bu dor nas 'bras bu thob pa 'phel bar byed do //
analyzed: de khyad par gyi 'bras bu dor nas 'bras bu thob pa 'phel bar byed do //
translated: He abandons the special result and increases the result of obtaining.

original: de'i phyir bstan bcos las rigs las yongs su nyams kyang 'bras bu las yongs su nyams par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i phyir bstan bcos las rigs las yongs su nyams kyang 'bras bu las yongs su nyams par mi 'gyur te /
translated: One does not degenerate from the result even though one degenerates from one's lineage.

original: rigs gong ma yongs su nyams kyang rigs 'og mas bsdus pa'i 'bras bu de nyid la gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rigs gong ma yongs su nyams kyang rigs 'og mas bsdus pa'i 'bras bu de nyid la gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: One does not degenerate from the result subsumed by the lower lineage even though one degenerates from the higher lineage.

original: mthar gyis pa dbang po rnon po rnams ni yongs su sbyangs pa bzhin mthar gyis pa las yongs su nyams pa med de /
analyzed: mthar gyis pa dbang po rnon po rnams ni yongs su sbyangs pa bzhin mthar gyis pa las yongs su nyams pa med de /
translated: Those who are sharp faculty serial abandoners do not degenerate from serial abandoner due to upgrading their intellectual faculty,

original: ci'i phyir zhe na 'bad pas thob pa'i rigs ni dbang po 'pho bas 'dod pa ste /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na 'bad pas thob pa'i rigs ni dbang po 'pho bas 'dod pa ste /
translated: because the lineage obtained through exertion is the desire to upgrade the faculty.

original: 'bad pa med par thob pa med pa'i phyir nye bar bsags par 'bad pas thob pa kho na rigs kyi ngo bos gnas so //
analyzed: 'bad pa med par thob pa med pa'i phyir nye bar bsags par 'bad pas thob pa kho na rigs kyi ngo bos gnas so //
translated: Since one does not obtain it effortlessly, it abides by the nature of the lineage that is obtained through exertion and is accumulated.

original: yang ci'i phyir 'bras bu dang po las yongs su nyams pa med ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: yang ci'i phyir 'bras bu dang po las yongs su nyams pa med ces bya ba ni /
translated: Why does one not degenerate from the first result?

original: mthar gyis pa dang phal cher la 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / 'dod pa la 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams la rgyun tu zhugs pa'i 'bras bu dang lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dag las mthong bas spang par bya ba rnams gzhi med pa'i phyir te zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mthar gyis pa dang phal cher la 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / 'dod pa la 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams la rgyun tu zhugs pa'i 'bras bu dang lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dag las mthong bas spang par bya ba rnams gzhi med pa'i phyir te zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The result of stream-enterer and the result of once-returner and the result of non-returner are not relinquished by seeing because those to be abandoned by seeing have no basis.

original: dngos po ji ltar kun btags pa @258b la dmigs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dngos po ji ltar kun btags pa @258b la dmigs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This means that they are not relinquished because they do not focus on things as they are imputed.

original: gzhan dag na re dngos po ji lta bar gnyi ga 'gal ba med de /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re dngos po ji lta bar gnyi ga 'gal ba med de /
translated: Others say: There is no contradiction that both are like things.

original: rigs kyi khyad par thob pa'i phyir 'di 'phel la nyon mongs pa dang ldan pa las ni yongs su nyams pas na 'di la 'gal ba ci zhig yod /
analyzed: rigs kyi khyad par thob pa'i phyir 'di 'phel la nyon mongs pa dang ldan pa las ni yongs su nyams pas na 'di la 'gal ba ci zhig yod /
translated: This increases due to obtaining the special lineage and it decreases due to possessing affliction. What contradiction is there in this?

original: lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa thob pa'i gegs bskyed pa'i phyir yang 'di yod mod kyi /
analyzed: lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa thob pa'i gegs bskyed pa'i phyir yang 'di yod mod kyi /
translated: It also creates an obstacle to attaining nirvana without remainder.

original: 'di nyid mi rigs kyi khyad par thob pa yongs su nyams par 'gyur gyi 'phel ba ma yin zhes bya ba 'di la rgyu med do //
analyzed: 'di nyid mi rigs kyi khyad par thob pa yongs su nyams par 'gyur gyi 'phel ba ma yin zhes bya ba 'di la rgyu med do //
translated: This is not reasonable, because there is no cause for the statement, ‚ÄúThe degeneration of the distinction of being a human is not an increase.‚Äù

original: bdag gi gzhi la 'jug pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bdag gi gzhi la 'jug pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Because it engages the basis of the self.

original: bdag gi dbang du byas nas 'jug pa ste /
analyzed: bdag gi dbang du byas nas 'jug pa ste /
translated: It engages the basis of the self, taking the self as its object.

original: 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rtsa ba can yin pa'i phyir bdag gi gzhi zhes bya bar shes so //
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rtsa ba can yin pa'i phyir bdag gi gzhi zhes bya bar shes so //
translated: It is called the basis of the self because it has the root of the view of the transitory collection.

original: ji ltar 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rtsa ba can yin pa de ni phra rgyas bstan pa'i mdzod nyid du rgya cher bshad la /
analyzed: ji ltar 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rtsa ba can yin pa de ni phra rgyas bstan pa'i mdzod nyid du rgya cher bshad la /
translated: How it has the root of the view of the transitory collection is explained extensively in the Treasury of Knowledge.

original: de yang bdag med do zhes bya ba grub pas 'di gzhi med pa nyid do //
analyzed: de yang bdag med do zhes bya ba grub pas 'di gzhi med pa nyid do //
translated: And that is established by the statement, ‚ÄúThe self does not exist.‚Äù Therefore this view has no basis.

original: 'o na med pa la dmigs par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni bdag gi rdzas med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'o na med pa la dmigs par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni bdag gi rdzas med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Well then, it would be an object of nonexistence, because the substance of the self does not exist.

original: phyin ci log tu dmigs pa yin no zhes bya ba ni lus sdug bsngal ba la bdag tu dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyin ci log tu dmigs pa yin no zhes bya ba ni lus sdug bsngal ba la bdag tu dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is an object of error, because the body, which is suffering, is taken as the self.

original: de lta ma yin pa'i nyon mongs pa gang zhig yin te zhes bya la /
analyzed: de lta ma yin pa'i nyon mongs pa gang zhig yin te zhes bya la /
translated: What other affliction is there?

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa bsgom pas spang bar bya ba yang mi gtsang ba la sogs pa'i dngos po la gtsang ba dang bde ba dang rtag pa'i rnam par dmigs pa'i phyir ci log tu dmigs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa bsgom pas spang bar bya ba yang mi gtsang ba la sogs pa'i dngos po la gtsang ba dang bde ba dang rtag pa'i rnam par dmigs pa'i phyir ci log tu dmigs pa yin no //
translated: Also, the afflictions such as attachment that are to be abandoned by the path of cultivation are mistaken apprehensions, because they apprehend things such as the impure as pure, happiness, and permanent.

original: byed pa po ni dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las kyi byed pa po'o //
analyzed: byed pa po ni dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las kyi byed pa po'o //
translated: The agent is the agent of virtuous and nonvirtuous karma.

original: tshor ba po ni 'bras bu'i zag po'o //
analyzed: tshor ba po ni 'bras bu'i zag po'o //
translated: The experiencer is the experiencer of the result of karma.

original: dbang bsgyur ba ni de la 'dod dgur 'jug pa'i phyir ro //üîΩde'i gzhi la zhugs pa yin pas zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni /
analyzed: dbang bsgyur ba ni de la 'dod dgur 'jug pa'i phyir ro // de'i gzhi la zhugs pa yin pas zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni /
translated: The controller is the one who controls the body and so on.üîΩThe one who engages in the basis of that is the one who engages in the basis of the view of the transitory collection.

original: bdag tu mngon par 'dod pa'i dngos po la rtag pa dang chad par rtog pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: bdag tu mngon par 'dod pa'i dngos po la rtag pa dang chad par rtog pa'i phyir te /
translated: The one who engages in the basis of that is the one who engages in the basis of the view of the transitory collection, because one conceives the thing that is asserted to be the self as permanent or annihilated.

original: de bzhin du gzhan la yang brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhan la yang brjod par bya'o //
translated: The same should be said for the others.

original: 'dod chags dang khong khro dang nga rgyal zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang khong khro dang nga rgyal zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
translated: Attachment, anger, and pride are the three roots of nonvirtue.

original: 'dod chags ni rang gi ngo bo gzugs la sogs pa kho na la sgro mi 'dogs par chags pa'i rnam par 'jug pas gzhi dang bcas pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: 'dod chags ni rang gi ngo bo gzugs la sogs pa kho na la sgro mi 'dogs par chags pa'i rnam par 'jug pas gzhi dang bcas pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Attachment is said to have a basis because it engages its object in the aspect of attachment without superimposing anything else, such as form, onto its nature.

original: zhe sdang la sogs pa dag la yang de bzhin du brjod par bya'o //üîΩslob dpon gyis gzhan yang @259a * //
analyzed: zhe sdang la sogs pa dag la yang de bzhin du brjod par bya'o // slob dpon gyis gzhan yang @259a * //
translated: Aversion and so on should be described in the same way.üîΩThe master says,

original: 'phags pa zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: 'phags pa zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: and also the ƒÅryas.

original: dran pa nyams pa zhes bya ba la dran pa nyams pa ni dran pa nyon mongs pa can no //
analyzed: dran pa nyams pa zhes bya ba la dran pa nyams pa ni dran pa nyon mongs pa can no //
translated: Diminished mindfulness is afflicted mindfulness.

original: thag pa la sbrul gyi 'du shes bzhin no zhes bya ba ni dper na dran pa nyams pas thag pa la sbrul du 'du shes pa 'byung gi nges par rtogs pa las ma yin pa bzhin no //
analyzed: thag pa la sbrul gyi 'du shes bzhin no zhes bya ba ni dper na dran pa nyams pas thag pa la sbrul du 'du shes pa 'byung gi nges par rtogs pa las ma yin pa bzhin no //
translated: It is like the conception of a snake in a rope, for example, because the conception of a snake arises due to diminished mindfulness, not from ascertaining it.

original: nges par mi rtog pa la ni zhes bya ba ni lta ba rnams nges par rtog pa'i rnam par zhugs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nges par mi rtog pa la ni zhes bya ba ni lta ba rnams nges par rtog pa'i rnam par zhugs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not like nonascertainment, because views engage their objects in the aspect of ascertainment.

original: dgra bcom pa nyid las kyang yongs su nyams pa med do zhes bya ba ni mthong bas spang bar bya ba spangs pa las yongs su nyams pa med pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi snyam du bsams pa'o //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa nyid las kyang yongs su nyams pa med do zhes bya ba ni mthong bas spang bar bya ba spangs pa las yongs su nyams pa med pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi snyam du bsams pa'o //
translated: He does not fall away from the state of an arhat. This means that he does not fall away from the abandonment of what is to be abandoned by the path of seeing.

original: 'di ji ltar khong du chud par bya zhe na /
analyzed: 'di ji ltar khong du chud par bya zhe na /
translated: How is this to be understood?

original: dge slong dag 'phags pa'i shes rab kyis spang ba gang yin pa de ni spangs pa yin no zhes bya ba 'byung ngo //
analyzed: dge slong dag 'phags pa'i shes rab kyis spang ba gang yin pa de ni spangs pa yin no zhes bya ba 'byung ngo //
translated: ‚ÄúMonks, that which is abandoned by the ƒÅrya‚Äôs wisdom is abandoned.‚Äù

original: 'phags pa ma yin pa'i ni spangs kyang spangs pa ma yin no zhes bstan par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'phags pa ma yin pa'i ni spangs kyang spangs pa ma yin no zhes bstan par 'gyur te /
translated: This teaches that that which is abandoned by the non-ƒÅrya is not abandoned.

original: slar skye ba'i phyir ro snyam du bsams pa'o //üîΩdgra bcom pa nyid ni 'jig rten pa'i lam gyis bsdus pa yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: slar skye ba'i phyir ro snyam du bsams pa'o // dgra bcom pa nyid ni 'jig rten pa'i lam gyis bsdus pa yod pa ma yin te /
translated: This is because it arises again.

original: 'jig rten pa la srid pa'i rtse mo'i gnyen po med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa la srid pa'i rtse mo'i gnyen po med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The state of an arhat is not subsumed by the mundane path because the mundane path has no antidote to the peak of existence.

original: slob pa la bag yod pa la bag yod par bya'o zhes smra'o zhes bya ba'i mdo'i tshig 'di ni dgra bcom pa nyid la yongs su nyams pa med do zhes bya ba'i khungs gnyis pa yin no //
analyzed: slob pa la bag yod pa la bag yod par bya'o zhes smra'o zhes bya ba'i mdo'i tshig 'di ni dgra bcom pa nyid la yongs su nyams pa med do zhes bya ba'i khungs gnyis pa yin no //
translated: The words of the sutra, ‚ÄúTrainers should be heedful, and should train in heedfulness,‚Äù are a second source for the assertion that arhats do not retrogress from their result.

original: slob pa ni 'bras bu gnyis las yongs su nyams pa srid cing de'i nyon mongs pa yang lhag ma dang bcas pas bag yod par gsungs kyi /
analyzed: slob pa ni 'bras bu gnyis las yongs su nyams pa srid cing de'i nyon mongs pa yang lhag ma dang bcas pas bag yod par gsungs kyi /
translated: Trainers can retrogress from two results, and since they have not abandoned all afflictions, they are said to be heedful.

original: mi slob pa ni nyon mongs pa ma lus pa spang ba'i phyir dgra bcom pa las yongs su nyams pa yod pa ma yin pas de la bag yod par bya ba ma gsungs so //
analyzed: mi slob pa ni nyon mongs pa ma lus pa spang ba'i phyir dgra bcom pa las yongs su nyams pa yod pa ma yin pas de la bag yod par bya ba ma gsungs so //
translated: Non-trainers do not retrogress from the state of an arhat, because they have abandoned all afflictions.

original: de lta ma yin na 'di la yang slob pa bzhin du bag yod par bya'o zhes ci ste mi gsung /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na 'di la yang slob pa bzhin du bag yod par bya'o zhes ci ste mi gsung /
translated: If that were not so, why would the Buddha not say, ‚ÄúNon-trainers should be heedful, and should train in heedfulness‚Äù?

original: gzhan dag na re /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re /
translated: Others say:

original: 'jig rten pa'i lam gyis spangs pa rnams las brgyad pa'i sa'i spangs pa ni slar ngan song dang 'brel ba yin no //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i lam gyis spangs pa rnams las brgyad pa'i sa'i spangs pa ni slar ngan song dang 'brel ba yin no //
translated: Abandonment by the mundane path is associated with lower rebirths.

original: 'di la dpe ni rangs byed kyi bu lhag spyod bzhin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: 'di la dpe ni rangs byed kyi bu lhag spyod bzhin no zhes zer ro //
translated: The example is the ascetic R·π£ya·π£·π≠a.

original: yang zag pa med pas spangs pa rnams ni ma yin te dgra bcom pa las yongs su nyams kyang slar skye ba dang 'brel pa yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang zag pa med pas spangs pa rnams ni ma yin te dgra bcom pa las yongs su nyams kyang slar skye ba dang 'brel pa yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: But they are not abandoned by the pure path, because, even if the perfected being regresses from the fruit, he does not again take up the possession of the defilements.

original: de'i phyir dge slong @259b dag 'phags pa'i shes rab kyis spangs pa gang yin pa ni spangs pa'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir dge slong @259b dag 'phags pa'i shes rab kyis spangs pa gang yin pa ni spangs pa'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: Thus it is said: ‚ÄúMonks, that which is abandoned by the noble understanding is abandoned.‚Äù

original: slob pa la bag yod par bya'o zhes gsungs la dgra bcom pa lam yin pa de la dgos pa yod de /
analyzed: slob pa la bag yod par bya'o zhes gsungs la dgra bcom pa lam yin pa de la dgos pa yod de /
translated: The S≈´tra says that the learner should be diligent, but the perfected being is not diligent.üîΩThe learner, even though freed from attachment up to the sphere of nothingness, takes up again the possession of the defilements when he retrogresses from the fruit of the perfected being.

original: slob pa ni ci yang med pa'i skye mched kyi bar las 'dod chags dang bral yang yongs su nyams pa na gzugs kyi khams su skye bar 'gyur ba de'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis de la bag yod par bya ba bka' stsal par gyur to //
analyzed: slob pa ni ci yang med pa'i skye mched kyi bar las 'dod chags dang bral yang yongs su nyams pa na gzugs kyi khams su skye bar 'gyur ba de'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis de la bag yod par bya ba bka' stsal par gyur to //
translated: The Blessed One has said that the learner should be diligent in order to avoid this retrogressing.

original: mi slob pa la ni yongs su nyams kyang yang srid pa mngon par 'grub pa'i skabs med pas de la bag yod par bya ba ma gsungs so zhes /
analyzed: mi slob pa la ni yongs su nyams kyang yang srid pa mngon par 'grub pa'i skabs med pas de la bag yod par bya ba ma gsungs so zhes /
translated: But for nonlearners, even if they fully degenerate, there is no opportunity to actualize existence, so heedfulness is not mentioned for them.

original: zer ro // 'di ni 'chad par 'gyur ba'i rigs pa dang 'gal ba'i phyir dang the tshom za ba'i phyir khas mi len to //
analyzed: zer ro // 'di ni 'chad par 'gyur ba'i rigs pa dang 'gal ba'i phyir dang the tshom za ba'i phyir khas mi len to //
translated: This is not accepted because it contradicts the reasoning to be explained and because it is doubtful.

original: slob pa la ni yongs su nyams pa yod de 'jig rten pa'i lam gyis spangs pa'i phyir dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam gyis spangs pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: slob pa la ni yongs su nyams pa yod de 'jig rten pa'i lam gyis spangs pa'i phyir dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam gyis spangs pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Learners have full degeneration because they abandon objects to be abandoned by the mundane path and they do not abandon objects to be abandoned by the transcendent path.

original: dgra bcom pa la yang bag yod par bya ba mdo gzhan las gsungs te /üîΩrnyed pa dang bkur sti bar chad byed pa yin par bshad pa'i phyir ro snyam du sems pa bsal bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa la yang bag yod par bya ba mdo gzhan las gsungs te / rnyed pa dang bkur sti bar chad byed pa yin par bshad pa'i phyir ro snyam du sems pa bsal bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Also, heedfulness is mentioned in another sutra for arhats:üîΩThe Buddha said to Ananda:

original: kun dga' bo dgra bcom pa la yang zhes bya ba rgyas par smos te /
analyzed: kun dga' bo dgra bcom pa la yang zhes bya ba rgyas par smos te /
translated: Ananda, even arhats should be heedful.üîΩAnanda, if arhats are not heedful, they will degenerate.

original: rnyed pa dang bkur sti ni mthong ba'i chos la bde bar gnas pa kho na la bar chad byed kyi /
analyzed: rnyed pa dang bkur sti ni mthong ba'i chos la bde bar gnas pa kho na la bar chad byed kyi /
translated: Gain and honor obstruct only the comfort of abiding in the present life,

original: dgra bcom pa nyid la ni ma yin pas de la bag yod par bya ba med do //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa nyid la ni ma yin pas de la bag yod par bya ba med do //
translated: but not arhatship. Therefore, there is no need for heedfulness with regard to that.

original: 'dis sems rnam par grol ba mi g-yo ba zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
analyzed: 'dis sems rnam par grol ba mi g-yo ba zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
translated: This is the explanation of the unshakable liberation of mind.

original: mdo de las ni dgra bcom pa nyid las yongs su nyams pa med do zhes rang gi sgra kho nas gsungs so zhes bstan to //
analyzed: mdo de las ni dgra bcom pa nyid las yongs su nyams pa med do zhes rang gi sgra kho nas gsungs so zhes bstan to //
translated: That sutra itself states that there is no regression from arhatship.

original: gal te dus dang sbyor ba la yod do zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gal te dus dang sbyor ba la yod do zhes bya ba la /
translated: If it is asked, ‚ÄúIs there regression from the state of arhatship?‚Äù

original: sems rnam par grol ba ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: sems rnam par grol ba ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The liberation of mind is twofold:

original: dus dang sbyor ba dang mi g-yo ba'o //
analyzed: dus dang sbyor ba dang mi g-yo ba'o //
translated: liberation of mind that is timely and liberation of mind that is unshakable.

original: de la mi g-yo ba zhes bya ba khyad par du byas pas sems rnam par gro la ba dus dang sbyor ba las yongs su nyams so zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la mi g-yo ba zhes bya ba khyad par du byas pas sems rnam par gro la ba dus dang sbyor ba las yongs su nyams so zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: Since the term unshakable is specified, it teaches that there is regression from the liberation of mind that is timely.

original: dus su mngon sum du 'gyur ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni dus 'ga' zhig gi tshe mngon sum du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dus su mngon sum du 'gyur ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni dus 'ga' zhig gi tshe mngon sum du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is manifest at the proper time means that it is manifest at some time.

original: ro myang bar bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni phongs pas zhes rjes su 'jug go //üîΩdgra bcom pa nyid kyi rnam par @260a * //
analyzed: ro myang bar bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni phongs pas zhes rjes su 'jug go // dgra bcom pa nyid kyi rnam par @260a * //
translated: Because it is to be savored means that it is to be savored by one who is in need.

original: grol ba ni zhes bya ba ni dgra bcom pa nyid rnam par grol ba yin pa'o //
analyzed: grol ba ni zhes bya ba ni dgra bcom pa nyid rnam par grol ba yin pa'o //
translated: The arhat‚Äôs liberation is calledüîΩbecause it is always associated with the attainment of the state of arhatship.

original: rtag tu rjes su 'brel ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni thob pa'i tshul gyis rtag tu rjes su 'brel pa dus dang sbyor ba yin par mi rung ste /
analyzed: rtag tu rjes su 'brel ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni thob pa'i tshul gyis rtag tu rjes su 'brel pa dus dang sbyor ba yin par mi rung ste /
translated: It is not proper to say that it is occasional, because it is always associated with the attainment of the state of arhatship.

original: 'dus ma byas kyi rnam par grol ba gang yin pa de ni nam yang mngon du gyur pa ma yin no //

analyzed: gang gi phyir dgra bcom pa thams cad sems kyis rnam par grol ba mi g-yo ba yin pa de'i phyir /
translated: Because all arhats are unshakable arhats liberated by the mind,

original: de las yongs su nyams par mi 'dod kyi /
analyzed: de las yongs su nyams par mi 'dod kyi /
translated: it is not asserted that they retrogress from that state.

original: bsam gtan dag las ni 'ga' zhig yongs su nyams par 'gyur la /
analyzed: bsam gtan dag las ni 'ga' zhig yongs su nyams par 'gyur la /
translated: But some retrogress from the absorptions,

original: 'ga' zhig ni ma yin pa de'i phyir 'di ni klan kar mi rung ngo //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig ni ma yin pa de'i phyir 'di ni klan kar mi rung ngo //
translated: while others do not. Therefore this is not a fault.

original: khams gsum las 'dod chags dang bral ba las yongs su nyams pa dang / nyon mongs pa dang bcas pa'i phyir gdon mi za bar skye la /
analyzed: khams gsum las 'dod chags dang bral ba las yongs su nyams pa dang / nyon mongs pa dang bcas pa'i phyir gdon mi za bar skye la /
translated: It is certain that those who retrogress from freedom from attachment to the three realms are born again because they possess affliction.

original: tshangs par spyod pa yang yid brtan pa'i gnas su bshad pas /
analyzed: tshangs par spyod pa yang yid brtan pa'i gnas su bshad pas /
translated: And since it is explained that pure conduct is a reliable state,

original: yang gang zhig dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu las yongs su nyams na zhes bya ba dris so //
analyzed: yang gang zhig dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu las yongs su nyams na zhes bya ba dris so //

original: de ni med de zhes bya ba ni yang skye ba med pa'o //
analyzed: de ni med de zhes bya ba ni yang skye ba med pa'o //
translated: he does not exist, that is, he does not arise again.

original: nyon mongs pa dang bcas na ji ltar mi skye zhe na /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang bcas na ji ltar mi skye zhe na /
translated: If he has affliction, how does he not arise?üîΩThus it is said:üîΩOne who falls from the result does not die.üîΩOne who has fallen from the result does not die.

original: 'di ltar / 'bras las nyams pa 'chi ba mer //üîΩces bya ba 'byung ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar / 'bras las nyams pa 'chi ba mer // ces bya ba 'byung ste /

original: de lta ma yin par gal te khams gsum pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba las yongs su nyams te 'dod pa'i khams kyi 'dod chags dang bral ba slar 'dod pa'i khams su skye ba lta bu yin na tshangs par spyod pa la yid brtan med par 'gyur ro
analyzed: de lta ma yin par gal te khams gsum pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba las yongs su nyams te 'dod pa'i khams kyi 'dod chags dang bral ba slar 'dod pa'i khams su skye ba lta bu yin na tshangs par spyod pa la yid brtan med par 'gyur ro
translated: If it were otherwise, then one who regresses from freedom from attachment to the three realms would again be born in the desire realm, and then the pure life would be unreliable.

original: // rtsal po che grong brdeg mi 'tshal ba bzhin no zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: // rtsal po che grong brdeg mi 'tshal ba bzhin no zhes bya ba la /
translated: It is like a wrestler who does not avoid a blow.

original: rtsal po che ni 'dir stobs dang ldan pa la dgongs so //
analyzed: rtsal po che ni 'dir stobs dang ldan pa la dgongs so //
translated: Here, a wrestler is one who is strong.

original: 'di brjod par byed de /
analyzed: 'di brjod par byed de /
translated: This is what is being said:

original: de la mi dge ba sngar zhugs pa nyams pa dang theg pa sna tshogs la dran pa 'jug pa dang / sha ma tha ku ru kon bi darshy'a na gu ru ka: aa lo bhot+sa do mo hot+sa do mi rnams kho nar yongs su nyams par byed ci 'dod pa na spyod pa'i lha rnams su ma yin te /
analyzed: de la mi dge ba sngar zhugs pa nyams pa dang theg pa sna tshogs la dran pa 'jug pa dang / sha ma tha ku ru kon bi darshy'a na gu ru ka: aa lo bhot+sa do mo hot+sa do mi rnams kho nar yongs su nyams par byed ci 'dod pa na spyod pa'i lha rnams su ma yin te /
translated: Those who have previously engaged in nonvirtue, those who have regressed, those whose mindfulness engages various vehicles, those who are born in the human realm, and those who are born in the desire realm of the gods are the ones who regress, not those born in the desire realm of the gods.

original: dbang po rnon pos der 'bras bu thob pa dang yul shin tu yangs pa las yang byung bas de yang yongs su nyams pa'i chos can ma yin no //
analyzed: dbang po rnon pos der 'bras bu thob pa dang yul shin tu yangs pa las yang byung bas de yang yongs su nyams pa'i chos can ma yin no //
translated: Those of sharp intellectual faculty obtain the result there and because they are born in a very vast realm, they do not possess the quality of complete degeneration.

original: gzhan dag na re /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re /
translated: Others say:

original: yo byad ma tshang ba'i phyir ram rten mi mthun pas yongs su nyams par 'gyur ba las der gnyi ga yang med pas dad pas rjes su 'brang ba'i rigs can yang mi nyams so zhes zer ro //
analyzed: yo byad ma tshang ba'i phyir ram rten mi mthun pas yongs su nyams par 'gyur ba las der gnyi ga yang med pas dad pas rjes su 'brang ba'i rigs can yang mi nyams so zhes zer ro //
translated: They do not degenerate because neither of those two exist there, since they degenerate due to incomplete resources or due to an incompatible basis.

original: yang gang zhig nyon mongs pa mngon du gyur pas yongs su nyams par 'dod pa de dag sems gcig 'dra ba zhig gi mjug thogs su nyon mongs pa mngon du byed ce na /
analyzed: yang gang zhig nyon mongs pa mngon du gyur pas yongs su nyams par 'dod pa de dag sems gcig 'dra ba zhig gi mjug thogs su nyon mongs pa mngon du byed ce na /
translated: Those who assert that degeneration occurs through the manifestation of affliction ask: Do they manifest affliction immediately after a single mind?

original: gal te gzugs dang gzugs med pa na sbyong pa'i kun nas dkris pas yongs su nyams nas gang gis kun nas dkris pas nyams pa'i sa gang yin pa de nyid kyi dge ba nyams pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i mjug thogs sa yongs su nyams par byed do //
analyzed: gal te gzugs dang gzugs med pa na sbyong pa'i kun nas dkris pas yongs su nyams nas gang gis kun nas dkris pas nyams pa'i sa gang yin pa de nyid kyi dge ba nyams pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i mjug thogs sa yongs su nyams par byed do //
translated: If one regresses through the entanglement of training in the form and formless realms, then immediately after the virtuous mind that is compatible with the level of regression, one generates the neutral mind of the level of regression.

original: 'dod pa'i khams su gnas pas sa gong ma pa'i lung ma bstan gyi sems mngon du byed pa ma yin pas 'dir sprul pa'i sems rnams la ste de la gnas pa yongs su nyams par mi byed do //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams su gnas pas sa gong ma pa'i lung ma bstan gyi sems mngon du byed pa ma yin pas 'dir sprul pa'i sems rnams la ste de la gnas pa yongs su nyams par mi byed do //
translated: But one abiding in the desire realm does not manifest the neutral mind of higher realms, so here one does not generate the emanation mind.

original: yang nyams pa'i cha dang mthun pa 'dod chags dang bral ba'i phyir spangs pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: yang nyams pa'i cha dang mthun pa 'dod chags dang bral ba'i phyir spangs pa ma yin nam /
translated: But isn't the level compatible with degeneration abandoned through freedom from attachment?

original: de ji ltar ma spangs par mngon du byed ce na /
analyzed: de ji ltar ma spangs par mngon du byed ce na /
translated: How could it be manifest if it is not abandoned?

original: gnas pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i phyogs kho na la yod pa cung zad spang ba dang rjes su mthun la cung zad ni khyad par dang rjes su mthun no //
analyzed: gnas pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i phyogs kho na la yod pa cung zad spang ba dang rjes su mthun la cung zad ni khyad par dang rjes su mthun no //
translated: It is compatible with the slightest abandonment and the slightest distinction in the category of the level compatible with abidance.

original: de la gang spangs pa dang rjes su mthun pa gang yin @266a * //
analyzed: de la gang spangs pa dang rjes su mthun pa gang yin @266a * //
translated: What is it?üîΩIt is that which is compatible with what is to be abandoned.

original: pa des ni nyams pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i ming 'thob la /
analyzed: pa des ni nyams pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i ming 'thob la /
translated: That which is compatible with the abandonment of the latter is called compatible with the stage of degenerated virtue.üîΩThat which is compatible with the stage of virtue is called compatible with the stage of virtue.

original: gnas pa'i phyogs de ni phal cher brten pas gnas pa'i cha dang mthun pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gnas pa'i phyogs de ni phal cher brten pas gnas pa'i cha dang mthun pa zhes bya'o //
translated: That which is compatible with the stage of stability is called compatible with the stage of stability, since it is compatible with the side of stability.

original: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i kun nas dkris pas yongs su nyams par byed ba na dge ba dang ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan ba'i sems dag gis mjug thogs su nyon mongs pa mngon du byed do //
analyzed: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i kun nas dkris pas yongs su nyams par byed ba na dge ba dang ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan ba'i sems dag gis mjug thogs su nyon mongs pa mngon du byed do //
translated: When one degenerates through the entanglement of the desire realm, one manifests affliction immediately after a virtuous mind and an unobscured neutral mind.

original: gal te slob pas sa gong ma dag las ni sa gang las 'dod chags dang bral pa'i sa de'i kun nas dkris pas nyams par byed de /
analyzed: gal te slob pas sa gong ma dag las ni sa gang las 'dod chags dang bral pa'i sa de'i kun nas dkris pas nyams par byed de /
translated: If a learner degenerates from any stage, he degenerates through the entanglement of that stage.

original: dge ba kho na'i mjug thogs su 'dod pa la 'dod chags dang bral ba dang dge ba dang lung ma bstan gyi mjug thogs su'o //
analyzed: dge ba kho na'i mjug thogs su 'dod pa la 'dod chags dang bral ba dang dge ba dang lung ma bstan gyi mjug thogs su'o //
translated: Immediately after a virtuous mind, he manifests affliction.

original: gzhan dag na re /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re /
translated: Others say:

original: yongs su nyams pa nyon mongs pa mngon du byed pa de mngon du gyur pa las ma yin te /üîΩyongs su nyams pa na nga'o snyam pa la rag las pas bar chad med pa dang rnam par grol ba'i lam dgu yang dran pa nyams pa gzhung kha don byed pa'i dus dang 'dra'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: yongs su nyams pa nyon mongs pa mngon du byed pa de mngon du gyur pa las ma yin te / yongs su nyams pa na nga'o snyam pa la rag las pas bar chad med pa dang rnam par grol ba'i lam dgu yang dran pa nyams pa gzhung kha don byed pa'i dus dang 'dra'o zhes zer ro //
translated: It is not that complete degeneration is due to manifesting affliction, because when one degenerates, it is dependent on the thought i.üîΩIt is like the time of performing the main part of the rite.üîΩThe nine uninterrupted and liberated paths of those possessing the lineage of realization are the uninterrupted and liberated paths of those possessing the lineage of realization alone, since they are connected to the lineage of realization through the power of continuous and respectful practice.

original: rtogs pa'i skal ba can gyi bar chad med pa'i lam dgu ni rtogs pa'i skal ba can gyi rigs can kho nar rgyun tu sbyor ba dang gus par sbyor ba'i nus pas khyad par so sor shes rab kyi skad cig skye bas gang dag gis rigs can kho
analyzed: rtogs pa'i skal ba can gyi bar chad med pa'i lam dgu ni rtogs pa'i skal ba can gyi rigs can kho nar rgyun tu sbyor ba dang gus par sbyor ba'i nus pas khyad par so sor shes rab kyi skad cig skye bas gang dag gis rigs can kho
translated: Since they generate the wisdom of distinct qualities, they block the obtainment of those of dull faculty who possess the lineage of realization alone.

original: na'i dbang po rtul po rnams kyi thob pa de dgag par byed de des na de dag bar chad med pa'i lam zhes bya'o //
analyzed: na'i dbang po rtul po rnams kyi thob pa de dgag par byed de des na de dag bar chad med pa'i lam zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore they are called uninterrupted paths.

original: dbang bo rtul po'i thob pa dang bral bas de'i mjug thogs su skye ba'i phyir rnam par grol ba'i lam zhes bya'o //üîΩde la bar chad med pa'i lam thams cad rtogs pa'i skal ba can gyi rigs can no //
analyzed: dbang bo rtul po'i thob pa dang bral bas de'i mjug thogs su skye ba'i phyir rnam par grol ba'i lam zhes bya'o // de la bar chad med pa'i lam thams cad rtogs pa'i skal ba can gyi rigs can no //
translated: Because it arises immediately after the obtainment of the sharp faculty, it is called the path of liberation.

original: rnam par grol ba'i lam brgyad pa dang dgu pa la ni mi g-yo ba'i chos can gyi rigs can nyid skye'o //
analyzed: rnam par grol ba'i lam brgyad pa dang dgu pa la ni mi g-yo ba'i chos can gyi rigs can nyid skye'o //
translated: On the path of liberation, the eighth and ninth stages, the lineage of the unshakable one is produced.

original: der mi slob pa'i kun rdzob shes pa yang thob par byed do //
analyzed: der mi slob pa'i kun rdzob shes pa yang thob par byed do //
translated: And on that path, the conventional knowledge of the nonlearner is also obtained.

original: dang po'i zad pa shes pa dang slob pa'i 'bras bu dang bo thob pa bzhin thams cad zag pa med pa nyid do //
analyzed: dang po'i zad pa shes pa dang slob pa'i 'bras bu dang bo thob pa bzhin thams cad zag pa med pa nyid do //
translated: Just as the first knowledge of elimination and the first fruit of the learner are uncontaminated, so are all the others.

original: de ltar 'di dag mi slob pa'i 'bras bu'i lam gyis bsdus pa nyid du shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar 'di dag mi slob pa'i 'bras bu'i lam gyis bsdus pa nyid du shes par bya'o //
translated: Thus, they should be understood as included in the path of the nonlearner's fruit.

original: slob pa dang mi slob pa'i lam gyis brtan par byas pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni gnas skabs gnyis su goms pa'i phyir shin tu goms pa'o zhes ston par byed do //
analyzed: slob pa dang mi slob pa'i lam gyis brtan par byas pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni gnas skabs gnyis su goms pa'i phyir shin tu goms pa'o zhes ston par byed do //
translated: Because they are stabilized by the learner's and nonlearner's paths, they are called very familiar, because they are cultivated in two states.

original: mthong bas thob la re re'o zhes @266b bya ba la /
analyzed: mthong bas thob la re re'o zhes @266b bya ba la /
translated: Those who obtain results by insight have one each.

original: gzhan du ma yin par goms pa'i phyir de'i rigs ni dad pas mos pa ste /üîΩgang gi tshe rtogs pa'i skal ba can gyi rigs mthong bas thob pa rtogs par byed pa na ste /üîΩgal te 'bras bu'i khyad par gyi lam thob par gyur pa na /
analyzed: gzhan du ma yin par goms pa'i phyir de'i rigs ni dad pas mos pa ste / gang gi tshe rtogs pa'i skal ba can gyi rigs mthong bas thob pa rtogs par byed pa na ste / gal te 'bras bu'i khyad par gyi lam thob par gyur pa na /
translated: Those who are resolute in faith have the lineage of those resolute in faith, since they are not otherwise.üîΩThose who obtain results by insight have the lineage of those who obtain results by insight, since they are not otherwise.üîΩWhen those who are capable of realizing the result of arhatship by insight generate the path that is the distinctive result,

original: de ni 'bras bu'i lam gyis bsdus pa rnam par grol ba'i lam gcig nyid yin no //
analyzed: de ni 'bras bu'i lam gyis bsdus pa rnam par grol ba'i lam gcig nyid yin no //
translated: they have one path of liberation subsumed by the result.

original: bar chad med pa'i lam yang gcig nyid do //
analyzed: bar chad med pa'i lam yang gcig nyid do //
translated: They also have one uninterrupted path.

original: yongs su nyams pa'i chos can yang gang gi tshe mi g-yo ba'i chos can nyid rtogs par byed pa de'i tshe mthar gyis pa'i rim gyis rigs lnga'i dbang po rnams 'phos te mi g-yo ba'i chos can du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yongs su nyams pa'i chos can yang gang gi tshe mi g-yo ba'i chos can nyid rtogs par byed pa de'i tshe mthar gyis pa'i rim gyis rigs lnga'i dbang po rnams 'phos te mi g-yo ba'i chos can du 'gyur ro //
translated: When those who are subject to complete degeneration generate the lineage of those who are immutable, they gradually upgrade their intellectual faculty through the five lineages and become immutable.

original: de lta ma yin na yongs su nyams pa'i chos can la sogs pa rnams kyang rtogs pa'i skal ba can du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na yongs su nyams pa'i chos can la sogs pa rnams kyang rtogs pa'i skal ba can du 'gyur ro //
translated: If that were not so, those who are subject to complete degeneration and so on would become those who are capable of realizing the result of arhatship by insight.

original: de bzhin du mthong bas thob pa rtogs par byed ba la yang sbyar ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du mthong bas thob pa rtogs par byed ba la yang sbyar ro //
translated: So too, this should be applied to the path of seeing that obtains the result of once return.

original: gang yang rnam par grol ba'i lam las yongs su nyams pa de gzhan du rnam par grol ba'i lam nyid la gnas na ji ltar yang de'i rigs can gyis bar chad med pa'i lam gyis rang gi rigs dang nye ba'i thob pa 'dren par rigs she na /
analyzed: gang yang rnam par grol ba'i lam las yongs su nyams pa de gzhan du rnam par grol ba'i lam nyid la gnas na ji ltar yang de'i rigs can gyis bar chad med pa'i lam gyis rang gi rigs dang nye ba'i thob pa 'dren par rigs she na /
translated: If one degenerates from the liberated path, then when one abides in the liberated path alone, how could the uncontaminated path of the same type induce obtainment of the same type and its near attainment?

original: ji ltar 'jig rten chos mchog so so skye bo'i rgyud can gyis kyang de dang nye ba'i chos 'dren la /
analyzed: ji ltar 'jig rten chos mchog so so skye bo'i rgyud can gyis kyang de dang nye ba'i chos 'dren la /
translated: Just as the supreme mundane state of the summit of existence induces the Dharma of the same type,

original: ji ltar 'dod pa la 'dod chags dang bral ba dbang po sbyangs pa bar chad med pa'i lam gyis dbang po ma sbyangs par bsdus pa rnams kyis kyang dbang po sbyong ba yin pas na thams cad du gcig nyid do //
analyzed: ji ltar 'dod pa la 'dod chags dang bral ba dbang po sbyangs pa bar chad med pa'i lam gyis dbang po ma sbyangs par bsdus pa rnams kyis kyang dbang po sbyong ba yin pas na thams cad du gcig nyid do //
translated: just as those free from attachment to the desire realm who upgrade their intellectual faculty induce the intellectual faculty that is not upgraded by the uncontaminated path, and just as those who upgrade their intellectual faculty induce the intellectual faculty that is not upgraded by the contaminated path, in all cases it is the same type.

original: mi g-yo ba rtogs pa la mthong bas thob pa la yang ngo //
analyzed: mi g-yo ba rtogs pa la mthong bas thob pa la yang ngo //
translated: This also applies to the realization of immutability by those who obtain results by insight.

original: gzhan dag na re dbang po 'pho bas ni mthong ba dang bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa kun nas ldang ba dang bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa shes pas mngon du rgyu ba zlog par byed la /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re dbang po 'pho bas ni mthong ba dang bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa kun nas ldang ba dang bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa shes pas mngon du rgyu ba zlog par byed la /
translated: Others say: Through upgrading one's intellectual faculty, one stops the manifest action of affliction abandoned by the path of seeing and meditation and the manifest action of obscured neutral states through the knowledge of elimination and nonarising.

original: mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa kun nas ldang ba ni slob pas zlog par byed cing /
analyzed: mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa kun nas ldang ba ni slob pas zlog par byed cing /
translated: One stops the manifest action of affliction abandoned by the path of seeing through the learner.

original: bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa kun nas ldang ba ni mi slob pas bzlog pas so //
analyzed: bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa kun nas ldang ba ni mi slob pas bzlog pas so //
translated: One stops the manifest action of affliction abandoned by the path of meditation through the nonlearner.

original: de'i phyir ji ltar kun nas slong ba po spangs pa de ltar de'i kun nas ldang ba yang spangs pas mi slob pa'i bar chad med pa'i lam dang rnam par grol ba'i lam dgu yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir ji ltar kun nas slong ba po spangs pa de ltar de'i kun nas ldang ba yang spangs pas mi slob pa'i bar chad med pa'i lam dang rnam par grol ba'i lam dgu yin no //
translated: Therefore, just as the instigator is abandoned, so too the instigated is abandoned. Thus there are nine uninterrupted and liberated paths of the nonlearner.

original: slob pa'i ni gcig kho na yin no zhes @267a * //
analyzed: slob pa'i ni gcig kho na yin no zhes @267a * //
translated: There is only one for the learner.

original: zer ro // de bzhin du yongs su nyams pa'i chos can la sogs pa rnams kyang 'chi bar sems pa'i chos can la sogs pa'i dbang po 'pho bas so zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: zer ro // de bzhin du yongs su nyams pa'i chos can la sogs pa rnams kyang 'chi bar sems pa'i chos can la sogs pa'i dbang po 'pho bas so zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: So too, those who are subject to complete degeneration and so on also upgrade their intellectual faculty by becoming those who contemplate death and so on.

analyzed: gzhan du ni ma yin te zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'i lha drug po rnams su'o //

original: lam gyi nus pas dbang po rtul po'i rgyud dor te 'bring po'am chen po thob pa 'di ni dbang po 'phel ba dang sbyangs pa dang 'pho ba zhes bya'o //

original: mi slob sa dgu la brten te //
analyzed: mi slob sa dgu la brten te //

analyzed: slob pa drug la zhes bya ba ni srid pa'i dbang du byas nas bshad de /

analyzed: de lta ma yin te btang ba dang thob pa dag dus rnam par chad pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //

original: tu l'a n'a mo n'a ma pa de ti /
analyzed: tu l'a n'a mo n'a ma pa de ti /
translated: Tula nƒÅma om nama·∏•üîΩIf one obtains the result of nonreturn,

analyzed: 'bras bu'i lam khon thob par 'gyur na zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'i khams la 'dod chags dang bral ba tsam gyis bsdus pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //

analyzed: phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu gzugs med pa'i sas bsdus pa yod pa ma yin te /

analyzed: mthar gyis pas ni mi lcogs pa med pas @267b bsdus pa'i lam gyis phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'dras bu thob la /

analyzed: 'dod pa dang 'dod chags dang bral ba yang sa drug las gang yang rung bas bsdus pas de gzugs med pas bsdus pa med de /

original: de la mthong ba'i lam med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la mthong ba'i lam med pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: nyan thos bdun gang zhe na zhes bya ba ni mdo las drug tu gsungs pa zhes byas te dri ba'o //

analyzed: mdo las slob pa drug nyid du bstan pa der yang 'di dag ma bsdus pa'i phyir yon gnas ma yin par thal bar 'gyur ro zhe na /

analyzed: de'i phyir sangs rgyas gnyis ni mi g-yo ba'i bye brag kho na yin te zhes bya ba smos te /

analyzed: dbang po'i bye brag gi dbang du byas nas rnam pa gsum mo //
translated: From the perspective of the different intellectual capacities, there are three types.

original: dbang po chen po ni mi g-yo ba'i chos can du rnam par gzhag la /
analyzed: dbang po chen po ni mi g-yo ba'i chos can du rnam par gzhag la /
translated: Those of great intellectual capacity are classified as immovables.

original: chen po'i bye brag gi nang du 'dus pa'i dbye ba'i dbang du byas te nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang sangs rgyas rnam par gzhag ste /
analyzed: chen po'i bye brag gi nang du 'dus pa'i dbye ba'i dbang du byas te nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang sangs rgyas rnam par gzhag ste /

original: de ltar mi g-yo ba'i bye brag kho na las sangs rgyas gnyis yin no //
analyzed: de ltar mi g-yo ba'i bye brag kho na las sangs rgyas gnyis yin no //

original: chung ngu'i chung ngu la sogs pa dbang po rnam pa dgu'i bye brag las gang zag dgur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chung ngu'i chung ngu la sogs pa dbang po rnam pa dgu'i bye brag las gang zag dgur 'gyur ro //
translated: The nine persons are established from the classification of the nine kinds of faculties, weak-weak, etc.

original: dbang po chung ngu'i chung ngu ni yongs su nyams pa'i chos can no //
analyzed: dbang po chung ngu'i chung ngu ni yongs su nyams pa'i chos can no //

analyzed: chung ngu'i 'bring ni 'chi bar sems pa'i chos can no //

analyzed: chung ngu'i chen po ni rjes su bsrung ba'i chos can no //

translated: Similarly, the person who is unshakable in the sense of abiding, the person who is unshakable in the sense of being destined for penetration, and the person who is unshakable in the sense of being purified of resistances should be applied to the medium-weak and so on.

original: dang po nyid nas mi g-yo ba'i chos can gyi nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang sangs rgyas rnams ni dbang po chen po'i rnam pa dag tu sbyar bar bya'o //

original: de ltar na 'di dag ni mi slob pa'i gang zag dbang po rnam pa dgu'i dbye bas dgu yin no //

analyzed: de ni 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa thob pa'i phyir rnam par thar pa'i sgrib pa las rnam par grol lo //
