analyzed: rnam par thar pa ni gzugs can gzugs la blta ba @268b zhes rgyas par 'byung ba'o //
translated: Liberation is the eight liberations, such as the liberation of form seeing form and so on.

original: rnam par thar pa la bsgribs pas na rnam par thar pa'i sgrib pa ste /
analyzed: rnam par thar pa la bsgribs pas na rnam par thar pa'i sgrib pa ste /
translated: The obscuration of liberation is the obscuration to the eight liberations.

original: de yang gang gis bsam gtan dag skyed par mi nus pa lus dang sems dag las su mi rung ba nyid do //
analyzed: de yang gang gis bsam gtan dag skyed par mi nus pa lus dang sems dag las su mi rung ba nyid do //
translated: Moreover, it is unserviceability of the body and mind that prevents one from generating the meditative development of the meditative absorptions.

original: dgra bcom pa'i rnam par grol ba thob pas nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa'i cha las rnam par grol te /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa'i rnam par grol ba thob pas nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa'i cha las rnam par grol te /
translated: The arhat is liberated from the part of the obscuration that consists in the notional attachment to the personal entity and the dharmas because he has attained the 'liberation of the arhat'.

original: de'i phyir snyoms par 'jug pa'i rnam par grol ba las gnyi ga'i cha las rnam par grol ba rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: de'i phyir snyoms par 'jug pa'i rnam par grol ba las gnyi ga'i cha las rnam par grol ba rnam par gzhag go //
translated: Therefore, the one who is liberated from both parts is determined as being the one who is liberated through the meditative development of the meditative absorptions.

original: rdzas su ni de dag rnam pa drug yin te zhes bya ba ni lus kyis mngon du byed pa ni dad pas mos pa dang / mthong bas thob pa gnyis kyi khongs su 'dus pa'i phyir dang / gnyi ga'i cha las rnam par grol ba ni dus dang mi sbyor ba rnam par grol ba gnyis kyi khongs su 'dus pa'i phyir rdzas su ni drug yin no //
analyzed: rdzas su ni de dag rnam pa drug yin te zhes bya ba ni lus kyis mngon du byed pa ni dad pas mos pa dang / mthong bas thob pa gnyis kyi khongs su 'dus pa'i phyir dang / gnyi ga'i cha las rnam par grol ba ni dus dang mi sbyor ba rnam par grol ba gnyis kyi khongs su 'dus pa'i phyir rdzas su ni drug yin no //
translated: In substance, they are six kinds. The meditative development of the meditative absorptions is sixfold in substance because the one who manifests through the body is included in the two, namely, the one who is resolute in faith and the one who obtains through views and because the one who is liberated from both parts is included in the two, namely, the one liberated regardless of circumstances and the one liberated after some time.

original: dbang po'i sgo nas ni gsum mo zhes bya ba ni dad pa'i rjes su 'brang ba dbang po rtul po yin mod kyi /
analyzed: dbang po'i sgo nas ni gsum mo zhes bya ba ni dad pa'i rjes su 'brang ba dbang po rtul po yin mod kyi /
translated: From the point of view of faculties, there are three.

original: slar chung ngu dang chen po'i bye brag gis dbye ste /
analyzed: slar chung ngu dang chen po'i bye brag gis dbye ste /
translated: The faith-follower is of dull faculties, but he is divided into small and great by way of the distinction of weak and strong.

original: de dag dbang po rtul por mtshungs kyang shin tu rtul ba dang ches shin tu rnal ba'i bye brag yod pas so //
analyzed: de dag dbang po rtul por mtshungs kyang shin tu rtul ba dang ches shin tu rnal ba'i bye brag yod pas so //
translated: Although they are similar in having dull faculties, there is a distinction of very dull and extremely dull.

original: rigs kyi sgo nas ni lnga'o zhes bya ba ni mi g-yo ba'i chos can gyi rigs ma gtogs pa lhag ma lnga'o //
analyzed: rigs kyi sgo nas ni lnga'o zhes bya ba ni mi g-yo ba'i chos can gyi rigs ma gtogs pa lhag ma lnga'o //
translated: From the point of view of lineage, there are five.üîΩThe five remaining lineages except for the immovable one are the three previously explained, plus the faith-follower and the one obtaining results by insight.

original: sngar bshad pa gsum po re re la rigs kyi bye brag yod de /
analyzed: sngar bshad pa gsum po re re la rigs kyi bye brag yod de /
translated: Each of those three previously explained has a distinction of lineage.

original: de ltar na rigs dang dbang po'i sgo nas bco lnga yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na rigs dang dbang po'i sgo nas bco lnga yin no //
translated: Thus, from the point of view of lineage and faculties, there are fifteen.

original: de bzhin du bco lnga po de dag re re zhing lam gyi sgo nas ni bco lnga bco lnga yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du bco lnga po de dag re re zhing lam gyi sgo nas ni bco lnga bco lnga yin no //
translated: In the same way, each of those fifteen, from the point of view of path, is fifteen.üîΩThey abide in seven knowledges.

original: shes pa bdun la gnas pa'o zhes bya ba ni lam la rjes su shes pa ni bsgom pa'i lam yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes pa bdun la gnas pa'o zhes bya ba ni lam la rjes su shes pa ni bsgom pa'i lam yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Knowledge of the path is the path of meditation.

original: de dag nyid lam gyi sgo nas ni yang re re zhing bco lnga bco lnga yin no //
analyzed: de dag nyid lam gyi sgo nas ni yang re re zhing bco lnga bco lnga yin no //
translated: In terms of the path, each of these is fifteen.

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba'i sgo nas ni re re yang bdun cu rtsa gsum gsum yin no //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba'i sgo nas ni re re yang bdun cu rtsa gsum gsum yin no //
translated: In terms of freedom from attachment, each is seventy-three.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is this?

original: 'dod pa'i khams na 'ching ba mtha' dag dang ldan pa gcig dang / 'dod pa'i khams la rnam pa gcig spangs pa nas rnam pa dgu spangs pa'i bar dang / de bzhin du ci yang med pa'i skye mched kyi rnam pa gcig spangs pa nas rnam pa dgu spangs pa'i bar te /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams na 'ching ba mtha' dag dang ldan pa gcig dang / 'dod pa'i khams la rnam pa gcig spangs pa nas rnam pa dgu spangs pa'i bar dang / de bzhin du ci yang med pa'i skye mched kyi rnam pa gcig spangs pa nas rnam pa dgu spangs pa'i bar te /
translated: In the desire realm there is one who possesses all the fetters, one who has abandoned one type of the desire realm up to one who has abandoned nine types, and similarly one who has abandoned one type up to nine types of the base of nothingness.

original: de dag ni 'dod pa'i khams dang / bsam gtan bzhi dang / gzugs med pa gsum na dgu tshan brgyad la bdun cu rtsa gnyis yin @269a * //
analyzed: de dag ni 'dod pa'i khams dang / bsam gtan bzhi dang / gzugs med pa gsum na dgu tshan brgyad la bdun cu rtsa gnyis yin @269a * //
translated: These are the seventy-two that are the eight groups of nine in the desire realm, the four absorptions and the three formless realms.

original: la ; 'dod pa'i khams kyi 'ching ba mtha' dag dang ldan pas bsnan na bdun cu rtsa gsum yin no //
analyzed: la ; 'dod pa'i khams kyi 'ching ba mtha' dag dang ldan pas bsnan na bdun cu rtsa gsum yin no //
translated: Adding one who possesses all the fetters of the desire realm makes seventy-three.

original: srid pa'i rtse mo 'dod chags dang bral ba ni 'dir mi brtsi ste /
analyzed: srid pa'i rtse mo 'dod chags dang bral ba ni 'dir mi brtsi ste /
translated: Freedom from attachment to the summit of existence is not counted here because

original: mthong ba'i lam snga rol du de las 'dod chags dang bral pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam snga rol du de las 'dod chags dang bral pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: there is no freedom from attachment to that prior to the path of seeing.üîΩIn terms of basis, there are nine,

original: rten gyi sgo nas ni dgu ste zhes bya ba ni re re zhing ste /
analyzed: rten gyi sgo nas ni dgu ste zhes bya ba ni re re zhing ste /
translated: because there are nine types of basis.

original: rten ni bskyed pa'i skye ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rten ni bskyed pa'i skye ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Basis means the generation of the path.üîΩIn the three continents

original: gling gsum dang zhes bya ba ni byang gi sgra mi snyan ma gtogs pa ste de na lam med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gling gsum dang zhes bya ba ni byang gi sgra mi snyan ma gtogs pa ste de na lam med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: means in the three continents except for Uttarakuru because the path does not exist there.üîΩBorn in the six divine realms

original: lha'i ris drug tu skyes pa'o zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa na spod pa'i lha'i ris drug tu skyes pa ste /
analyzed: lha'i ris drug tu skyes pa'o zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa na spod pa'i lha'i ris drug tu skyes pa ste /
translated: means born in the six divine realms of the desire realm.

original: de'i gong na mthong ba'i lam med pa'i phyir dad pa'i rjes su 'brang ba med do //
analyzed: de'i gong na mthong ba'i lam med pa'i phyir dad pa'i rjes su 'brang ba med do //
translated: Because the path of seeing does not exist above that, there are no followers of faith.üîΩIn terms of faculty, type, path, freedom from attachment and basis

original: dbang po dang rigs dang lam dang 'dod chags dang bral ba dang rten gyi sgo nas ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung bas ni de nyid kyis sdud pa'o //
analyzed: dbang po dang rigs dang lam dang 'dod chags dang bral ba dang rten gyi sgo nas ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung bas ni de nyid kyis sdud pa'o //
translated: is a detailed explanation of that.

original: gang zag gzhan dag kyang ci rigs par de bzhin du brtsi par bya'o zhes bya ba ni chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: gang zag gzhan dag kyang ci rigs par de bzhin du brtsi par bya'o zhes bya ba ni chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: Other persons should be calculated in the same way, as appropriate.

original: ji ltar dad pas rjes su 'brang ba dbang po dang rigs dang lam dang 'dod chags dang bral ba dang rten gyi sgo nas brtsis pa bzhin du brtsi par bya'o //
analyzed: ji ltar dad pas rjes su 'brang ba dbang po dang rigs dang lam dang 'dod chags dang bral ba dang rten gyi sgo nas brtsis pa bzhin du brtsi par bya'o //
translated: They should be calculated in the same way as the pursuer of faith is calculated in terms of intellectual faculty, lineage, path, freedom from attachment, and basis.

original: ci rigs par zhes bya ba ni chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba dang / mthong bas thob pa dang dus dang mi sbyor bar rnam par grol ba rnams la ni rigs kyi khyad par med do //
analyzed: ci rigs par zhes bya ba ni chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba dang / mthong bas thob pa dang dus dang mi sbyor bar rnam par grol ba rnams la ni rigs kyi khyad par med do //
translated: As appropriate means that the pursuer of reality and the one attaining through views do not differ in terms of lineage.

original: de la rigs kyi sgo nas gcig go //
analyzed: de la rigs kyi sgo nas gcig go //
translated: In terms of lineage, there is one.

original: chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba dbang po'i sgo nas gsum mo //
analyzed: chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba dbang po'i sgo nas gsum mo //
translated: In terms of intellectual faculty, the pursuer of reality is threefold.

original: lam gyi sgo nas re re zhing bco lnga ste bzod pa brgyad dang shes pa bdun la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: lam gyi sgo nas re re zhing bco lnga ste bzod pa brgyad dang shes pa bdun la gnas pa'o //
translated: In terms of path, each is fifteen, abiding in eight acceptances and seven knowledges.

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba'i sgo nas ni bdun cu rtsa gsum ste sngar bshad do //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba'i sgo nas ni bdun cu rtsa gsum ste sngar bshad do //
translated: In terms of freedom from attachment, there are seventy three, as previously explained.

original: bco lnga po re re zhing rten gyi sgo nas dgur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bco lnga po re re zhing rten gyi sgo nas dgur 'gyur ro //
translated: Each of the fifteen is ninefold according to its basis.

original: de bzhin du dbang po dang 'dod chags dang bral ba dang gnas kyi sgo nas bsdoms na dgu stong dang brgyad brgya lnga bcu'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du dbang po dang 'dod chags dang bral ba dang gnas kyi sgo nas bsdoms na dgu stong dang brgyad brgya lnga bcu'o //
translated: Thus, there are nine thousand eight hundred and fifty by adding the faculties, freedom from attachment, and the abodes.

original: de bzhin du gzhan la yang brtsi bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhan la yang brtsi bar bya'o //
translated: The other should be calculated in the same way.

original: rnam par thar pa ni brgyad de /
analyzed: rnam par thar pa ni brgyad de /
translated: The liberations are eight in number.

original: gzugs can gzugs rnams la blta ba zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs can gzugs rnams la blta ba zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa'o //
translated: The first is the liberation of the form realm beings who see forms.

original: yang rnam par thar pa'i sgrib pa 'di gang zhig ce na /üîΩgang gis rnam par thar pa dag skyed par mi nus te /
analyzed: yang rnam par thar pa'i sgrib pa 'di gang zhig ce na / gang gis rnam par thar pa dag skyed par mi nus te /
translated: What is the obstruction to the liberations?

original: lus dang sems @269b las su mi rung pa nyid do //
analyzed: lus dang sems @269b las su mi rung pa nyid do //
translated: It is the unfitness of the body and mind, which prevents the arising of the liberations.

original: yang des rnam par thar pa la ci'i phyir sgrib ce na /
analyzed: yang des rnam par thar pa la ci'i phyir sgrib ce na /
translated: Why is it an obstruction to the liberations?

original: gang gi phyir dgra bcom pa sems rnam par grol yang rnam par thar pa ma skyed pa'i phyir yang rnam par grol bar bya bas na rnam par thar pa la sgrib ces bya ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir dgra bcom pa sems rnam par grol yang rnam par thar pa ma skyed pa'i phyir yang rnam par grol bar bya bas na rnam par thar pa la sgrib ces bya ste /
translated: Because even though the arhats have liberated minds, they do not generate the liberations.

original: rdzu 'phrul shes pa la ma bsgribs lung ma bstan no ;
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul shes pa la ma bsgribs lung ma bstan no ;
translated: The knowledge of supernormal power is unobscured-non-defined.

original: / gzhan dag na re sngar nyid du nges spangs pa khams las 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid las rnam par thar pa ma lus pa bskyed de kun tu mi spyod pa las rnam par gzhag go zhes zer ro //
analyzed: / gzhan dag na re sngar nyid du nges spangs pa khams las 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid las rnam par thar pa ma lus pa bskyed de kun tu mi spyod pa las rnam par gzhag go zhes zer ro //
translated: Others say: The complete generation of the liberations is established from the prior definite abandonment of the defilements and from the freedom from attachment to the realms.

original: gzhan dag ni snyoms par 'jug pa la mi dbang ba rnam par thar pa'i sgrib pa'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag ni snyoms par 'jug pa la mi dbang ba rnam par thar pa'i sgrib pa'o zhes zer ro //
translated: Others say: The obstruction to the liberations is the lack of mastery in meditative attainment.

original: gzhan dag ni snyoms par 'jug pa ma thob pa nyid do zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag ni snyoms par 'jug pa ma thob pa nyid do zhes zer ro //
translated: Others say: It is the non-attainment of meditative attainment.

original: gzhan dag na re /üîΩau d'a s'i na tvata /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re / au d'a s'i na tvata /
translated: Others say:üîΩThe obstruction to the generation of the liberations is the non-mastery in meditative attainment, because one is not accustomed to the practice of meditative attainment.

original: sbyor ba mnyan pa la ma goms pa'i phyir rnam par thar pa skyed par mi byed pa de nyid 'di'i sgrib pa yin te snga ma nyid rigs so zhes zer ro //
analyzed: sbyor ba mnyan pa la ma goms pa'i phyir rnam par thar pa skyed par mi byed pa de nyid 'di'i sgrib pa yin te snga ma nyid rigs so zhes zer ro //
translated: The former explanation is correct.

original: 'di la gang zhig nyon mongs pa lnga spangs te zhi zhes bya ba ni kun tu sbyor ba'i tha ma'i cha dang mthun pa lnga'o //
analyzed: 'di la gang zhig nyon mongs pa lnga spangs te zhi zhes bya ba ni kun tu sbyor ba'i tha ma'i cha dang mthun pa lnga'o //
translated: Here, the abandonment of the five defilements and the pacification refers to the five lower fetters.

original: mi 'phrogs chos can zhes bya ba ni yongs su mi nyams pa'i chos can no //
analyzed: mi 'phrogs chos can zhes bya ba ni yongs su mi nyams pa'i chos can no //
translated: One who is irreversible is one who is not subject to retrogression.

original: phyir mi 'ong ba dad pas mos pa lus kyis mngon sum du byed pa ma yin pa ni 'bras bu kho na las so //
analyzed: phyir mi 'ong ba dad pas mos pa lus kyis mngon sum du byed pa ma yin pa ni 'bras bu kho na las so //
translated: One who is not a faith-follower but a bodily witness is complete only in terms of the result, because he is a non-returner.

original: dbang po rtul po yin pa'i phyir dbang po'i sgo nas yongs su rdzogs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: dbang po rtul po yin pa'i phyir dbang po'i sgo nas yongs su rdzogs pa ma yin no //
translated: He is not complete in terms of the faculties, because he is of dull faculties.

original: 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa med pa'i phyir snyoms par 'jug pa'i sgo nas kyang ma yin no //
analyzed: 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa med pa'i phyir snyoms par 'jug pa'i sgo nas kyang ma yin no //
translated: He is not complete in terms of meditative development, because he does not possess the meditative attainment of cessation.

original: slob pa'i 'bras bu'i mthar gnas pa'i phyir 'bras bu kho na'i sgo nas yongs su rdzogs pa yin no //
analyzed: slob pa'i 'bras bu'i mthar gnas pa'i phyir 'bras bu kho na'i sgo nas yongs su rdzogs pa yin no //
translated: He is complete only in terms of the result, because he is established in the result.

original: mthong bas thob pa 'dod chags dang ma bral ba ni dbang po ko na las so zhes bya ba ni de ni dbang po rnon po yin pa'i phyir dbang po kho na'i sgo nas yongs su rdzogs kyi /
analyzed: mthong bas thob pa 'dod chags dang ma bral ba ni dbang po ko na las so zhes bya ba ni de ni dbang po rnon po yin pa'i phyir dbang po kho na'i sgo nas yongs su rdzogs kyi /
translated: One who is not detached and who has attained through insight is complete only in terms of the faculties, because he is of sharp faculties.

original: 'dod chags dang ma bral ba'i phyir snyoms par 'jug pa dang 'bras bu'i sgo nas yongs su rdzogs pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang ma bral ba'i phyir snyoms par 'jug pa dang 'bras bu'i sgo nas yongs su rdzogs pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Because he is not free from attachment, he is not perfect in terms of meditative attainment and result.üîΩA nonreturner who obtains the result by insight and does not manifest the transcendent path is perfect in terms of result and intellectual faculty.

original: phyir mi 'ong ba mthong bas thob pa lus kyis mngon sum du byed pa ma yin pa ni 'bras bu dang dbang po las so zhes bya ba ni de dbang po rnon po yin pa'i phyir dang / slob pa'i 'bras bu'i mthar gnas pa'i phyir dbang po dang 'bras bu'i sgo nas yongs su rdzogs pa yin gyi /üîΩlus kyis mngon sum du ma byas pa'i @270a * //
analyzed: phyir mi 'ong ba mthong bas thob pa lus kyis mngon sum du byed pa ma yin pa ni 'bras bu dang dbang po las so zhes bya ba ni de dbang po rnon po yin pa'i phyir dang / slob pa'i 'bras bu'i mthar gnas pa'i phyir dbang po dang 'bras bu'i sgo nas yongs su rdzogs pa yin gyi / lus kyis mngon sum du ma byas pa'i @270a * //
translated: He is perfect in terms of result because he is a learner who abides in the final result.üîΩHe is perfect in terms of intellectual faculty because he possesses sharp intellectual faculty.

original: phyir snyoms par 'jug pa'i sgo nas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: phyir snyoms par 'jug pa'i sgo nas ni ma yin no //
translated: He is not perfect in terms of meditative attainment because he does not manifest the transcendent path through the body.üîΩA nonreturner who is resolute in faith and manifests the transcendent path through the body is perfect in terms of result and meditative attainment.

original: dad pas mos pa lus kyis mngon du byed pa ni 'bras bu dang snyoms par 'jug pa las so zhes bya ba ni dbang po rtul po yin pa'i phyir dbang po'i sgo nas yongs su rdzogs pa ni med do //
analyzed: dad pas mos pa lus kyis mngon du byed pa ni 'bras bu dang snyoms par 'jug pa las so zhes bya ba ni dbang po rtul po yin pa'i phyir dbang po'i sgo nas yongs su rdzogs pa ni med do //
translated: He is not perfect in terms of intellectual faculty because he possesses weak intellectual faculty.

original: phyir mi 'ong ba lus kyis mngon du byed pa ni 'bras bu dang dbang po dang snyoms par 'jug pa las so zhes bya ba ni dbang po rnon po yin pa'i phyir dang / 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa thob pa'i phyir dang / slob pa'i 'bras bu thams cad thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyir mi 'ong ba lus kyis mngon du byed pa ni 'bras bu dang dbang po dang snyoms par 'jug pa las so zhes bya ba ni dbang po rnon po yin pa'i phyir dang / 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa thob pa'i phyir dang / slob pa'i 'bras bu thams cad thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Nonreturners who physically manifest nirvana are classified by their result, intellectual faculty, and meditative attainment.üîΩThey are not classified by meditative attainment alone or by meditative attainment and intellectual faculty, because they are sharp intellectual faculty, they obtain the meditative attainment of cessation, and they obtain all learner results.üîΩThey are not classified by meditative attainment alone or by meditative attainment and intellectual faculty, because they are sharp intellectual faculty, they obtain the meditative attainment of cessation, and they obtain all learner results.

original: snyoms par 'jug pa kho na dang snyoms par 'jug pa dang dbang po las yongs su rdzogs pa nyid ni med do zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu med par slob pa 'gog pa la snyoms par 'jug pa med de /üîΩgang gi phyir 'bras bu med par mi slob pa nyid yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug pa kho na dang snyoms par 'jug pa dang dbang po las yongs su rdzogs pa nyid ni med do zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu med par slob pa 'gog pa la snyoms par 'jug pa med de /üîΩgang gi phyir 'bras bu med par mi slob pa nyid yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are not classified by meditative attainment alone or by meditative attainment and intellectual faculty, because they are sharp intellectual faculty, they obtain the meditative attainment of cessation, and they obtain all learner results.

original: shes rab kyis rnam par grol ba dus dang mi sbyor bar rnam par grol ba ni dbang po kho na las so zhes bya ba ni 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa med pa'i phyir snyoms par 'jug pa'i sgo nas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: shes rab kyis rnam par grol ba dus dang mi sbyor bar rnam par grol ba ni dbang po kho na las so zhes bya ba ni 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa med pa'i phyir snyoms par 'jug pa'i sgo nas ni ma yin no //
translated: One liberated by wisdom who is liberated regardless of circumstances is so only by means of the controlling faculties. This is not by means of meditative attainment, because the meditative attainment of cessation does not exist.

original: gnyi ga'i cha las rnam par grol ba zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni dbang po rtul po yin pa'i phyir dbang po'i sgo nas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gnyi ga'i cha las rnam par grol ba zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni dbang po rtul po yin pa'i phyir dbang po'i sgo nas ni ma yin no //
translated: One who is liberated by both parts is not so by means of the controlling faculties, because he is of dull faculties.

original: gnyi ga'i cha las rnam par grol ba dus dang mi sbyor ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa la dbang po rnon po yin pa'i phyir dang / 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa thob pa'i phyir gnyis kyis yongs su rdzogs pa nyid do //
analyzed: gnyi ga'i cha las rnam par grol ba dus dang mi sbyor ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa la dbang po rnon po yin pa'i phyir dang / 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa thob pa'i phyir gnyis kyis yongs su rdzogs pa nyid do //
translated: One who is liberated by both parts and is liberated regardless of circumstances is so by means of both, because he is of sharp faculties and because he has attained the meditative attainment of cessation.

original: sbyor ba'i lam ni gang gis mjug thogs su bar chad med pa'i lam skye ba'o zhes bya ba ni dper na chos kyi mchog rnams lta bu'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba'i lam ni gang gis mjug thogs su bar chad med pa'i lam skye ba'o zhes bya ba ni dper na chos kyi mchog rnams lta bu'o //
translated: The path of preparation is that by which the uninterrupted path arises immediately after it, like the supreme mundane state.

original: mdor byas pa las go bzlog nas bstan pa ni tshig le 'ur byas pa bsdeb pa dang mthun par bya ba'i phyir yin no //
analyzed: mdor byas pa las go bzlog nas bstan pa ni tshig le 'ur byas pa bsdeb pa dang mthun par bya ba'i phyir yin no //
translated: The order of the brief presentation is reversed in order to conform to the order of the verses.

original: bar chad med pa'i lam ni gang gis sgrib pa rab tu spong ba ste sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: bar chad med pa'i lam ni gang gis sgrib pa rab tu spong ba ste sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The uninterrupted path is that by which one abandons the obscurations, such as the perseverance for the knowledge of the dharma with regard to suffering.

original: de spang bar bya ba'i sgrib pa las nges par grol ba zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de spang bar bya ba'i sgrib pa las nges par grol ba zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The path of liberation is that which arises when one is liberated from the obscurations that are to be abandoned by that.

original: bar chad med pa'i lam des spang bar bya ba'i sgrib pa gang yin pa de las nges par grol ba'o //
analyzed: bar chad med pa'i lam des spang bar bya ba'i sgrib pa gang yin pa de las nges par grol ba'o //
translated: The path of liberation is that which arises when one is liberated from the obscurations that are to be abandoned by that uninterrupted path.

original: dbang po nyid du skye ba gang yin pa'o zhes @270b bya ba la /
analyzed: dbang po nyid du skye ba gang yin pa'o zhes @270b bya ba la /
translated: The faculty is that which arises as the faculty.

original: dang po ni thog ma ste dper na sdug bsngal la sogs pa dag la chos shes pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dang po ni thog ma ste dper na sdug bsngal la sogs pa dag la chos shes pa bzhin no //
translated: The first is the initial stage, such as the knowledge of the dharma with regard to suffering.

original: de ni sdug bsngal la sogs pa chos shes pa'i bzod pas spang bar bya ba'i sgrib pa las nges par grol bar skye'o //
analyzed: de ni sdug bsngal la sogs pa chos shes pa'i bzod pas spang bar bya ba'i sgrib pa las nges par grol bar skye'o //
translated: That arises when one is liberated from the obscurations that are to be abandoned by the perseverance for the knowledge of the dharma with regard to suffering.

original: dang po zhes bya ba ci'i phyir gzhan du ni gal te de ltar brjod gang gi phyir de spang bya'i sgrib pa las grol bar skye'o zhes de skad bshad na /
analyzed: dang po zhes bya ba ci'i phyir gzhan du ni gal te de ltar brjod gang gi phyir de spang bya'i sgrib pa las grol bar skye'o zhes de skad bshad na /
translated: Why is the first called? If one says that it is because it is born free from the obscurations to be abandoned,

original: 'di yang bar chad med pa'i lam rnams kyi snga rol du spang bya'i sgrib pa las grol ba'i phyir rnam par grol ba'i lam du thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di yang bar chad med pa'i lam rnams kyi snga rol du spang bya'i sgrib pa las grol ba'i phyir rnam par grol ba'i lam du thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: then this would also be a liberated path, because it is free from the obscurations to be abandoned prior to the uninterrupted paths.

original: khyad par gyi lam ni de dag las gzhan pa'i lam gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba ni sbyor ba dang bar chad med pa dang rnam par grol ba'i lam dag las gzhan pa'o //
analyzed: khyad par gyi lam ni de dag las gzhan pa'i lam gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba ni sbyor ba dang bar chad med pa dang rnam par grol ba'i lam dag las gzhan pa'o //
translated: The special path is any path that is different from those.

original: lam la rjes su shes pa ni rgyun chags pa yin te /
analyzed: lam la rjes su shes pa ni rgyun chags pa yin te /
translated: Subsequent knowledge of the truth of the path is a continuum.

original: de'i skad cig ma dang po ma gtogs pa lhag ma ni khyad par gyi lam mo //
analyzed: de'i skad cig ma dang po ma gtogs pa lhag ma ni khyad par gyi lam mo //
translated: The remaining moments of that continuum, excluding the first moment, are the special path.

original: rnam par grol ba'i shes pa rgyun chags pa gzhan yang de dang 'dra ba brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: rnam par grol ba'i shes pa rgyun chags pa gzhan yang de dang 'dra ba brjod par bya ste /
translated: Other continua of liberated knowledge should be described in the same way.

original: dper na zad pa shes pa la sogs pa dang / de bzhin du dgra bcom pa'i mthong ba'i chos la bde bar gnas pa dang / yon tan khyad par can mngon par sgrub par byed pa'i lam gsum ma gtogs pa gang yin pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na zad pa shes pa la sogs pa dang / de bzhin du dgra bcom pa'i mthong ba'i chos la bde bar gnas pa dang / yon tan khyad par can mngon par sgrub par byed pa'i lam gsum ma gtogs pa gang yin pa lta bu'o //
translated: Similarly, it is like the three paths of the arhat which are the abiding in bliss in this life and the path which accomplishes the special qualities, excluding the three paths of the knowledge of destruction, etc.

original: gal te gang gi mjug thogs su bar chad med pa'i lam sbyor ba'i lam yin na /
analyzed: gal te gang gi mjug thogs su bar chad med pa'i lam sbyor ba'i lam yin na /
translated: If the path of application is the uninterrupted path immediately after the path of vision,

original: de lta na chos kyi mchog gi snga rol gyi lam gang yin pa de la ji skad du brjod par bya zhe na /
analyzed: de lta na chos kyi mchog gi snga rol gyi lam gang yin pa de la ji skad du brjod par bya zhe na /
translated: then what is the path prior to the supreme mundane state?

original: sbyor ba'i lam kho na yin mod kyi de ni thag ring ba yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni chos mchog dag las 'di'i khyad par yin no //
analyzed: sbyor ba'i lam kho na yin mod kyi de ni thag ring ba yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni chos mchog dag las 'di'i khyad par yin no //
translated: It is the path of application, but it is distant. This is the difference between the path of application and the supreme mundane state.

original: sgra bye brag tu bshad pa dri ba'i phyir ci'i phyir lam zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: sgra bye brag tu bshad pa dri ba'i phyir ci'i phyir lam zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: In order to explain the etymology of the word mƒÅrga, he says, ‚ÄúWhy is it called the path?‚Äù

original: mya ngan las 'das pa'i lam yin no zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa'i lam yin no zhes bya ba la /
translated: It is the path to nirvana.

original: lam dang bshul zhes bya ba ni rnam grangs bstan pa'o //
analyzed: lam dang bshul zhes bya ba ni rnam grangs bstan pa'o //
translated: The words path and road are synonyms.

original: ji ltar 'di mya ngan las 'das pa'i lam yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar 'di mya ngan las 'das pa'i lam yin zhe na /
translated: How is this the path to nirvana?

original: de'i phyir de nas der 'gro ba'i phyir zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir de nas der 'gro ba'i phyir zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Therefore, it is said, ‚Äúbecause one goes there from here.‚Äù

original: lam de nas mya ngan las 'das par 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lam de nas mya ngan las 'das par 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because one goes to nirvana from this path.

original: 'dis ni mya ngan las 'das pa 'tshol ba'i phyir 'di ni zhes bya ba ni mya ngan las 'das pa rjes su tshol zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'dis ni mya ngan las 'das pa 'tshol ba'i phyir 'di ni zhes bya ba ni mya ngan las 'das pa rjes su tshol zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Since this is the path to nirvana, it is called ‚Äúthis.‚Äù

original: rnam par grol ba dang khyad par can dang lam dag ji ltar na lam @271a * //
analyzed: rnam par grol ba dang khyad par can dang lam dag ji ltar na lam @271a * //
translated: How are the liberated and special paths paths?

original: nyid yin zhes bya ba ni sbyor ba dang bar chad med pa'i lam dag kho nas nyon mongs pa spong bar nus kyi /üîΩrnam par grol ba dang khyad par gyi lam dag gis ni ma yin te /
analyzed: nyid yin zhes bya ba ni sbyor ba dang bar chad med pa'i lam dag kho nas nyon mongs pa spong bar nus kyi / rnam par grol ba dang khyad par gyi lam dag gis ni ma yin te /
translated: The thought is that only the paths of preparation and uninterrupted path are able to abandon the afflictions.

original: nyon mongs pa rnams spangs zin pa'i phyir ro snyam du bsams pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa rnams spangs zin pa'i phyir ro snyam du bsams pa'o //
translated: The liberated and special paths are not, because the afflictions have already been abandoned.

original: de dang 'dra ba dang ches che ba yin pa'i phyir te zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de dang 'dra ba dang ches che ba yin pa'i phyir te zhes bya ba la /
translated: Because they are similar to it and greater than it.

original: de dag ni spangs pa'i lam dang 'dra ba yin te rab tu dbye ba dang dmigs pa dang rnam pa 'dra ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag ni spangs pa'i lam dang 'dra ba yin te rab tu dbye ba dang dmigs pa dang rnam pa 'dra ba'i phyir ro //
translated: They are similar to the path of abandonment because they are similar in their differentiation, object, and aspect.

original: ches che ba ni rgyu rgyas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ches che ba ni rgyu rgyas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The greater is greater because its cause is extensive.

original: de'i phyir de dag kyang lam nyid yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir de dag kyang lam nyid yin no //
translated: Therefore, they are also the path.

original: de dag ni gong nas gong du phyin par byed pa'i phyir yang lam nyid yin no //
analyzed: de dag ni gong nas gong du phyin par byed pa'i phyir yang lam nyid yin no //
translated: They are also the path because they cause one to proceed higher and higher.

original: de lta na khyad par gyi lam nyid yin pa nyams par 'gyur te de'i gong na lam med pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: de lta na khyad par gyi lam nyid yin pa nyams par 'gyur te de'i gong na lam med pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: If that is so, then the distinction of the path would be lost, because there is no path higher than that.

original: de'i phyir phung po lhag ma ma lus par 'jug pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir phung po lhag ma ma lus par 'jug pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, ‚Äúbecause they cause one to enter the realm without remainder of the aggregates.‚Äù

original: gang gi phyir lam du gyur pa de dag nas phung po lhag ma med pa'i dbyings su 'jug pas de'i phyir de gnyis kyang lam yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir lam du gyur pa de dag nas phung po lhag ma med pa'i dbyings su 'jug pas de'i phyir de gnyis kyang lam yin no //
translated: Because they are the path, they cause one to enter the realm without remainder of the aggregates. Therefore, those two are also the path.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa sgrub par byed pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir des mya ngan las 'das pa sgrub par byed ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa sgrub par byed pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir des mya ngan las 'das pa sgrub par byed ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning: because it is the means of attaining nirvana.üîΩSimilarly, the easy path is also twofold.

original: de bzhin du sla ba yang rnam pa gnyis so zhes bya ba ni mngon par shes pa bul ba sla ba'i lam yang yod ;
analyzed: de bzhin du sla ba yang rnam pa gnyis so zhes bya ba ni mngon par shes pa bul ba sla ba'i lam yang yod ;
translated: There is the path of slow superknowledge that is easy,

original: mngon par shes pa myur ba sla ba'i lam yang yod zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: mngon par shes pa myur ba sla ba'i lam yang yod zhes bya ba'o //
translated: and there is the path of quick superknowledge that is easy.

original: yang ji ltar de dag rnam par gzhag ce na /
analyzed: yang ji ltar de dag rnam par gzhag ce na /
translated: How are they established?

original: sa dang dbang po'i sgo nas so //
analyzed: sa dang dbang po'i sgo nas so //
translated: By the stages and faculties.

original: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate just that,

original: bsam gtan dag gi lam rnams sla //
analyzed: bsam gtan dag gi lam rnams sla //
translated: he says, The paths of the absorptions are easy,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: and so on.üîΩPossessing the factors, by means of the equanimity of serenity and insight.

original: yan lag gis yongs su zin pa dang / zhi gnas dang lhag mthong mnyam pa dag gis zhes bya ba yan lag dag gis yongs su zin pa ni yan lag gis yongs su zin pa'o //
analyzed: yan lag gis yongs su zin pa dang / zhi gnas dang lhag mthong mnyam pa dag gis zhes bya ba yan lag dag gis yongs su zin pa ni yan lag gis yongs su zin pa'o //
translated: Possessing the factors is possessing the limbs.

original: yan lag gis yongs su zin pa zhi gnas lhag mthong mnyam pa nyid ces tshig rnam par sbyar te /üîΩde dag gis 'bad mi dgos par dang gis 'byung ba'i phyir bsam gtan dag gi lam ni lam sla ba yin no //
analyzed: yan lag gis yongs su zin pa zhi gnas lhag mthong mnyam pa nyid ces tshig rnam par sbyar te / de dag gis 'bad mi dgos par dang gis 'byung ba'i phyir bsam gtan dag gi lam ni lam sla ba yin no //
translated: The path of the absorptions is easy since one effortlessly and spontaneously attains the limbs, serenity, insight and their equilibrium.

original: bsam gtan dag gi yan lag gis yongs su zin pa dang / zhi gnas dang lhag mthong mnyam pa nyid du gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: bsam gtan dag gi yan lag gis yongs su zin pa dang / zhi gnas dang lhag mthong mnyam pa nyid du gyur pa yin no //
translated: The path of the absorptions is easy because one effortlessly and spontaneously attains the limbs of the absorptions, serenity and insight and their equilibrium.

original: de'i phyir de'i lam ni 'bad mi dgos par ngang gis @271b 'byung ba yin te chu la gzings bzhin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir de'i lam ni 'bad mi dgos par ngang gis @271b 'byung ba yin te chu la gzings bzhin no //
translated: Therefore, that path occurs spontaneously without effort, like a boat on water.

original: de'i phyir de ni lam sla ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir de ni lam sla ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is easy.

original: bsam gtan gyi dngos gzhi dag las gzhan pa'i sa zag pa med pa rnams kyi lam gang yin pa de ni 'bad nas 'byung ba'i phyir lam dka' ba yin te thang la gzings bzhin no //
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi dngos gzhi dag las gzhan pa'i sa zag pa med pa rnams kyi lam gang yin pa de ni 'bad nas 'byung ba'i phyir lam dka' ba yin te thang la gzings bzhin no //
translated: The path of the uncontaminated stages other than the actual basis of the absorptions is difficult because it occurs through effort, like a boat on land.

original: 'bad nas 'byung ba ni de na yan lag gis zin pa med pa'i phyir dang zhi gnas dang lhag mthong chung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bad nas 'byung ba ni de na yan lag gis zin pa med pa'i phyir dang zhi gnas dang lhag mthong chung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The path of preparation is called difficult because it is not conjoined with the branches of enlightenment and because it has little serenity and insight.

original: 'phags pa'i lam ni dka' ba'i bdag nyid ma yin pa'i phyir dang sdug bsngal ba tshor ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa ma yin pa'i phyir dka' bar mi brjod do //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam ni dka' ba'i bdag nyid ma yin pa'i phyir dang sdug bsngal ba tshor ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa ma yin pa'i phyir dka' bar mi brjod do //
translated: The ƒÅrya path is not called difficult because it is not by nature difficult and because it is not concomitant with the feeling of pain.

original: de bzhin du mi lcogs pa med pa dang bsam gtan khyad par can gyi lam ni zhi gnas chung ngu /
analyzed: de bzhin du mi lcogs pa med pa dang bsam gtan khyad par can gyi lam ni zhi gnas chung ngu /
translated: Similarly, the path of unrestricted access concentration and the special path of the first absorption have little serenity.

original: gzugs med pa dag na ni lhag mthong chung ngu thams cad na ting nge 'dzin yan lag gis yongs su ma zin pa yin no //
analyzed: gzugs med pa dag na ni lhag mthong chung ngu thams cad na ting nge 'dzin yan lag gis yongs su ma zin pa yin no //
translated: In the formless realm, all have little insight and are not conjoined with the branch of concentration.

original: sa'i bye brag gis rnam pa gnyis su phye ba gang yin pa de kho na re re zhing dbang po'i bye brag gis rnam gnyis yin te /
analyzed: sa'i bye brag gis rnam pa gnyis su phye ba gang yin pa de kho na re re zhing dbang po'i bye brag gis rnam gnyis yin te /
translated: The path that is differentiated by the specific levels is twofold. Each of those is twofold due to the differentiation of intellectual faculty.

original: de nyid kyi phyir lam de yang rnam pa gnyis te zhes bya ba rgyas par smos so //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir lam de yang rnam pa gnyis te zhes bya ba rgyas par smos so //
translated: Therefore it is said, ‚ÄúThat path is also twofold.‚Äù

original: lam 'di la mngon par shes pa bul ba yod pas na mngon par shes pa bul ba'o //
analyzed: lam 'di la mngon par shes pa bul ba yod pas na mngon par shes pa bul ba'o //
translated: This path is called ‚Äúslow in higher understanding‚Äù because it is slow in higher understanding.

original: bul ba zhes bya ba ni chung ba zhes bya ba'i don gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: bul ba zhes bya ba ni chung ba zhes bya ba'i don gang yin pa'o //
translated: Slow means small.

original: mngon par shes pa ni shes rab ste /
analyzed: mngon par shes pa ni shes rab ste /
translated: Higher understanding is wisdom.

original: 'dis mngon du chog nas rab tu shes pas na mngon par shes pa'o //
analyzed: 'dis mngon du chog nas rab tu shes pas na mngon par shes pa'o //
translated: It is called ‚Äúhigher understanding‚Äù because one understands through it.

original: gzhan dag na re /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re /
translated: Others say:

original: 'dis myur du shes pas ma yin gyi bul bar shes pas mngon par shes pa bul ba'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: 'dis myur du shes pas ma yin gyi bul bar shes pas mngon par shes pa bul ba'o zhes zer ro //
translated: It is called ‚Äúslow in higher understanding‚Äù because it is slow in understanding, not because it is quick in understanding.

original: yang na 'di gang zag mong rtul po yin pas zhes bya ba ni blun po yin pas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: yang na 'di gang zag mong rtul po yin pas zhes bya ba ni blun po yin pas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Or else, it is called ‚Äúslow‚Äù because it is for a person of dull faculties, that is, because it is for a fool.

original: mong rtul ba yang gang zhig ce na dbang po rtul po gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: mong rtul ba yang gang zhig ce na dbang po rtul po gang yin pa ste /
translated: What is dullness? It is the dullness of the faculties.

original: mngon par shes pa myur ba ni 'di las bzlog pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: mngon par shes pa myur ba ni 'di las bzlog pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: The path that is quick in higher understanding should be understood in the opposite sense.

original: dka' ba dang sla ba 'am bul ba dang myur ba'i lam ni phung po lnga'i rang bzhin du rig par byas la /
analyzed: dka' ba dang sla ba 'am bul ba dang myur ba'i lam ni phung po lnga'i rang bzhin du rig par byas la /
translated: The difficult path and the easy path, or the slow and quick paths, should be understood as having the nature of the five aggregates.

original: shes rab gtso bor bstan pa'i phyir ni mngon par shes pa zhes bshad do //
analyzed: shes rab gtso bor bstan pa'i phyir ni mngon par shes pa zhes bshad do //
translated: The expression ‚Äúsuperknowledge‚Äù is used because of the predominance of wisdom.

original: yang ci dbang po 'bring po yang yod pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: yang ci dbang po 'bring po yang yod pa ma yin nam /
translated: Are there no beings of middling faculties?

original: gang gi phyir lam rnams su dbang po rtul po dang rnon po dag kho na bshad ce na /üîΩkha cig na re yod pa ma yin te dad pa dang chos @272a * //
analyzed: gang gi phyir lam rnams su dbang po rtul po dang rnon po dag kho na bshad ce na / kha cig na re yod pa ma yin te dad pa dang chos @272a * //
translated: Why are only those of weak and sharp faculties mentioned in the paths?

original: kyi rjes su 'brang ba la sogs pa'i dbye bas lam rnam pa gnyis bstan pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //
analyzed: kyi rjes su 'brang ba la sogs pa'i dbye bas lam rnam pa gnyis bstan pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //
translated: Some say: No, because the paths are taught as two types, those who follow faith and those who follow the teaching.

original: gzhan dag ni dbang po 'bring po nges par khas blang bar bya ste /
analyzed: gzhan dag ni dbang po 'bring po nges par khas blang bar bya ste /
translated: Others say: One must definitely accept that there are those of middling faculties,

original: 'di ltar nyan thos chen po dang rang sangs rgyas dang sangs rgyas rnams chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba'i rigs can yin yang dbang po mi mtshungs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar nyan thos chen po dang rang sangs rgyas dang sangs rgyas rnams chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba'i rigs can yin yang dbang po mi mtshungs pa bzhin no //
translated: because the great sravakas, pratyekabuddhas and buddhas are of the same type as those who follow the teaching but their faculties are not the same.

original: 'o na lam rnams su 'bring po ci'i phyir ma smos she na /
analyzed: 'o na lam rnams su 'bring po ci'i phyir ma smos she na /
translated: Why are those of middling faculties not mentioned in the paths?

original: mngon par mi gsal ba yin te /
analyzed: mngon par mi gsal ba yin te /
translated: They are not clearly mentioned.

original: 'jig rten na yang mchog dang tha ma dag gi chos kho na'i don rab tu gsal ba yin gyi 'bring po ni ma yin pa bzhin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten na yang mchog dang tha ma dag gi chos kho na'i don rab tu gsal ba yin gyi 'bring po ni ma yin pa bzhin no zhes zer ro //
translated: In the world, it is only the superior and inferior dharmas that are clearly understood, not the middling ones.

original: 'dis lam rnam pa gnyis so sor bshad do //
analyzed: 'dis lam rnam pa gnyis so sor bshad do //
translated: This explains the two kinds of paths separately.

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi ni lus dang tshor ba dang sems dang chos dran pa nye bar gzhag go //üîΩyang dag par spong ba bzhi zhes bya ba ni sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos skyes pa rnams spang ba'i phyir zhes bya ba dang / ma skyes pa rnams mi skye ba'i phyir zhes bya ba dang / dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa rnams bskyed pa'i phyir zhes bya ba dang /
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi ni lus dang tshor ba dang sems dang chos dran pa nye bar gzhag go // yang dag par spong ba bzhi zhes bya ba ni sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos skyes pa rnams spang ba'i phyir zhes bya ba dang / ma skyes pa rnams mi skye ba'i phyir zhes bya ba dang / dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa rnams bskyed pa'i phyir zhes bya ba dang /
translated: The four foundations of mindfulness are mindfulness of the body, of sensation, of thought, and of the factors.

original: dge ba'i chos skyes pa rnams gnas pa dang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dge ba'i chos skyes pa rnams gnas pa dang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The four right efforts are: in order to abandon the bad, unwholesome dharmas that have already arisen; in order to prevent the bad, unwholesome dharmas that have not yet arisen from arising; in order to produce the wholesome dharmas that have not yet arisen; in order to make the wholesome dharmas that have already arisen remain, grow, and increase.

original: rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi zhes bya ba 'dun pa'i ting nge 'dzin spong ba'i 'du byed dang ldan pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi ting nge 'dzin dang sems kyi ting nge 'dzin dang / spyod pa'i ting nge 'dzin spong pa'i 'du byed dang ldan pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams so //
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi zhes bya ba 'dun pa'i ting nge 'dzin spong ba'i 'du byed dang ldan pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi ting nge 'dzin dang sems kyi ting nge 'dzin dang / spyod pa'i ting nge 'dzin spong pa'i 'du byed dang ldan pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams so //
translated: the base of supernatural power that is achieved by the concentration of energy, the concentration of mind, and the concentration of investigation and the formative force of abandonment.

original: 'dun pa'i bdag po'i rkyen las skyes pa'i ting nge 'dzin ni 'dun pa'i ting nge 'dzin te /
analyzed: 'dun pa'i bdag po'i rkyen las skyes pa'i ting nge 'dzin ni 'dun pa'i ting nge 'dzin te /
translated: The concentration that arises from the condition of the predominance of aspiration is the concentration of aspiration.

original: de bzhin du brtson 'grus dang sems dad spyod pa'i ting nge 'dzin rnams la yang brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du brtson 'grus dang sems dad spyod pa'i ting nge 'dzin rnams la yang brjod par bya'o //
translated: The same should be said of energy, mind, and investigation.

original: 'dun pa dang rtsol ba dang dad pa dang shin tu sbyangs pa dang dran pa dang shes bzhin dang sems pa ste /
analyzed: 'dun pa dang rtsol ba dang dad pa dang shin tu sbyangs pa dang dran pa dang shes bzhin dang sems pa ste /
translated: Aspiration, striving, faith, tranquility, mindfulness, full awareness, and volition.

translated: The foot of supernatural power is the cause of supernatural power.üîΩThe five faculties are the faculties of faith, vigor, mindfulness, meditative concentration, and wisdom.

translated: By the distinction of persons means the ≈õrƒÅvaka, pratyekabuddha, and perfect buddha. For that very reason, it says the enlightenment of the ≈õrƒÅvakas and so on.

analyzed: gzhan yang de gnyis kyis rang gi don zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /

translated: The branches of morality are right speech, right action and right livelihood. They are posited as one substance since they are not differentiated as having the nature of nonindicative form.

original: rdzas gcig go //
analyzed: rdzas gcig go //

original: sbyor ba las byung ba ni zag pa dang bcas pa dang zag pa med pa rnams te /
analyzed: sbyor ba las byung ba ni zag pa dang bcas pa dang zag pa med pa rnams te /

original: thos pa dang bsam pa dang bsgom pa las byung ba ci rigs par dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams so //
analyzed: thos pa dang bsam pa dang bsgom pa las byung ba ci rigs par dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams so //

analyzed: sbyor ba las byung ba smos pa ni skye bas thob pa'i dad pa la sogs pa las khyad par du bya ba'i phyir ro //

analyzed: de bzhin du yang dag par spong ba dang rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams la yang brjod par bya'o //

original: rab tu 'jog pa zhes bya ba ni rab tu 'byin par byed pa dang 'dzin pa dang / res 'ga' 'jug pa dang res 'ga' nges par 'byed pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /

original: de rab tu gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de rab tu gnas pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: de ni yon tan thams cad 'byor pa'i rten yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni gzhi yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //

analyzed: ting nge 'dzin la rag las pas yon tan rnams 'byor par byed pa yin no //

original: bye brag tu smra ba gang dag 'dis 'byor par byed pa rdzu 'phrul ni ting nge 'dzin kho na yin no zhes zer ba de dag gi ltar na /
analyzed: bye brag tu smra ba gang dag 'dis 'byor par byed pa rdzu 'phrul ni ting nge 'dzin kho na yin no zhes zer ba de dag gi ltar na /
translated: Vaibhasikas say that the bases of supernatural power are concentration alone, since they are the bases of supernatural power.üîΩSince it is the basis of effort, it is included in the four perfect abandonments.üîΩSince it is the basis of analysis, it is included in the four establishments of mindfulness.üîΩSince it is the basis of aspiration and intention, it is included in the seven branches of enlightenment.üîΩSince it is the basis of mindfulness, it is included in the eightfold noble path.üîΩSince it is the basis of concentration, it is included in the four meditative attainments.üîΩSince it is the basis of wisdom, it is included in the four establishments of mindfulness.

translated: Since it is the basis of wisdom, it is included in the four establishments of mindfulness.üîΩSince it is the basis of effort, it is included in the four perfect abandonments.üîΩSince it is the basis of analysis, it is included in the seven branches of enlightenment.üîΩSince it is the basis of mindfulness, it is included in the eightfold noble path.üîΩSince it is the basis of concentration, it is included in the four meditative attainments.

analyzed: gang gi phyir yongs su mi nyams pa bzod pas bsdus pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams kyis rtse mo la 'jug ste /

analyzed: rtse mo la ni rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams rnam par gzhag go //

analyzed: de'i phyir mthong ba'i lam nas bzung nas lam gyi yan lag dag yod do zhes bya bar shes so //
translated: Therefore, it is understood that the factors of the path exist beginning from the path of seeing.

original: de ltar 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad bsgom pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa de'i phyir mthong lam nas brtsams te bsgom pa'i lam la lam yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro zhes bya bar shes so //
analyzed: de ltar 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad bsgom pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa de'i phyir mthong lam nas brtsams te bsgom pa'i lam la lam yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro zhes bya bar shes so //
translated: Thus, the cultivation of the eightfold noble path becomes complete. Therefore, it is understood that the cultivation of the path becomes complete on the path of cultivation beginning from the path of seeing.

original: de ltar yin na mthong ba dang bsgom pa'i lam gnyis ka la yang lam gyi yan lag yod par 'gyur ro //üîΩyang dge slong zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: de ltar yin na mthong ba dang bsgom pa'i lam gnyis ka la yang lam gyi yan lag yod par 'gyur ro // yang dge slong zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: If that is so, then both the path of insight and the path of cultivation would have the members of the path.üîΩThe Fortunate One said: ‚ÄúMonks, the noble path of the eight members is the way to abandon the three lower realms, the way to attain the three types of liberation, the way to attain the three types of superknowledge, the way to attain the three types of clear knowledge, the way to attain the four discriminations, the way to attain the four fearlessnesses, the way to attain the four unhindered knowledges, the way to attain the five eyes, the way to attain the six higher faculties, the way to attain the seven factors of enlightenment, the way to attain the eight members of the noble path, the way to attain the nine serial absorptions, the way to attain the ten powers of the TathƒÅgata.üîΩBy this passage, the Fortunate One teaches that the noble path is the way to attain all the qualities of the Buddha.

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi'i tshig bla dgas yin no zhes bya ba 'dis ni mthong ba'i lam bstan to //üîΩji ltar rtogs pa'i lam gyis 'jug ces bya ba ni bsgom pa'i lam gyis ji ltar rtogs pa ste /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi'i tshig bla dgas yin no zhes bya ba 'dis ni mthong ba'i lam bstan to // ji ltar rtogs pa'i lam gyis 'jug ces bya ba ni bsgom pa'i lam gyis ji ltar rtogs pa ste /
translated: By the expression ‚Äúthe noble eightfold path,‚Äù he teaches the path of insight, for the noble path is the path of insight.üîΩBy the expression ‚Äúthe way to attain the seven factors of enlightenment,‚Äù he teaches the path of cultivation, for the path of cultivation is the path of the seven factors of enlightenment.

original: ji ltar thob pa'i lam gyis zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //üîΩ'jug ces bya ba ni byang chub kyi bar du nges par 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: ji ltar thob pa'i lam gyis zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // 'jug ces bya ba ni byang chub kyi bar du nges par 'byung ba'o //
translated: By the expression ‚Äúthe way to attain the ten powers of the TathƒÅgata,‚Äù he teaches the path of insight and the path of cultivation, for the ten powers of the TathƒÅgata are attained by the path of insight and the path of cultivation.

original: de lta bas na gnyi ga la 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad par 'dod par bya dgos so //
analyzed: de lta bas na gnyi ga la 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad par 'dod par bya dgos so //
translated: Thus, it is necessary to accept that both the path of insight and the path of cultivation have the eight members of the noble path.

original: byang chub yan lag lam yan lag / zag pa med ces bya ba la //üîΩzag pa med pa kho na yin gyi /
analyzed: byang chub yan lag lam yan lag / zag pa med ces bya ba la // zag pa med pa kho na yin gyi /
translated: The members of enlightenment and the members of the path are uncontaminated.üîΩThey are only uncontaminated.

original: de dag kho na zag pa med pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de dag kho na zag pa med pa ni ma yin te /
translated: They are not only uncontaminated.

original: de gnyis bsgom pa dang mthong ba'i lam la rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir la /
analyzed: de gnyis bsgom pa dang mthong ba'i lam la rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir la /
translated: because they are established as the path of meditation and the path of seeing,

original: srid pa'i rtse mo'i gnyen po yin pas bsgom pa'i lam la byang chub kyi yan lag rnams rnam par gzhag @276a * //
analyzed: srid pa'i rtse mo'i gnyen po yin pas bsgom pa'i lam la byang chub kyi yan lag rnams rnam par gzhag @276a * //

original: pa'i phyir zag pa med pa nyid do //
analyzed: pa'i phyir zag pa med pa nyid do //

original: de nyid kyi phyir thams cad byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa yin bzhin du de dag kho na la byang chub kyi yan lag ces bya'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir thams cad byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa yin bzhin du de dag kho na la byang chub kyi yan lag ces bya'o //

original: lam gyi yan lag rnams ni mthong ba'i lam rnam par gzhag ste /
analyzed: lam gyi yan lag rnams ni mthong ba'i lam rnam par gzhag ste /
translated: The limbs of the path are established as the path of seeing,

original: mthong lam gcig tu zag pa med pa yin pa'i phyir de rnams kyang zag pa med pa nyid do //
analyzed: mthong lam gcig tu zag pa med pa yin pa'i phyir de rnams kyang zag pa med pa nyid do //
translated: and because the path of seeing is exclusively uncontaminated, they are also uncontaminated.

original: 'jig rten pa'i yang dag pa'i lta ba la sogs pa yang yod pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i yang dag pa'i lta ba la sogs pa yang yod pa ma yin nam /
translated: Don't mundane correct view and so on also exist?

original: ji ltar zag pa med pa rnams kho na lam gyi yan lag ces bya zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zag pa med pa rnams kho na lam gyi yan lag ces bya zhe na /
translated: Why are only the uncontaminated called limbs of the path?

original: yod pa bden mod kyi de dag ni 'phags pa'i lam zhes bya ba'i sgra mi 'thob ste /
analyzed: yod pa bden mod kyi de dag ni 'phags pa'i lam zhes bya ba'i sgra mi 'thob ste /

translated: Because they are the origin of the increase of the defilements, it is not possible that they are members of the path.üîΩOthers are both with and without outflows.

original: byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun par gzhan dag ni zag pa dang bcas pa dang zag pa med pa dag yin no zhes bya ba ni dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la sogs pa stobs la thug pa rnams te /
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun par gzhan dag ni zag pa dang bcas pa dang zag pa med pa dag yin no zhes bya ba ni dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la sogs pa stobs la thug pa rnams te /
translated: The members of enlightenment are the seven members of enlightenment, beginning with mindfulness.

original: mthong ba dang bsgom pa dang mi slob pa'i lam gyis bsdus pa dag ni zag pa med pa'o //üîΩder bden pa so so la dmigs pa'i shes rab chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa ma 'ongs pa bzhis 'thob bo //
analyzed: mthong ba dang bsgom pa dang mi slob pa'i lam gyis bsdus pa dag ni zag pa med pa'o // der bden pa so so la dmigs pa'i shes rab chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa ma 'ongs pa bzhis 'thob bo //

analyzed: dgos pa rnam pa bzhi bsgrub pa'i phyir brtson 'grus yang dag par spong ba rnams so //
translated: The members of enlightenment are only without outflows, because they are the antidote of the three realms.üîΩThe members of the path are either with or without outflows, because they are the antidote of the realm of desire.üîΩThe members of enlightenment are only supramundane, because they are the antidote of the three realms.üîΩThe members of the path are either mundane or supramundane, because they are the antidote of the realm of desire.

analyzed: yang dag par 'byor pa la brten pa'i don gyis bden pa so so la dmigs pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams so //
translated: The bases of psychic power are focused on the individual truths in the sense of being based on the correct acquisition of concentration.

analyzed: dbang thob pa'i phyir dad pa la sogs pa'i dbang po rnams so //

analyzed: de nyid nyon mongs pas mi brdzi ba'i don gyis stobs rnams so ;
translated: The powers are based on the non-subversion by the adversaries of faith, etc.

original: / chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'i shes rab de ni 'di'i yang chos dag pa'i lta ba'o //
analyzed: / chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'i shes rab de ni 'di'i yang chos dag pa'i lta ba'o //

analyzed: de bzhin du yang dag par spong ba la sogs pa rnams la yang ji ltar rigs par brjod par bya ste /

original: rdzas gcig nyid khyad par de dang des de lta de ltar brjod pa yin na zag pa dang bcas pa ni de las gzhan pa rnams so //
analyzed: rdzas gcig nyid khyad par de dang des de lta de ltar brjod pa yin na zag pa dang bcas pa ni de las gzhan pa rnams so //
translated: It is the same substance that is described in this way and that way by those distinctions. Those with outflows are the others.

original: bsam gtan dang po nas thams cad ces bya ba la /
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po nas thams cad ces bya ba la /
translated: The first absorption up to the fourth absorption are called ‚Äúwith investigation and analysis.‚Äù

analyzed: de ni dga' ba yang yod pa @276b rtogs pa dang bcas pa'i phyir yang dag pa'i rtogs pa yang yod do //

analyzed: nyer bsdogs rnams ni stobs kyis drang dgos pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la /

original: brtson 'grus chen pos mngon du byed pa bde blag tu thob pa'i sems dga' bar 'gyur ba yin te /
analyzed: brtson 'grus chen pos mngon du byed pa bde blag tu thob pa'i sems dga' bar 'gyur ba yin te /

analyzed: de'i phyir de rnams ni dga' ba med do //

analyzed: gzhan yang sa 'og ma'i dogs pa dang bcas pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni yongs su nyams par dogs pa dang bcas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //

original: gzhan dag na re 'dod chags dang ma bral ba thun mong pa'i sa de ni dbugs ma phyin pa'i sa yin pa'i phyir de mngon du gyur pa na dga' ba med do zhes zer ro //

analyzed: bsam gtan gnyis pa na ni rtogs pa med pa'i phyir yang dag pa'i rtog pa med do //

analyzed: rnam par rtog pa ni kun tu rtog pa ste dpyod pa ma yin no //

original: de'i phyir dpyod pa yod par yang /
analyzed: de'i phyir dpyod pa yod par yang /

original: bsam gtan bar na yang /üîΩde gnyis nyid ma gtogs pa zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: bsam gtan bar na yang / de gnyis nyid ma gtogs pa zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: In the intermediate meditation, there is also investigation.üîΩIn the second and third meditations, there is no joy because there is no pleasure of joy.üîΩIn the fourth meditation, there is no pleasure of pleasure because there is no pleasure.üîΩIn the formless realm, there is no body or speech because there is no form.üîΩIn the formless realm, there is no correct speech, action, or livelihood because there is no form.üîΩIn the formless realm, there is no mindfulness and clear knowledge because there is no mindfulness and clear knowledge of form, sound, and tangible objects.üîΩIn the formless realm, there is no correct mindfulness because there is no mindfulness of form, sound, and tangible objects.üîΩIn the formless realm, there is no correct effort because there is no effort to abandon nonvirtue and to cultivate virtue.üîΩIn the formless realm, there is no correct concentration because there is no concentration associated with the formless realm.üîΩIn the formless realm, there is no correct liberation because there is no liberation associated with the formless realm.üîΩIn the formless realm, there is no correct knowledge because there is no knowledge associated with the formless realm.üîΩIn the formless realm, there is no correct liberation because there is no liberation associated with the formless realm.

analyzed: de gnyis na zag pa med pa'i lam med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la 'dod pa'i khams dang srid pa'i rtse mo dag na ni go rims bzhin du mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i phyir dang mi gsal ba'i phyir zag pa med pa'i lam med do //
translated: In the formless realm, there is no correct liberation because there is no liberation associated with the formless realm.üîΩIn the formless realm, there is no correct knowledge because there is no knowledge associated with the formless realm.üîΩIn the formless realm, there is no correct liberation because there is no liberation associated with the formless realm.üîΩIn the formless realm, there is no correct liberation because there is no liberation associated with the formless realm.üîΩIn the formless realm, there is no correct knowledge because there is no knowledge associated with the formless realm.üîΩIn the formless realm, there is no correct liberation because there is no liberation associated with the formless realm.üîΩIn the formless realm, there is no

original: gzhan dag na re srid pa'i rtsa ba de yin pa'i phyir de dag na zag pa med pa'i lam med do zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re srid pa'i rtsa ba de yin pa'i phyir de dag na zag pa med pa'i lam med do zhes zer ro //
translated: Others say: The pure path does not exist there because it is the root of existence.

original: sa gang la byang chub kyi phyogs ji snyed ce na /
analyzed: sa gang la byang chub kyi phyogs ji snyed ce na /

original: skad cig gcig la thams cad mngon du byed do //
analyzed: skad cig gcig la thams cad mngon du byed do //
translated: All are manifested in one moment.

analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa gsum ni de dag la dmigs pa yongs su chad pa'i phyir mngon du gyur pas na bzhi po gang yang rung ba mngon du 'gyur ro //

original: shes rab gnyis kyi rdzas dus gcig tu mngon du gyur pas sems ci'i phyir byang chub kyi phyogs ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: shes rab gnyis kyi rdzas dus gcig tu mngon du gyur pas sems ci'i phyir byang chub kyi phyogs ma yin zhe na /
translated: Why is mind not a factor of enlightenment, since the two wisdoms manifest simultaneously?

analyzed: de ni kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang bas rab tu phye ba'i phyir / rnam par byang ba'i phyogs kho na byang chub kyi phyogs yin gyi /
translated: Because it is distinguished by affliction and purification.üîΩPurification is a factor of enlightenment.

analyzed: tshul khrims nyid rab tu dang ba yin pa ni tshul khrims dang ba ste / de yang zag pa med pa'i tshul khrims /

analyzed: sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung dang 'gog pa mngon par rtogs na zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ngo //
translated: If one realizes the truths of suffering, origin, and cessation,

analyzed: 'di na sems can med do snyam du yid ches pa gang yin pa de ni chos la shes nas dad pa'o //

original: shes nas dad pa thob pa'o //

original: de bzhin du kun 'byung mngon par rtogs pa'i sgo nas gnyis nyid thob po //
analyzed: de bzhin du kun 'byung mngon par rtogs pa'i sgo nas gnyis nyid thob po //

analyzed: de bzhin du 'gog pa mngon par rtogs pa'i sgo nas de nyid du gnyis thob ste /

original: chos la dad pa de nyid 'gog pa'i don gang yin pa la mngon par yid ches te /
analyzed: chos la dad pa de nyid 'gog pa'i don gang yin pa la mngon par yid ches te /
translated: The faith that derives from understanding the teaching is the conviction that the meaning of cessation is the same as the teaching.

original: snga ma bzhin du zag pa med pa'i tshul khrims 'thob po //
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du zag pa med pa'i tshul khrims 'thob po //
translated: As before, one obtains the pure morality that is free from the outflows.

original: lam gyi bden pa mngon par rtogs na zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: lam gyi bden pa mngon par rtogs na zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: When one realizes the truth of the path, one has faith in the Dharma,

analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i rgyu can mi slob pa'i chos kyi yul la dad pa ste dad pa ni shes nas dad pa'o //

original: slob pa'i rgyud can ni slob pa dang mi slob pa'i chos kyi yul te /
analyzed: slob pa'i rgyud can ni slob pa dang mi slob pa'i chos kyi yul te /
translated: Faith in the object of the Dharma of the learner and non-learner,üîΩwhich is the cause of the learner's continuum.

original: dge 'dun la shes nas dad pa'i don gyis mngon par yid ches pa'o //
analyzed: dge 'dun la shes nas dad pa'i don gyis mngon par yid ches pa'o //
translated: It is full confidence through the meaning of faith in the Sangha.

original: des ni sangs rgyas su byed pa'i phyir dang dge 'dun du byed pa'i phyir sangs rgyas dang dge 'dun zhes bya'o //
analyzed: des ni sangs rgyas su byed pa'i phyir dang dge 'dun du byed pa'i phyir sangs rgyas dang dge 'dun zhes bya'o //
translated: Because of that, it is called the Buddha and Sangha, because it makes the Buddha and makes the Sangha.

original: de dag la dad pa gang yin pa ni sangs rgyas dang dge 'dun la dad pa'o //
analyzed: de dag la dad pa gang yin pa ni sangs rgyas dang dge 'dun la dad pa'o //
translated: Faith in those is faith in the Buddha and Sangha.

original: dge ba la sogs pa chos mang du bshad la /
analyzed: dge ba la sogs pa chos mang du bshad la /
translated: Many dharmas such as virtue are explained.

original: skyabs su 'gro ba dag tu ni mya ngan las 'das pa kho na chos su bshad pas the tshom zos pas /
analyzed: skyabs su 'gro ba dag tu ni mya ngan las 'das pa kho na chos su bshad pas the tshom zos pas /
translated: But in the goings for refuge, only nirvana is explained as the Dharma. Therefore, doubt arises.

original: 'dir gang la chos su dgongs pa yin zhes dris so //
analyzed: 'dir gang la chos su dgongs pa yin zhes dris so //
translated: Here, it is asked, In what is the Dharma intended?

original: @277b chos bden gsum dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: @277b chos bden gsum dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The Dharma is the three truths, etc.

original: 'dir shes nas dad pa rnams ni dad pa'i rang bzhin yin pa nyid kyis yid ches pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i chos gang dag yid ches pas sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung dag 'gog pa dag kho na chos yin par shes pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir shes nas dad pa rnams ni dad pa'i rang bzhin yin pa nyid kyis yid ches pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i chos gang dag yid ches pas sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung dag 'gog pa dag kho na chos yin par shes pa'o //
translated: Here, those who have faith through knowledge have the nature of faith, and thus have the nature of conviction. Therefore, they know the Dharma of suffering, etc., as it is, through conviction. They know that the truths of suffering and origin are the Dharma, and that the truths of cessation and path are the Dharma.

original: rang sangs rgyas byang chub sems dpa'i lam yin no zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas byang chub sems dpa'i lam yin no zhes bya ba la /
translated: The path of the pratyekabuddha and bodhisattva is the Dharma.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa'i lam ni slob pa'o //
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa'i lam ni slob pa'o //
translated: The path of the bodhisattva is training.

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi lam ni slob pa dang mi slob pa ste /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi lam ni slob pa dang mi slob pa ste /
translated: The path of the pratyekabuddha is both training and post-training.

original: de'i yul la dad pas lam mngon par rtogs pa na chos la shes nas dad pa zhes bya'o ;
analyzed: de'i yul la dad pas lam mngon par rtogs pa na chos la shes nas dad pa zhes bya'o ;
translated: When one realizes the path through faith in that object, it is called faith through knowledge of the Dharma.

original: / de'i phyir bden pa bzhi char yang mngon par rtogs pa'i sgo nas chos la shes nas dad pa 'thob pa'o //
analyzed: / de'i phyir bden pa bzhi char yang mngon par rtogs pa'i sgo nas chos la shes nas dad pa 'thob pa'o //
translated: Therefore, one obtains faith through knowledge of the Dharma by realizing the four truths.

original: dkon mchog gsum 'tshol ba'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' dang rang sangs rgyas kyi lam dag kho na chos su bshad kyi /
analyzed: dkon mchog gsum 'tshol ba'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' dang rang sangs rgyas kyi lam dag kho na chos su bshad kyi /
translated: The path of the Bodhisattva and the path of the Solitary Buddhas are taught as the Dharma, because they seek the Three Jewels.

original: cig shos sangs rgyas dang dge 'dun ni ma yin no ;
analyzed: cig shos sangs rgyas dang dge 'dun ni ma yin no ;
translated: The other two Jewels are not the Dharma.

original: / yang ci lam mngon par rtogs pa na gsum la shes nas dad pa 'dzin par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: / yang ci lam mngon par rtogs pa na gsum la shes nas dad pa 'dzin par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: When one realizes the path, does one then acquire faith through knowledge with regard to the Three Jewels?

original: de'i tshe lam gyi yul thams cad gcig pa nyid kyi phyir 'dren pa la dmigs pas chos la shes nas dad par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de'i tshe lam gyi yul thams cad gcig pa nyid kyi phyir 'dren pa la dmigs pas chos la shes nas dad par blta bar bya'o //
translated: At that time, one should see that one has faith through knowledge with regard to the Dharma, because one has the same object as the Leader.

original: de mngon du gyur pa nyid kyis ma 'ongs pa'i dad pa'i skad cig mang po 'thob po //
analyzed: de mngon du gyur pa nyid kyis ma 'ongs pa'i dad pa'i skad cig mang po 'thob po //
translated: By the very fact that one realizes the path, one acquires many moments of future faith.

original: de dag la kha cig sangs rgyas la sogs pa la nges par dmigs pa yang yod /
analyzed: de dag la kha cig sangs rgyas la sogs pa la nges par dmigs pa yang yod /
translated: Some of these moments of faith have the Buddha, etc. as their object,

original: mtha' dag la dmigs pa yang yod pas /üîΩgang nges par dmigs pa de ni gsum la shes nas dad pa yin la /
analyzed: mtha' dag la dmigs pa yang yod pas / gang nges par dmigs pa de ni gsum la shes nas dad pa yin la /
translated: and some have all three as their object.üîΩThose that have the Buddha, etc. as their object are faith through knowledge with regard to the Three Jewels.

original: gang mtha' dag la dmigs pa de ni chos la shes nas dad pa yin no //
analyzed: gang mtha' dag la dmigs pa de ni chos la shes nas dad pa yin no //
translated: Those that have all three as their object are faith through knowledge with regard to the Dharma.
